reviews.review: Amazing. It is always amazing to visit this temple. It is one of the monuments you must have visited during your life time

Movie Temple. While driving around the temples we stumbled upon this one back accident. It was not as crowded as the others. But once inside I recognized the temple from the film Tomb Raider. The temple is amazing and great places to take pictures with out people in the background. Inside the temple sits a monk who will help you make a wish and a offering for A donation. A must see!!!
#2 Temple, but #1 for us!. I actually thought this was as good an attraction as Angkor Wat was. We saw this temple first, and enjoyed it.
Great place. It's a beautiful place. Fun to walk around. Give it time to enjoy everything. Spectacular experience

Must visit. Main attraction of Angkor Thom are south gate, Bayon Temple, Baphuon, Phimeanakas and Terrace of the Elephants. This route require more than everage stamina and risky to complete. The price of foods stall here are high end of town area restaurant.

SSHHH. I think this was better than Angkor Wat. This is another amazing place to visit. The walk in is amazing and I think it is better. Get a guide who will explain the history so you can better understand it all.

Beautiful!. Surprisingly, I enjoyed Angkor Thom perhaps a little more than Angkor Wat! The Buddha's faces were gorgeous and made for some great pictures. The age and scope of this wat is unforgettable. Would definitely recommend!

Magnificient. Breathtaking seriously. Get there now. Bring a hat, comfortable shoes, clothing that you are comfortable sweating in, and your camera of course. Maybe apply mosquito reppelent. If you are wearing shorts, bring a sarong or pareo. Wear a tshirt with sleeves.Bring something to wipe off your sweat (so you can look decent in the photos). Enjoy
Must see. Must see atraction in Siem Reap. To avoid the crowds go early. You will get nice views and good pictures. After 10 o'clock to hot to go there and to many tourists.Recommended.
One of the reasons you go to Siem Reap. It was my second time here as a tourist. The sites are amazing. What it would have been like to see them at their height !!
Different again. Each of the temples was lovely to explore but it may be worthwhile doing it over a few days so that they don't all blend into one.

Part of temple circuit . Laura Croft Tom reader site
Need I say more
Easy awesome not to be missed
All part of the park admission
Loved Angkor Thom. Great place to visit. Easy walk to the main site. A beautiful old temple and artwork. Second only to Angkor Wat.

Another fascinating complex..... No matter where you go within angkor wat complex...there are always new things to see
Angkor Thom is no different.
The carvings and sculptures are magnificent....

Review of Angkor Thom's Gate. Anghor Thom literally means 'Great City' and was the last of the Khmer's majestic capitals.This review concerns the impressive entrance gate to the City. Sharing the serene and beautifully carved faces of Bayon, the gate rises above alongside the moat and provides a narrow entrance beyond.The well preserved 50mm bridge as you approach has stone figures of the Hindu story; The myth of the churning of the ocean'. The guardian gods on the left pull the head of the snake while the demon gods on the right pull it's tail in the opposing direction. Some of the heads have been 'recently' and faithfully added, our guide telling us that they were stolen by Vietnamese 40 years ago or more.

Beautiful. Visited here last week and on arrival it began to rain heavily (an umbrella is highly advisable). The site has both beautiful architecture and highly visible artwork that provide wonderful photo opportunities.The temple area that allows you to release all negativity from your body through beating your chest is a real highlight (your chest beats echo through the building).Again, a guide would be advisable to provide a deep history of the site.

Breath-taking. One of numerous temples in Siem Reap. Each temple is unique and leaves one just how these were constructed centuries ago. The carving, history as well as the restoration efforts by both foreign and Cambodian Government is exceptional.A must see.
A cant choose what i liked best. Like all the other temples. Each offers its own excitement.I think i loved Byon the most. But dont miss any of it.

Do it!! . Seeing temples is mandatory in Cambodia. They can be very crowded with tourist buses, yelling children, and rude people. But do not let this deter you!Anyone can walk down the middle of Angkor Thom with the masses and get caught up with selfie sticks, group photos, and disrespectful tourists. If you can handle this, go for it. My wife and I chose to walk the dirt paths around the extomerior portions, entering the locations we wanted, and gathering the beauty of the entire grounds. I would also HIGHLY recommend going to the national museum before hand to gather the history of the temples and be your own tour guide :-)
Best of them all. Much cooler and much less crowded this temple is absolutely beautiful and much better to navigate around then the other two but avoid the hagglers

This place was bigger than I thought. . Was a lot bigger than I originally thought it was, the whole area is dotted with temples and old structure's. Well worth putting aside a few hours to walk around the site so you can get a good grasp of how big it actually is, felt like it'd never end sometimes! There are quite a few good spots for grabbing some great photo's around the area as well.

Another great piece of history and architecture. . Visiting this temple was another amazing experience for us. Locals are so friendly and our guide was extremely knowledgeable about its history. I'm so glad I visited this beautiful place. Got to say some quiet prayers and found some peace just being there... it's a must and I would suggest to anyone visiting Seam Reap

Beautiful structures . Angkor Thom is a massive area with lots of Temples and structures within it. I would recommend you have a car or a tuk tuk with you for at least half day to cover the Temples just in Angkor Thom. Places that you should see in Angkor Thom area the gates, bayon, elephant terrace, baphuon and phimeanakas. There are more structures you can see but these are the main ones. Please be advised Baphuon there is some steep climbing with steps. For those interested you can also get elephant ride for the main gate of Angkor Thom to Bayon.
Temple trips a must. You'll be blown away by the temples and their history. Go and enjoy this activity.Cover up - shoulders and knees must be covered.

A wonderful start to our tour!. We did the small circuit and this was an impressive start to a memorable day. Spend the extra $ and take a guide who will explain the history and carvings to you. Don't forget hats, sunscreen and water as a fair bit of walking in the heat involved.
Nice temple with trees on top. Lots of old stones where trees growing on top. Impressive to see and definitely worth a stop and for making some pictures.
My favorite . I enjoyed this temple the most; the carvings were super cool and I was able to climb (on marked paths) all over the place. It was fun to get up close and personal with the place.
Astonishing!. Really beautiful place! The face of Buddha is placed in each side of the towers. There are beautiful carvings in the walls at the entrance. Ticket is the same for Angkor complex.
My favourite. So much quieter, I thought a better looking building more like what you see on all the photos depicting Angkor Wat. It was a pleasure to see

While in Cambodia.... While in Cambodia, you'd be doing yourself a disservice by not visiting Angkor - and various temples within the greater Archaeological Park. Much like the Great Pyramids of Egypt, Angkor provides a look in to the ancient history of the region - and one cannot help but marvel at the engineering feats before them and contemplate the greater significance of the sites.Angkor Thom is another impressive temple within the archaeological park that I'd recommend visiting, if you have the time. If you are short of time, a few quick photos will suffice.
Sightseeing. Another beautiful historic and religious place that is quite well preserved and being restored methodically. Would recommend to anybody.

Angkor Tom. This temple was so fascinating because each carving tells a story about someone living there at that period of time. We had a local guide by the name of Leap Lam and he made all the difference in the world. He was worth his weight in gold.

Palatial grounds missing the Palace, but let your imagination go. Nice to see but the authorities could do so much more with this. There are many parts to the grounds, just stay long enough to stroll through the main ones

Famous faces. On many tourguide books you find picture of the faces og Angkor Thom.
If you have the chance to be a little later in the day there, take it - the light will give your pictures some special colours!
Hundreds of Smiles. The smiling faces that look out in all directions are each unique. You should look at them and pick out your favorite.

Amazing. I am so very glad i was able to hire Angkor Visitor (Praim hear) for my personal guide. I would have missed most of the fascinating details of this intricate world heritage site. Very worth seeig and ecperiencing.

Rub noses with the Buddha. Another part of the archeological park. Beautiful, interesting sculptures. At one point you can rub noses with the Buddha and find a corner to take a picture with a Hindu deity.
Amazing. A truly amazing place. A must see if in Cambodia. A very affordable attraction to visit. Highly recommended.
Wonderful place. Wondering how many Buddha face here. Would be nice to take some funny photo shot here. Advise to go in the morning due to the facing of the sun in order to have a good picture
Very interesting. actually liked this place better than Angor Wat. The trees growing through and around the temple are amazing.
Angkor Thom or Bayon temple. The best place you can't skip. It's a amazing time you can enjoy with your family,friends or sweetheart. Highly recommended!
Beautiful. Very peaceful. Had a fantastic time walking around the temples, Theara ,our guide gave us a good tour, and made it fun. Took lots of good photos.

A great place to start. You'll have your camera out before you even get through the gate. The architecture is jaw dropping, especially in the wet season (June to October) when the stones are draped in moss. Thom is home to the Bayon and a host of smaller temples, all well worth seeing. It's perhaps best to start with Thom and it's surrounding temples and leave Angkor Wat til last. That way you appreciate the scope and scale of It on a whole other level.

A whole lot of history . Angkor Thom is beautiful. There is a lot to see and the history that surrounds the temples is interesting. I would recommend either getting a tour guide or reading up on the history before you visit. There are lots of photo opportunities. Dont forget to go with your shoulders and knees covered as a sign of respect as this is a religious site.
Smiling Buddhas. this is the home of the smiling Buddhas, amazing monument, you are able to climb up quite high to see the smiling buddhas and wonder how on earth they built this place.
Very difference from Angkor Wat. Lots of steps but worth the climb. See ancient carvings and statues close up. A wonderful experience
Temples tepmples . A very good site to visit. Lots of cravings. Lots of different history. Plenty to see. Take lots of water.
Many temples. Not like Angkor Wat, Angkor Thom was a complex of temples. There were so many, big and small temples. We had to climb many ancient stone stairs. Most of them was so steep.

A must Visit Angkor Thom etc. the whole complex of Angkor Watt, Thom etc are worth visiting - why else would you go to Sien Reaps. Spend at least a few days to visit them. We had a conducted tour for one day, then went back and explored by ourselves. It's helpful to have some some reading/reseach before you go, then you have knowledge about the sites before you arrive.

Too big for just 1 day. Angkor Thom, according to my guide boasts of 200 structures!You could spend weeks in here and still not see everything!Great place to just wander around!Tip: Go to the North Gate for good pics and less tourists
A must see. Any tour includes the Angkor Thom. Again an amaizing place, one of the best temples to see. Breathtaking!
Fantastic. Great food, wonderful entertainment! The dancing was exquisite - a feast on the eyes and senses. Xxx
Part of Angkor Wat temple area. Personally this is the best temple of this complex and must be visited. Not too over repaired and feels `real`

Just stunning!. All of the temples at the Angkor Wat "complex" are amazing - and it's impossible not to be in awe of them. Some are beautiful because of the craftsmanship, or the carving or how nature has embedded itself within the walls. Some are simply beautiful tributes to family, and others are remains of grandiose homages to deities...all of the temples in this re are worth visiting...all you need is time!

The other must visit. I love the ruins and history of this place. It was very crowded during the morning we went and it is during the off peak season! Gotta prepare yourself for the uneven surfaces and the other tourists!
Super. Enjoyed a few hours at this sight - wonderful statues and murals and elephant terrace - combined it with a visit to Ta Prohm arriving by Tuk Tuk
Beautiful temple with sculpture of smiling faces. The place is easy to walk as flat area. Bayon Temple is interesting.You just have to imagine what happened here many centuries ago.
Beautiful grounds, ruin temple. Beautiful surroundings but the temple is just barely better than a pile of stones. Of course you will visit as you paid $20 for the privilege, but it's not worth it.

Gorgeous. Gorgeous entrance into Bayon city temple!!! Beautiful entrance with tug of war depicted between the Gods on the left and the demons on the right. Get a great guide to make your experience memorable, we had amazing experience with Happy Angkor Tours!!!! Ask for Mr. Bun!

Walled city. Not a temple but an entire walled city of 9sq km that served as the ancient royal capital of the Khmer Empire from approx 1181. With an estimated population of 1 million, it was far bigger and grander than any European city at the time.

Amazing. What a pleasure to be able to walk around a building that is so old and just try to imagine what was going on so many years ago. You can get some amazing photos. Worth the visit. It was really humid when I was there so be prepared to pace yourself if you are not used to that sort of weather. Maybe take a 3day pass and allow longer time.

Smaller temple but still profound. We visited Angkor Thom in the afternoon and it found it wonderful - a smaller temple but very impressive. The face on the entrance is overpowering to scaring away any enemy.More faces inside make the 12 km trip well worthwhile.Rain almost spoiled it for us but we persisted and made it through.We plainly did not have the crowds at Angkor Wat - that was a joy. Thom plays a part in the drama of Angkor, a very senior part.

Wonderful!. Except for Angkor Wat, it is the second one you must visit. It is so large and has 8 small temples. Bayon and Bapoun is great. Terrace of Elephant is quite interesting. The view is peaceful and comfortable to take a sit anywhere.
unforgettable. again this temple will leave you speechless , its absolutely stunning and great place for photos etc and you will never forget it

Amazing sight in angkor. Angkor Thom which once stood at the ancient capitol is a must visit location in siem reap. Amazing grounds stunning sculptured and temples that take your breath away. A whole day here is a must. Hiking boots, hat, water, camera and take it in. Awesome

Enjoyed this place more than Angkor Wat. I like the different faces of the Buddhas.This temple is well worth the trip to see it. Smaller than Angkor Wat but more interesting and more to see. Tomb Raider was filmed there.
Great complex. Go with time. There is so much to see. We arrived at 05:00 and left only at 16:30! Have some breaks and look at the details. Unfortunately, as entire Angkor, a bit overcrowded.

It's the size and the moat that impress. Angkor Thom is a vast city consisting of many temples and gates and the elephant walk wall. How men could have dug such an expansive moat is impossible to comprehend. One is first impressed by the length of the ride from the city gate to the first temple. One cannot visit AW without visiting AT. If you had to pick one, it would be Thom.
The city of angkor in its glory.. This is the planned city of Angkor Thom and you need to walk a lot to cover the entire city. It is a must visit.

Better than Angkor Wat in my view. We enjoyed this site better than the more crowded Angkor Wat. There are many lovely shaded doorways which make for some interesting photo ops...and the four sided Buddha faces and carvings displaying the mythology of 900 years ago are worth the visit. It's necessary to have a guide take you through the site if you are to enjoy it. Park attendants clip the photo ID which you need to purchase in Order to visit any of these sites. The pass is $60 and is good for about 2 weeks. A sun hat, bug spray and sunscreen are essential. Many of us used umbrellas...

Stunning carvings / views from the top. Walking through Angkor Thom feels like walking back through time and alongside a very advanced civilisation.
Angkor Thom again offers different scenes than that of other temples and highlighted by the Buddha Faces of so many different types. Just in awe of this temple.

Wall of Elephants. Taking a walk through Angkor Thom and the surrounding grounds was our favorite. The Elephant Terrace was magnificant, the Terrace of the Leper King was grand and we found surprises around each corner. Takes a few hours to do it justice.

Magnificent. I went here yesterday and it was beautiful. Tbh, all the temples in Angkor Complex are magnificent. I did a DIY tour of the complex but if you want, you can hire a free lance tour guide which can be found in each temples. I advice you to explore angkor thom for more than an hour. The details which you can find on the wall is sophisticatedly done. There are a lot of stores outside the temple and they are relatively affordable. Put sun block cause the heat in Siem Reap is terrible.

An amazing collection of structures rivaling Angkor Wat. The Angkor Thom city ruins are a collection of different structures spread out in an area much larger than the Angkor Wat complex. If traveling in a tour group, you'll take your bus to most places around here, and passed off to tuktuks for smaller places. For independent travelers, you'll likely be brought here by your day-hire tuktuk driver.Nearly all tuktuk drivers will start you off at Angkor Wat first thing, but if you want to beat the crowds, you can opt to save Angkor Wat for last (you'll also be forgoing the sunrise). So start off at Angkor Thom in the morning, and you should be ahead of most independent groups for most of the day.Most likely, you'll be visiting other places in the Angkor complex on the same day. I'd strongly advise visitors to bring at least one spare battery, as there will be almost nowhere you can charge your equipment.

Must See on the Circuit - Bayon Temple is Part of Angkor Thom. I've done a seperate review of Bayon which is the key attraction of Angkor Thom.Angkor Thom also includes the Terrace of the Elephants and the causeway with the 'Churning Sea of Milk' tug of war. It is worth stopping to see these before making your way through Angkor Thom.Note there were a lot of wasps present when were there. We were fortunate not to be stung but they were quite clingy. It is easy to purchase a variety of food (such as fruit) and drinks in here. This is another area where there are lots of sellers. These women and children (mostly) are very persistent. Do not buy from the children who should be in school. They will nonetheless follow you around. If you do buy from the women, come to a fair price and be aware they start high and won't take no for an answer! You can easily purchase water, scarves, hats and various tourist tat such as pants, tops and postcards at the temples. Also on offer is lots of art - just be aware there are many mass produced items - but if you like the product and the price, wonderful.
FACES. Bring your camera, lots of great shots here. This site is always very busy so take your time and look around, don't be afraid to double back and look again.
The town that still remains. Most of the other sites in the area are temples, but this is the only town that still remains. Walls, 5 gates, Bayon, a royal palace, the towers, the elephant Terrace

Still amazing with a lot of crafts. A nice place for photography and the stones and rocks are all over the green grass and there are quite a number of temples (structure) some damage and some are still standing. Underneath a pagoda nearer the shops and parking, you will be led to walk in a "maze" full of wall sculptures with figures. Nice indeed!
Loved it!. The entire trip was magical & Angkor Thom was no exception. Very interesting & the people are so kind & friendly.
Look for the faces. Enjoyable walk around - do appreciate the faces in the various towers. Take water with you and good walking shoes.

Happy Temple. Angkor Thom is a temple with a lot of smiling faces. As far as I remember what our tour guide told us, this temple was built in different time of building Angkor Wat. The carvings are different from the other temples. We like this temple too :) This is a must go temple too.
My favorite part of Angkor Wat. Stunning. I could have spent all day in this part of Angkor. The giant heads are amazing and walking through the area charges you with energy.

So many temples - lots of variety. Many people think the temples all look the same, but they don't. I loved visiting each one and seeing the differences in architectural design, materials, and sculptures. Simply amazing!
Cambodian Holiday.. Amazing siteBetter than the movies or films.Imagine how hard it was to carve the [profiles not once but dozens of times.A really spectacular site
Just a temple :) But a fun one. I like this temple for getting some very good photos at the right time of the day. I do like going more evening time then morning for this one.

Day visit to the tples. We did an all day tour of all temples and didn't spend much time here, but it was sufficient. Quite frankly all the temples fade into obscurity after Ta Prohm!! But that is just my opinion.

Bigger (and better?) than Angkor Wat. Wow! Angkor Wat is a 5 star, but Angkor Thom is even more impressive. Both are a must see. Angkor Thom requires a lot of walking (and climbing) and can be tiring on a hot humid day as it was in August.

Another Amazing Temple. This is also a must see, not for the faint hearted as there are many steps to climb with fabulous views. Make sure you wear good walking shoes, take your camera and just keep clicking.

Amazing . All of the temples in the Siem Reap area are phenomenal! This is a huge temple complex and so much to see. It is so important to have a guide so you can fully understand the history behind the temples otherwise it will be just another temple. They are all so different and unique.
A key stop on your day in Siem Reap. This temple is one of the key top ten temples, but it didn't rank amongst my favorites for the day. Even still, it's impressive!

Another great engineering/architectural achievement. Great ancient architectural/engineering achievement. There are quite a few stairs to get to the different levels but are not too demanding until the last set to the very top level. These last stairs could be demanding for some people but the views from the top are worth the effort.
Peaceful. More compact than Angkor Wat, more character. You can't really compare as they are all different but I preferred this temple.
Huge place . Again a good place to visit on a pleasant weather day as u have to walk walk and walk... With lot of steps to climb up and down.

fantastic peaceful experience. do be prepared to be tired out. fantastic view and amazing sense of calm. but the stairs and the angle of elevation is really exhausting. Managed it though! :) do wear good walking shoes and for those with fear of heights, it's really a great thrill!

Has to be seen. Located in the Angkor Archeological site, this is a much larger complex than Angkor Wat and has many temples. You can enter with your Angkor ticket $20US for 3 days pay (use over 7 days). The famous Bayon temple is here, as is the Terrace of the Elephants and many other sites. This is a must do if in the Angkor area. You can get elephant rides here.

Find a spot, take a breath and soak it in. Stunning. Angkor Thom is one of the temples you will experience in the tour of the Angkor Wat area. You can walk through and up the steps to experience what it was like to live there. It is lovely on a rainy day too as it only adds to the mystic atmosphere. This is a must try activity when in Siem Reap.
Amazing ancient city. Must see this ancient city. It is amazing to explore this ancient city and think about how people lived a thousand years before.

classic cambodia. many of the photos you see of the trees growing through the ruins are from angkor thom. it is very photogenic tho many beautiful carved stones have fallen to the ground. could use a bit of refrubishment.
different . This is another major temple in Siem Reip and is different from the others. It is worth seeing all the major temples as they are quite different from each other
Wonderful temple. No need special promotion it is just wonderful as all the temples in Angkor. Be there early in the morning to avoid traffic and heat
Great visit. the visit was really great. In the end i visited the major 6 temples and all were really good. A lot of deterioration but still worth the visit.
Another great Wat. They are all good and you should see them all. Take your own guide if you can afford it. Photos galore

Very big site. The whole Angkor Thom is large. Most itinerary will have this in your list after checking out Angkor Wat. You will be greeted by head sculptures and other statues starting from the gate. There are so many sites within Angkor Thom so I suggest to dedicate more time in checking what is inside it. The picture I included was from the entrance gate.
Angkor Thom. when i come visit this place still in reconstruction, maybe next year this place will be good visit.

Angkor Thom!. I liked the way its been constructed. Imagine how Buddha face is shaped on such high rising tombs in that ancient time! That too when temple is constructed from big stones... Few part of this temple is not not standing tall and changed in ruin but still its got its charm and a must visit in Siem Reap.
The walled city of Angkor Thom is awesome!. Loved this temple for the many faces and engraved walls, the way the trees have grown up through the stonework is quite amazing ...

What an ancient city it would have been. This is another must visit, Angkor Tom is not 1 temple it is actually an ancient city with a number of temples within the complex. The gates leading in to the ancient city are truly amazing!!! Inside Angkor Tom is the Bayon Temple which was one of my favorites, it is a must to walk to the top and overlook Angkor Thom. I am not one to have thought I would be so taken back with the temples but I am still in awe of my experience at Angkor Wat Site.

Interesting temple. THis temple is not a must but a very interesting one. Always is enjoable if you don't have so many people aroud and see more of the beauty. If you have enough time you should see it.
Don't miss all the faces!. Angkor Wat may get most of the attention, but the many faces of Angkor Thom should not be overlooked. Very interesting place!

Better than Angkor was.. Several temples inside a 3km square wall that I am told housed up to 1 million people around 1000 years ago. That is densely populated.The authorities like you to follow a set route from temple to temple. I went in the reverse direction in order to avoid some of the crowds and for the first 2 temples I was almost alone which was fantastic. It did require a bit of extra walking but was well worth the effort.If you want a special sunset away from the crowds you can enter the West gate, turn right and follow a jungle path up a hill that gives a great secluded view of the sunset over the west lake.

Make sure you spend time here as well as Angor Wat. Amazing temple - huge - best to have a Tuk Tuk driver so you can move quickly - this contain Banyon Temple and the walk through the gate past the heads on the bridge is very powerful - don't miss it

Good to see. This was the 2nd temple seen yesterday on our one day tour. Bring hat and cold water as it was very hot. Well worth including it in your temple tours but wear comfortable clothing and shoes as lots of walking involved in all temples
Yet another temple.. Yet another temple. Unless you are an archaeologist or a film maker then this is only worth a 5 minute look around if you have seen the other temples

The Temple of Many Faces. Saw Angkor Thom before Angkor Wat and thought it was better because you could go into more places and explore with better camera angles to choose from although the temple is smaller.

awesome ancient civilization experience. Lots of temples/cities to see and explore, gives you an idea how advanced hindu civilization was, and marvel at the architecture in ancient times especially the massive stone structures and the carvings, be prepare to walk and climb lots of stairs and steps but its worth it
Imagine. Imagine you could turn the hands of the clock back to the period when this lovely building was still in use!
Seeing is beliving. The carving of the stones, you wonder how they do it in ancient times. Try doing this place 1st or last to avoid crowd.

Get a Small Tour & then hire Tut Tut for the remaining half day. This is what I do to maximise my 1 day temple pass (USD 20). Get the Small tour for Angkor Thom which starts at 5am and end at 1pm (USD 18) covers sunrise view. After that, instead of following the tour back to your hostel, just negotiate with a good English speaker tut tut to bring you around for the Grand tour to see the remaining temples (I got it for USD18).I visited almost all the major temples available but most memorable would be: Angkor Wat, Angkor Thom, Bayon, Prasat Ta Prum, Banteay Kdel, Prasat Prey Roup, Eastern Mebon, & Prasat Prey Khan. All of them has their own story and history with slightly different in architecture and designs. Spending a total of 14 hours here before going back to rest.Tips: Download offline map. Get a good walking shoe, umbrella, lots of drinking water (at least 3 litres), tut tut to ferry you around, food ration to recover energy (chocolate bar), Get a foot massage ranging around USD 2-4 for 30 minute should fix the leg fatigue. Calcium & magnesium helps and some warm cream would be good for muscle ache.

The best of 3 . Insider journeys took us to the big 3 - the walk of history in this one inscribed on the walls was like pages of history jumping out at us - we spent around 30 mins here - amazing amazing Amazing !!
Wow!. Not to be missed. All the facial carvings on these rocks is so amazing! how did they do this so many years ago? Definitely a wonder of the world!

Have to see it to believe it . If you are in Siem Reap it would be a travesty to miss Angkor Thom. It is full of temples and Wats that are all a must see... Bayon, The Leper King/ Elephant Terrace even the gates are amazing crossing the moat on bridges with gods on one side and demons on the other.... At the very least half a day will let you see the main attractions but a full day would be best. Angkor Thom should be the second last thing you do in Siem Reap, the last being Angkor Wat. Do all the other temples/ Wats before the two biggest...l
Don't miss this one. Absolutely awesome temple to visit, my favourite of the temples we visited. Having a guide with you definitely enhances the experience

WOW! Don't miss this..... Quite hard to get ones head around the age and mechanics of simply getting this structure built nigh on 1000 years ago....the detailed smiling faces done in a Mona Lisa smile style bear down wonderfully! A memory forever....
Largest complex with famous sites.. Start here in the morning, since most tourists will gather at Angkor. Take your time to wonder around and explore. Plan at least 2 days to see the all the temples.
Pictures do not do it justice. The vibe of this awesome place is very sobering. I can only imagine life here long long ago. A very spiritual place and a place of civility and culture. A must see.

Magnificent temple complex. Angkor Thom includes the Bayon, Baphuon, Terrace of the Leper King, Terrace of the Elephants, etc. It is a large complex of ancienf temples, definitely worthy of a visit and recommendation.Make sure to buy your Angkor Pass, dress in appropriate clothings, bring your water and extra clothes.

Unlike anything else I've ever seen!. This place is just phenomenal...it's huge and has such a lovely variety of temples within it, it's difficult to know where to start.It's the gates that get you first! 54 gods and 54 demons fighting it out over the massive moat. The south gate especially is an astonishing site to behold. Within the 5 gates and moat are a myriad of sights...probably the most famous is the Bayon, right at its heart. But you should also take in the lovely big buddhas outside the Bayon, maybe ride an elephant, walk the Terrace of Elephants and the Terrace of the Leper King...just for starters. Ideally a day spent exploring it would do it justice. Buy a 3 day ticket (for the price of 2 days) and spread it out. Trying to cram everything in in just a morning or afternoon would be a travesty! It's also best to hire a guide in town before you get there...money well spent.

The Tops. If you go to Siem Reap, you have to go to Angkor Thom, "The Great City". If I had to choose between this and Angkor Wat, I would choose Angkor Thom every time. Its walls enclose a vast area (around seven square miles) and the buildings inside are of such stunning variety. The South Gate to the old city (hundreds of thousands - maybe a million people- lived here long before New York even existed) and its green moat is an awe-inspiring sight. The gate is dominated by the giant face of Avalokiteshvara, the Buddha of Loving Compassion. He's everywhere in temple of Bayon, too, but so are bus-loads of other tourists plus their loud guides and I gave up on it after two abortive visits as it just wasn't fun. Never mind: nearby is the evocative ruin of another temple, the Baphuon pyramid, with great views from the upper gallery. And adjacent to that- a short peaceful walk through the emerald woods- is another sight of haunting magnificence- the royal palace, what's left of it. These are spectacular places and mercifully free of overcrowding, at least in the low season. You can also find other smaller ruins lurking in the forests. Finally there is the Terrace of Elephants... and next to it, the hidden gem of the Terrace of the Leper King: the walls of sculptured figures in its little passageways are very expressive and mostly very well-preserved - in my humble opinion, one of the finest sights around Siem Reap and not to be missed on any account. It seems the Leper King is a misnomer and that the statue (now in Phnom Penh) on top of the mound was Yama, the Lord of Death. This strange little site may have been where the kings of Angkor were cremated. Either way, to me the sculptured figures are much more fascinating than the interminable bas reliefs in Angkor Wat which get far more publicity but which are standard diagrammatic imperial fare by comparison.

It is worth visiting this UNESCO "World heritage site".

Majestic... Angkor Thom is also from 12th century and is one of the largest Khmer cities having 9 square kilometre area. City walls surrounded by a moat enclose a square. Most of the area now is a forest and have four gates at cardinal points. I entered through the S gate that is extensively restored and and it's on the road from Angkor Wat and Siem Reap. The approach to the S gate is through a moat lined by avenue of statues including two rows of figures each carrying the body of giant serpent - a seven headed Naga - looking as if it's in a tug of war. The centre of city is Bayon.The use of Naga balustrades lining as approach is symbolically interpreted as linking the world of men outside the temple with world of gods inside.At the base of gate tower, on either side, is another architectural invention, a three headed elephant plucking lotus flowers with it's trunks that form the pillars. The elephant is Airawata the vehicle of Indra, the god of sky as well as king of gods. Naga bridge is therefore also interpreted as divine rainbow. One has to spend at least two hours to walk round to be assisted by learned guide.

Amazing history -Angkor Thom means Great City. I found this city....Angkor Thom to be a very interesting archeological site. I could stand back and just imagine what this place was like back in the late 12th century. Amazing that this is the last capital city of the Khmer Empire. I copied the following info for other guests to read. "Angkor Thom (Khmer: អង្គរធំ; literally: "Great City"), located in present-day Cambodia, was the last and most enduring capital city of the Khmer empire. It was established in the late twelfth century by King Jayavarman VII.[2]:378–382[3]:170 It covers an area of 9 km², within which are located several monuments from earlier eras as well as those established by Jayavarman and his successors. At the centre of the city is Jayavarman's state temple, the Bayon, with the other major sites clustered around the Victory Square immediately to the north."This is such an amazing site to visit!

Didn't Know There Was Such a Place, Did You?. Many people think that the Angkor Archaeological Park is called Angkor Wat and are clueless that there's even somewhere called Angkor Thom. I suggest you get a tour guide who can give you the big picture about what you're looking at, as well as pointing out small details that your guidebook may not know. A tour guide will also ensure that you hit the really good spots, especially if you have limited time like I did. In any case, the important thing is that you visit Angkor Thom.

So much to see and explore!. It is worth spending at least a half day exploring this area. Most people just go to Bayon, the most famous structure in the area, known for the many faces that adorn each of the towers. And indeed Bayon is a must see. But it's also great to have your tuk tuk driver stop at various spots, (or rent a bicycle and stop where you like!) and spend time exploring the whole complex. There are many small structures worth wandering about. They are less crowded and it's wonderful taking some restful time to sit in a grassy area just taking in the awe-inspiring scenes. Buy a snack or lunch from one of the many vendors, or take along your own picnic to enjoy a scenic break from temple visits. Don't miss the elephant terrace within the complex. It's magnificent walls carved with giant elephant scenes, and the large elephant sculptures guarding the entrance are stunning.

Amazing place to take in history. Of all our travels around this world this has to be one of the most amazing place we have been to. It's so awing inspiring just so full of history you can't help to be blown away with the way this Temple was built in the period.

Lost largest human settlement in pre-industrial world.. Angkor Thom means big city. It was founded by Hindu king Jayavarman the 7th in 1177. It was surrounded by 26ft high stone wall with 5 gates. We can see the South gate, in front of which there are 54 Devas and 54 Demons pulling the great snake depicting the scene of Samudra Manthan as per Hindu mythology. It is mind boggling to see the massive statues and imagine how this was built.

Great site with enough private space . We visited almost every part of the complex started with the temple of Bayon, then Baphuon, Phimeanakas, passed the Terrace of Elephant and finally Prasat Suor Prat before leaving from the Victory Gate. Its a nice 2 hours walk and climbing. Baphuon is my top choice besides Bayon Temple. We visited during lunch time so there were fewer crowds and we could enjoy enough private space while wandering around the temples. Highly recommended.

Stunning! Must visit. We visited mid morning on a sweltering day - what an impressive site - restoration work was being carried out at front so photos were slightly impeded by crane lifting stone blocks. This however did not detract from the overall impressive structures. We were able to walk around all levels - the final top stairs are very steep and not for the infirm or unsteady. Beautiful stone carvings. A must visit destination.

Nice place. This place is huge and you need to have good walking shoes to move around. Do note that there are a lot of tourist in this area and if you are visiting this place in summer, bring along a hat or umbrella
wow. another beautiful temple that has a lot of history well worth visiting another beautiful piece of history
Another Wonder of the World. Different to Angkor Wat and well worth worth the experience. The mind boggles at the architecture and skill involved to create such a temple.
Beautiful. Another temple on our list to visit yet it is safe to say it is of a complete difference, offering its own characteristics and atmosphere. Stunning

Temple run!. There are lot of temples within. The best one is Bayon. This was the 3rd day tour and we just saw others from outside as we were tired of walking and humidity. Take lots of water and towel.
so good!. This place was one of my favorites on the small circle and was much more breathtaking than Angkor Wat. It is a must see when you do the temples

Very popular -. Best of the temples - the 48 plus large sized faces are magical as you walk, climb, navigate through the temple. Very very crowded in peak times. I went twice to return for pictures late afternoon and enjoyed it best over early morning crowds.most people skip the Gallery walks of carvings of everyday life and the aspara dancers. My favorite.mi found the section where the women helping a woman in labor and the next scene women helping woman giving birth. The animals, birds, trees, men betting at a cock fight, men cooking fish on a stick, alligator taking a bite of a person's leg, oxen, elephants.... The exquisite carvings on ground level of the Galleries worth the time especially if interested in seeing the everyday lives 1,000 years ago. Then suddenly the carvings end...why?! The King has died and the carving artists return to their villages to home, I was told by docent. A viable Temple with a prominent Buddha worthy of a prayer and blessing. Cover shoulders and knees I was told as a woman for respect to the monks. Try to read ahead before touring as limited signage and history provided. Most eastern tourists use this location for group photo background shots over the historically significant cultural stories this magnificent monument holds. Angkor Thom is the ancient faces once of gold of Cambodia - worth purchasing a book!
Amazing. A another amazing temple you need to see while your in Cambodia. The architecture and size of this place is mind blowing. Visit this site you won't be disappointed.
The temples are so memorable!. I didn't know Cambodia has so many temples. It's worth it to try and spend a considerable amount of time in each, especially with a guide. I recommend Intrepid Tours!
Many steps to negotiate. Great history and beautiful pictures for our life experience to share with all our friends and family
Angkor Thom. Absolutely stunning. It's best to go with a tour guide. The detail that he gives you plus the sight will blow you away.

Of course 5-star. Like other parts...again, worth all the challenges of travel to this area of the world. Very cool faces...don't forget to line up your profile to one of the towers profile for a great pic!
Awesome. The view is awesome and it is part of your tour. Every temple holds a different story and uniqueness. Indescribable architecture.

Another temple not to be missed. Possibly the most famous of all temples in the region, the vastness and complexity is astounding. If you;re lucky you may find monks praying. You can climb the steepest temple and walk around with amazing views.

Once in a lifetime . The entire Angkor Wat complex is one for all bucket lists, including Angkor Thom. The history and sheer size of the place has to be seen to be believed. To be honest, I had a bit of a cry walking the bridge towards the temple with the good statues on one side and bad on the other ... is just so amazing to imagine what these statues have seen. A must see!
A must see! . Amazing and breath taking. The only sad thing is the amount of visitors. So beautiful / was my favourite! Take lots of water and sun screen!
Part of your tour. You'll end up here as part of any tour as well on the main loop. Another awesome one. Hope the crowds aren't bad

The highlight of Angkor. Angkor Wat is what the Angkor complex is named for, but Angkor Thom really stands out as the highlight. With the Bayon Temple, the fantastic South Gate and the Terrace of the Elephants, Anhkor Thom is well worth spending a good amount of time at.

Enter into the walled capital and behold. A religious homage to the King - a distinct style with four faced towers everywhere in celebration of his likeness. The drive into Angkor Thom past the statues and into the gates is amazing

Hot Angkor Thom. By being on a tour with Vespa tours I got an amazing insight into the history of this amazing place. The king was before his time and a pity we don't have more prominent people like him
Dope!. It's everything you think it will be. Beautiful temples with amazing carvings. Bayon temple was probably my favourite. Spend two days exploring Angkor.
Another Old Temple near Angkor Wat. We visited Angkor Thom after Angkor Wat. We don't pay much attention to its history but took lots of nice photo here.

Very cool. A very cool place to get some great photos.The walkway leading up to the temple photographs beautifully from ground level side on. I was able to capture 2 monks walking along the walkway and it is such a great shot.Note that children need to be 12 and over to climb to the top of the main temple as the stairs are very steep.

Fascinating !!. It's difficult to add to what has already been said by other about Angkor Thom or myself about Angkor Wat and Bayron. The whole complex is fascinating while being challenging to take in due to the enormity of it coupled with the heat and humidity. Underfoot ain't the easiest for less able visitors either. I suppose on reflection I want to go back and revisit after reading more in depth about the sites history. You will however undoubtedly enjoy you visit to this wonderful historic space.
Superb. the review is same is Bayon temple also known as Angkor Thom, worth a visit at least once in a lifetime
Amazing Complex. I was wonder struck by the architects vison who created these monumental Temples .. and so many structures in the complex. the Faces are as like staring at you.. do go
Beautiful place. Such a beautiful place to visit, a great day out , our tour guide was brilliant , all I can say is just brilliant and worth a visit you will be disappointed

Beautiful temple. After seeing Angkor wat it was nice to see another temple that wasn't as crowded but equally as enjoyable to see. Would recommend doing a tour, you can hire a tuk tuk for $20 for the day.
Astounding . Majestic great photo shoots take your time and also read up the history to appreciate the ruins better. .Jun is quieter than November so less people to enjoy and appreciate
Loved this place. Loved Angkor Thom , it looks different to everything else because of the large faces.. You can walk in and around the whole place and take some great photo's

Worth visiting!. Just like the other angkor heritages, this place makes you experience the beauty of cambodia's rich history. The ruins, intricate carvings on every corner of the remaining structures, the evident interplay of nature and human's talent give you the chills and a better appreciation of life's wonders and mysteries. This is a site to behold.
Beautiful. Perhaps a bit underrated, the temple is a must see while in town. Great carvings and artwork throughout make it a great addition to the temple tour.
Not as busy as the other temples. Another great temple but had less people there. This was a great one to just find a place up high and take it all in without people trying to push pass.

Awesome!. This is one of the temples that we initially visited. Simple yet majestic. It was a great time just being with my wife and taking pictures for our post-nup (We didn't have pre-nup pictures).

Good. Visited this as part of the tour of Angkor Wat.
In my opinion this was better than Angkor Wat as there was more to see and in better condition.
Some of the security men were really helpful and were happy to take photos for you.

Another beautiful temple. The temples are all a must see and you can fit them all in one day. $20 for the day amd $16 for tuk tuk. Lots of sellers and markets around but they don't pester too much. I bought some shirts as I sweated so much I had to change twice.

Great Complex full of beautiful temples. The complex has a number of temples and the kings palace. My guide and me walked the entire complex and climbed each and every temple. The place is best explored on foot. The entire is the naga bridge (churning of the milk in the sea and is the story of how Vishnu disguised himself to help the good priests from the demons) The carvings on that bridge is just fabulous.

Great Temple complex. While visiting we were showered with some rain. But you aren't truly visiting Cambodia in the rainy season unless you get soaked once or twice! The sites are amazing and are a must see for all visitors.

A distressed marvel, with Buddha's galore. This is an interesting site, as it's four times the area of the Angkor Wat site. Much more in a distressed state than most, with only a little but of restoration here or there. The four Buddha's on each surviving tower are magical, and give this site a real touch of mystery. Once again a site that has to be visited to be appreciated.

Archaeologically a wonder. IT is amazing how these temples are built and truly deserves a billing of an ancient wonder. you will be spellbound as to how this temple is constructed. get a good guide as we did. you will learn a lot more.

Angkor Thom, the “Great City” was the last capital of the Khmer empire. This place holds some beautifully serene and peaceful places to wander if you plan your time well. Take time to take a few pictures on the bridge as you enter the gate.

A must-see whilst seeing the temples. Checked out this temple after seeing Ankor Wat and I highly recommend. Make sure you include this in your tour when haggling with a tuk tuk driver. It's a lot bigger than Angkor Wat and there's a temple across the road with a large gold buddha

ANGKOR WOW . Enjoyed the lunch adventures here. Very hot even in July rainy season. Our tuktuk driver was very patient even if we were so slow in touring the place. So many things to see we didn't even get to see the insides of leper kings temple but we were already exhausted due to the heat but all good as the views were spectacular

breathtakingly beautiful. The Angkor Thom province is magical with its majestic entrance inviting you to a city of grandeur beauty. The faces are calm yet powerful enveloping you in its spell. Walking though many of its temple you are taken back in time wondering about the bustling life. The beauty about Siem Reap's temples are its eroding stone structures and natures hold on it, but you cannot help wondering how it must have been in all its glory. Siem Reap's temples are a must visit.
Perhaps the most interesting of the local temples. Smaller in scale but much more interesting than Angkor Wat. Visit both. Something like 54 towers here.

MAGNIFICENT . You feel like Indiana Jones and Tomb Raider all rolled into 1. Your pictures does this place no justice... Inhale it all into your memory. Once you buy your day pass, all Angkors and temples are free, just be sure to hold on to your pass throught out the day. My phone died I took so many pictures. Bring a back up battery for sure.

Perfect complement for visiting the second day after Angkor Vat. The place is fantastic, not only for the big impressive faces carved in the middle of the city. The Southern entrance have a line of gods in the left side and devils in the right side. In other place the have elephants carved in the wall , thousands of butterflies, the place has its magic.I went end of June and I thing is a good season, you appreciate the raining storms when visiting this. Mosquitoes don't care of the Off Bite and that stuff, but I can not imagine climbing this fantastic place with a whole day sunshine in my head.

Another Excellent Place to see. This is another very interesting place, will take you minimum 3+ hrs to see it, be prepared to climb several very steep angled about 75 degree steps, & bring an umbrella to shade from hot sun, & plenty of water as you may become dehydrated very quickly.It is in several levels & you will be climbing very steep steps, but it is worth it.
Great Experience. Definitely I will come back to Siem Reap to visit again and this time... I will take the 3 day pass.
Unique. Surreal! Enjoyed Angkor Thom. Very beautiful and wonderful to explore. Work out as one of our favourites. Great for lovers of history and anything beautiful.

A walk through a very different culture.. Angkor Thom is just another part of this stunning Khmer civilisation and is equally worth visiting along with Angkor Wat. The largest city in the world in the 12th century, it is fascinating to learn that further sights are being discovered thanks to modern technology. Try and visit early in the morning when it is less busy depending on time of the year. It is worth doing your homework before you visit to truely understand jus what a marvel this is.
Take the time to visit . Another impressive ruin from the Angkor period. Has steep uneven stairs to contend with. Take it easy and enjoy the site. Pictures don't do it justice .

Another Amazing Temple. We visited so many temples in Siem Reap, but this was another good one. Beautiful views from the top, and just simply huge - worth going to visit, but make sure you see the others as well!
another temple. you get to see the same thing all around Angkor Wat but it is worth while taking it all in a must to see ,just makes u wonder how this attraction was put together all those years ago

A highlight. The largest of the temples in the archeological park is most impressive and largest of the temples. Considerable conservation and reconstruction has gone into this structure. Wear sturdy shoes as there is a lot of climbing, but well worth it. The art work is awe inspiring, both on the amount of it and it's sophistication..
Angkor thom big city. Angkor thom is big city have many temple inside there .Bayon temple was in also .It amazing the first get there .
Must See. Simply breath-taking. If you are on Siem Reap, don't miss the power and sublime beauty of this architectural marvel.

Favourite temple! . We were looking forward to Angkor Thom and Bayon the most.
Unfortunately, half way through our tour it started raining really hard and flash flooding so we didn't get as much time here as we had hoped.
Regardless of that, it was still my favourite temple with very interesting architecture!!

Climb to the top for great views. Definitely one of the temples worth visiting if you only have time for a few or are worried about becoming 'templed out'. It's a steep climb to the top (coming down is scary if you've got a problem with heights) but perfectly do-able for most.

Don't skip this one. This is more interesting than Angkor Wat in that you can examine the carvings and stone placements at your own pace, as there are no crowds. In fact my wife and I were the only people there. Even the ruins are impressive. See this before you go to Angkor Wat for a better understanding.
Amazing place to visit. A must place to visit in Asia as it is pretty amazing to see the ruins ancient trees with enormous roots, elephants and monkeys plus the people are so nice and friendly.
Amazing!. This is an amazing temple complex with so much history and so very much to offer. We highly recommend it. It is well worth the cost of your pass!
very good. We didn't need a lot of time to explore this temple but enjoyed what it had to offer. Include this one on your day tour.
Absolutely stunning!. This is one of my favorite temples in this area! It was crowded but worth it to see the unique architecture.
My favourite . Out of all of the temples we were fortunate to visit these were by far our favourite. I actually liked them much better than ankor wat. The faces were amazing a photographers dream.
Yet another wonderful temple. So much to see in such a small amount of time. I wish we spent more than 3 days to see more temples. Bring sun screen and lots of water

Angkor Thom. Angkor Thom is one of the largest Khmer cities founded by Jayavarman VII and was likely to of remained the capital for approximately 500 years. To visit the 900 hectare site of Angkor Thom enter through the S gate which can be reached by crossing the bridge over the moat. You know you're heading in the right direction when the towers with huge faces carved into them are looking down at you.

It's everything you've read about and more. Angkor Thom was a city of 1 million people. Take a guide to learn as much as possible and to help you find the best photo spots. Or read up plenty ahead of time to gain full appreciation.

Angkor Thom - Amazing!. What an amazing place to visit. There is something about this and all the temples. Such a spiritual experience. A must see in Cambodia. Worth paying for a guided tour as there is so much history.
Wow. Part of our Angor Wat and other temple tour. The size of this City is amazing! Get a guide and take a tour!
magical!!!. maybe more magic (less tourist on the field) than Angkor Wat?!? The faces at the walls are beautiful! Get a guide for more information and less walking arround...

Last and Most Enduring Capital City of the Khmer Empire. Angkor Thom was the last and most enduring capital city of the Khmer empire. Face-Tower Entrances serve as Welcome Arch when entering the Angkor Thom Complex. Bayon Temple, Baphuon, Phimeanakas, Elephants Terrace and Leper King Terrece are situated inside the complex. Angkor Thom and the famous Angkor Wat are both located in the Angkor Thom District (Don't get confused with Angkor Thom Complex and Angkor Thom District).

Amazing Temple. As with Ankor Wat this is also an amazing place to visit. We are amazed to see the roots coming through the beautiful stonework. I have always wanted to see this along with Ankor Wat. A great place to visit and be prepared to spend a bit of time exploring. As i watched tomb raider it was nice to see where some of the filming was done.

Take 2 days and see them all. Don't try and see everything in 1 day It's way to big and hot to rushIf you can use a guide you will get more out of it. In the rainy season(now) it was not overwhelming crowded and the rains are predictable You don't want to explore temples in rain because it's a lot of climbing on smooth stone.
Excellent. There is many options to visit temples. You can walk, take tuk tuk, cycle, ride an elephant ...endless possibility.Must see!
Wonderful visit . This is one of the frequently visited site of the temples. The carvings are so intricate and amazing. This is evident in Angkor Wat as well.

Take suitable shoes and water! . Absolutely magnificent to explore! Plenty of photo opportunities, lots of hiking, monkeys, and small shrines! Wear suitable shoes and take plenty of water! Oh and don't feed/touch the monkeys!

Templeland. A complex of several temples, each one distinct and more impressive than its neighbour. The vastity of the area gives a good idea of the glory of the former Khmer empire. The former might is no more, and now countless stray kids (some almost pre-school) try to sell their load of fridge-magnets and other junky souvenirs to wealthy tourists. One thing that was advised multiple times was not to buy from the kids (as hartless as that might sound), to try and stop the wheel of exploitation from turning.

Lovely Temple Awesome Building. A lovely temple with fantastic gallery depicting Hindu tales. The building work is unbelievable and well worth visiting. Now it is the quieter time so you are able to see the temple in its glory without being too interrupted and photo opportunities are good.Worth a visit

One of the truly great temples in this area.. I have visited the temples of Angkor Wat a number of times to photograph them and this is one of the must see temple if you visit Siem Reap Cambodia. I just finished visiting again last week and this temple continues to amaze me. Each year the number of visitors grows, so again, I advise people to leave early. This will help you beat some of the crowd and avoid some of the heat. Also wear shoes shoes good for walking since this temple especially requires covering some distance. It is worth it, along with taking the "big views" of this temple, pay attention to the details too. So much of the walls have relief carving details that are fascinating to view. Check out the photos to get a hint at how incredible nature of this place.
Beautiful!. I think I liked this temple best of all the temples in the Angkor Wat complex, just because of the beautiful Buddha faces built into the towers. Amazing!

Like all Angkor temples: beautiful and had my elephant ride there!. I believe the begging of a trip is the most important; in my planning i decided to start the journey to the temples with Angkor Thom; first my tuk-tuk took me before arriving Angkor to get my temples admin pass - 1 day is 20 dollars 3 days or 1 week is 40dollars I got the 3 days to take only 2 days to See all peacefully! Angkor Thom has a 20mts gate crowned by 4 stone faces bordered by a Dbl row of 54 stone figures! There i took my elephant ride to Bayon Temple-$40 for one person; if would have been 2ppl Price is same they said, shame. Them we arrived Bayon amazing as well!
See my comments of Angkor Wat. See my comments on Angkor Wat. Don't forget to organise a simple snack or pack lunch to take with you. Don't forget the sunscreen.

Smiling Buddha. Absolutely a do-not-miss. While it can be quite warm with a good deal of sun, has many steps and even a ladder, the effort is well worth it. If the heat is too much, there are a number of lower level inside passages that are much cooler and quite interesting as well.

Another Temple but well worth visiting. visiting four temples on the same day gives a feeling of sameness, but this temple was different and despite the humidity we really enjoyed the dedication and experience of the construction team of centuries past.

Amazing except the smell.. Bathroom smells in the temples, very gross, but the architecture is amazing. Especially Bayon temple. Also, beside Bayon theres a huge wall with nice elephant sculptures. Please do not do the elephant rides. It is cruel. Please sign the online petition for this practice to stop.

Must see as part of visit to the area. The 216 faces here are all amazing - so much character in each that still remain. Our guide was able to explain much of the history too which is really worth hearing. Plenty of great photo opportunities here too.

Amazing Angkor Thom . This was possibly my favourite temple out of all those in the Angkor province. Be careful walking after it has rained as the stones can be extremely slippery. Lots to see, I suggest you do read about the history of the temples before you visit them as it gives you an appreciation of them.
Largest temples i guess. the largest temple in angkor wat. you will get lost in here because it has 4 different entrances.exits

The feeling that you have to share it but just want it for yourself. All wow effects everywhere! One of my favorite places on Earth!All the temples and walking through the jungle.Breathe the place, all its mysticism, such a special place! Everyone should go there once in their life... Except because that would mean we would have to share it more.
perfect !. please do go early in the morning, it gets really hot, and make sure you are prepared to walk a long distance

Architectural marvel. Watching the 49 of the 54 remaining towers with 4 faces of Jayaverman VII morphed into Buddha's is something every traveller to the Angkor village dedicates time to marvel. Rightly so!

Huge city!. The sheer scale of Angkor Thom is very impressive and you definitely need a car to drive through it. We did a sunset gondola cruise around the moat which was lovely, the birds were singing, the scenery is lovely and it is so peaceful. We visited the bayon temple - a must see, the terrace of the leper king, terrace of the elephants and the statues of the gods on the south gate. Overall a lovely place to visit and a must see!
Angkor Thom. Beautiful place with amazing architecture. It was fascinating that there were many little green butterflies flying around the area which made it look magical. A must see
172 smiling Buddhas. what set this one apart is all the Buddha heads. A lot were 4 sided. Nice climb to the top. very cozy feel to this temple
Lovely architecture. Another temple in Angkor Wat complex whereby photography enthusiasts will appreciate. It can feel like a miniature maze walking around in circle.

Second to None. Generally visited after legendary Angkor Wat, Angkor Thom has a style of its own that makes it second to none. The beautifully carved faces and the magnificent sculptures presents us most of religious/mythical elements in 3D form

Interesting ruins. Much smaller than close by Anghor Watt but this Temple is well worth a visit. Only downside is you need to be careful as the site is slightly unstable. Look out for the face in the tree..

Amazing Experience. A beautiful place with such great history.Even though it was very hot, it was amazing to walk around and see the faces in the stone and to experience what the place would have been like hundreds of year ago.Driving in through the victory gate was a really buzz.
Much better than Angkor Wat. Atmospheric with great faces, interesting bas reliefs, could have spent all day there. Monkeys too! Great photo ops
Wonderful mysteries in the stone faces. Even in the stifling heat, the stone heads are a marvel. Worth taking the trip, to include in visit to other temples.

Trip of the lifetime. This is one place, every person in the world should see. Make sure to carry a good camera and lots of sunscreen and water along with you because views are breathtaking, sun is hard and you need to walk a lot. But at every stage you feel amazed. We took a bus with wifi from Phnom Penh around 9pm and reached Siem Reap in the morning. You can get tut tut (or tuktuk) easily and make sure to wintness the epic sunrise. Take lots of pictures and just forget everything and welcome the sun. Good luck for your epic journey.

Very interesting. We did the Angkor Wat sunrise tour on an extremely hot day. Angkor Thom was really interesting and got some great pictures. Would recommend going but take lots of water and ladies make sure you wear appropriate clothing (long pants and cover your shoulders). There isn't any information on the temples unless you hire a guide which isn't expensive. However we preferred to walk around at our own pace. If recommend doing some research before hand if you are interested in knowing the history.

beautiful.. and confusing... With several temples and places to walk / climb / discover / get lost / offered rides / rained on and buy cold water / beer... Angkor Thom will keep you busy for the rest of the day.. to the point where one temple just blends into the next.. and you need to start keeping score of what you are actually looking at.. Bayon Temple being the centre of Angkor Thom... and then a medley of more palaces, lakes, Baphuon, the terrace of this the terrace of that.. by this time, a map and a guide book would be very well needed.. to understand the complexity and intricate history and who built what temple for whom during what century... for the untrain historian.. more rocks / bricks / faces / carvings (and the odd wild bee's nest) for the fitness fanatic.. more to climb and train / run through for the archeologist.. more Disneyland to explore. Hystorically speaking.. another expression of religous ferver.. based on Mount Meru. From the moment you enter the fantastic gates, its a small leap to imagine life in the 13th century.

Unbelievable . Pictures do not serve this site any justice. It's a dream to see with your own eyes. Was there a couple weeks ago and it was super hot, so start exploring early so you can end before the strong sun beats on you. Architecture is breathtaking. Also hire a guide so you get the whole story

different that Angkor Wat. this place made me realize, that for sure some day need to go to Mexiko for Aztec ruins. Its smaller location than Angkor Wat, but also amazingly different.Going there from from Wat, you may slide slowly in queues. Depending on season day you visit the place.

Worth the STEEP steps. The carvings and the attention to detail is spectacular - knowing that they we're done hundreds of years before modern tools and techniques. Every which way you look you'll be faced with the four faces on each spire which is all around the temple. FRIENDLY TIP: the steps up and down to the "spires" are VERY STEEP so wear some comfy shoes and hold on to the railing. Not recommended for young kids

Movie Hype vs Ancient Temple. This was an interesting visit. I enjoyed the history of this site more than its connection to the Tomb Raider movie. You might want to watch the movie clip before you visit in order to understand the perspective depicted. Cold water, good shoes and an air conditioned van were crucial for our dry season visit.

An Interesting Experience. One of the major temple complexes together with Ankor Wat this is well worth a visit. A guide as for most of the temples, is really necessary to gain some kind of understanding of the history. Without a guide to explain the stories behind the bas reliefs, architecture etc the temples become just another collection of stones.

Omg! Just amazing! !. I could've spent all day here! !Just absolutely breath taking! Wear some sturdy sneakers as you'll have to be climbing up and down some pretty weeny and precarious steps. But omg. If you want some gorgeous pictures and sights that will stay with you forever. ...you have to visit here! !If you can afford a guide i would recommend it. Worth the few extra $$ to get taken to the nooks and crannies you may not have found and for the explanations about Cambodian culture and mythology ♡♡

Lovely place to visit. The whole site is amazing. There are lots of different temples to visit. Lots of walking and you could walk from one to another but I'd suggest taking a tuk tuk or a bicycle least, especially if its hot. We were lucky enough to have a private tour with a car/driver.

Worth Seeing in Addition to Angkor Wat. This is different enough that it's worth seeing this as well. The faces embedded in the columns are amazing. All the rubble and unrestored parts makes this feel more like the ruins it is than Angkor Wat.

Very interesting. This is nearby the much larger and better known Angkor Wat. However, being smaller is actually an advantage as it will only take an hour or so to cover the whole area. The statues are large and very impressive. I would recommend going to this as part of a larger visit to Angkor Wat or if you don't have time to do Angkor Wat, then this will give you a good insight to the architecture of that period.

Just some tips!. Just to clear things up.angkor thom is not a specific temple but a city like area that has alot of temples in it including bayon and others,make sure to have a picture in the angkor thom gate.Here are some tips for all the temples if you are going to visit alot of them,prepare a day or two to visit them all and make sure to pack alot of water! 1.First what we did was buy ticket in a goverment controlled establishment (you a have a choice of a 1day 2day or 3day pass for all the temples included) we got the 1day pass for $20 and visited 6 temples.If you are not that into walking i would suggest to just visit bayon and angkor or just split the temples in different days for there will be alot of walking! 2.SLEEVLESS,SHORTS,SLIPPERS,SHADES AND SCARFS ARE NOT ALLOWED although sandals may be considered.but most importantly make sure to be comfortable to enjoy ur visit. 3.Just to be sure dont forget to check the weather,temples dont have roofs and there are only few convered area so if it is gonna rain i suggest you bring you rain coats or umbrella.Ps. Guides are available in temples if you are into history and culture i suggests you get one as of now they are not the rip off kind of guys that will try to fool you they are nice and knowledgable guys that can share real great stories as you stroll in the temples,and they also know secret sculptures and images that you might pass by.
The favourite!. The most beautiful temple of the complex. Peaceful, less crowd but terribly hot. The ticket purchased at the gate includes this visit.It's on the East side of Angkor Wat.

Beautiful and Awe inspiring. Incredible place to visit, also got up really early watch the sunrise one morning. An experience never to be beaten. However, it does get very busy and some of the smaller temples allow you more access, and a easier to get around. Do not miss Tah Prom.

Great sight. Angkor Thom is known as the great city and is composed of several important temples. In the center of the walled complex are Bayon, Baphuon, the Royal Enclosure, Phimeanakas and the Terrace of Elephants. The entrance gates to the complex have high towers with Buddha faces. Angkor Thom is also distinctive for the row of gods and demons with various expressions lining the entrance way. There are many things to see and discover here so allot half day to explore.

Loved them all. A usual addition to the temple tours, and a must see. Beware the steps on some of the temples are very steep and can get busy during peak times. We did see an ambulance speeding into the complex so assume someone was hurt. Really worth climbing any steps for the views.

Very beautiful but terribly hot. We headed here right after Angkor wat in the usual route the tuk tuk try to run you through. We were pretty tired already and it was the hottest part of the day. This temple is beautiful but different from Angkor wat. Don't expect to be in the shade here so bring water and a hat. And if you go to Angkor wat then head over here you pay 15 dollars for a tour guide there then you find that you need another guide to get the history of the temples in this area. I wish we had just found someone to go around to all the temples with us that day and pay him one fee instead of several separate fees.

Interesting. Angkor Thom with the Bayon Temple is definitely worth a visit event though it is not as spectacular as Angkor Wat. The walk around the temple is peaceful and it is hard to believe that this city was bigger than London at its peak!

Magnificent site. Angkor Thom is impressive from the entry gates from each direction to the array of ruins. Unlike Angkor Wat it is a series of temples and structures., all steeped in history and all visually stunning.I recommend you use a guide to go through at least this area and Angkor Wat. There is so much history and it is fascinating. You would miss so much without a guide. It is expensive by Cambodian standards but well worth it. Our guide talked non stop for the 4-5 hours and told us about the history, the culture both then and now, politics, his personal life, his beliefs and the guiding principles of the rulers during the 10th to 12th century. I can't believe how much I took from this. It set me up for the rest of the trip.

Wonderful. Not as spectacular as Angkor wat, Bayon, or tae prohm but fascinating because it is still a working monument being set up for a visit from the King when we visited. Cambodia is magical and mystical
Enchanting. We toured a few temples over two mornings and I think this was my favorite. The countless carved faces and nooks and crannies to explore were captivating.

Amazing. These temples are truly a wonder. You cannot visit Cambodia and not see these truly magnificent ruins.We decided to keep our tour to early mornings arriving before 07.30 to attempt to beat the heat and humidity. In May temperatures rose to 45 degrees which for a Londoner is too much to bear.I advise using a local tour guide we used Asean Angkor Guide. Our tour guide pointed out many things we would otherwise have missed and the knowledge is remarkable. We learnt so much and this enhanced our experience.
Must Do.... Angkor Thom was the palace of the king. Amazing place, worth more than half-day of your time. Stunning, just amazing, it's really hard to explain how detailed and grand this place is.
marvelous. just a wonderfull place to see, it's time before it becomes to touristic (even if it seems to late :))

Good spot. Comparing to other temples, angko thom is not my favourite but its huge and nice. You will get lost your direction when u are out of the temple.Go there in low season so you can see more the god' creation.!

Beautiful. This was the next stop after Angkor Wat. The buddha and bodhisatva heads are just gorgeous. The most beautiful being the ones with the thick botox-ish lips - such serene expressions. I could spend hours, days etc here.
Lovely temple.................. Bayon is the most temple i like on our vacation in Siem Reap. It really amazing building of last time specially faces was very nice.

BEautiful Angkor with a lot of budha faces. It would be awesome if you come earlier to this place since the it's would be free of tourist groups that would make you can not enjoy the peaceful of this place.. nice place.

AMAZING PICS. I met a guide boy at this temple who showed me around and gave me lots of information he took some great pictures with me in it to it was fantastic. i loved this temple as all of them that i saw in the Angkor Park but this one really blew me away at still so long after the faces were so prominant and easy to see. It is huge and u need to be able to walk up and down stairs but it's well worth it.
Fav of the temples. Angkor Thom doesn't get the PR of the others, but it was my favourite. Not to be missed or passed over.
Beautiful carvings and heritage site in Siem Reap Cambodia. Beautiful sandstone and limestone carvings from a different era....wonderful experience to see these ancient monuments.
