Amazing!. This was one of the coolest temples we had the pleasure of going to. It is so mysterious and uncanny. Be sure to wear good shoes, it's a little slippery in flip flops.
This is an amazing place. So many amazing ruins to explore ... Came to this place on a nice cloudy afternoon. Was quiet when we visited at the end of the day which helped for better photos.
WELL WORTH A VISIT. Amazing - beautiful - isn't a huge site - but well worth a visit - carvings etc beautiful - still amazed you're allowed to climb all over it!
Angkor Thom. Bayon temple was amazing. Angkor Wat of course is a must see but Bayon Temple at Angkor Thom is equally amazing. Great experience.
My dream came true. Wonderful, ancient history. A lot of walking is involved, but worth it.Better in the colder month to visit.But we loved every minute of it.

A must visit when at Angkor Wat.. Words cannot express the history and culture of Angkor Thom. You can rent a Tuk Tuk callled a remork in Khymer for $15.00 a day. Your driver will take you to all the sites at Angkor, supply water for you and wait as you take your time to walk and visit the ancient temples.

Incredible. Not fat from Angkor Wat but not walking distance. This is the temple inside the huge ancient city. The city, south bridge and this temple plus many other buildings throughout are all incredibly beautiful. You cannot walk around the whole city as its large so take a guide and transport of you can as well as lots of water. Lesser known than Angkor away and in less good condition but still stunning.

Fascinating. An absolute must see experience, Ankor Thom is another temple with so much to see, to get the most out of the experience and understand the history I would highly recommend having a private guide.
Up and around Angkor Thom. Simply breath taking and must see. The quality and breath of the ancient architectural master piece will leave in you in awe of the diligence of people way back in time.

Beautiful. Get there before sunrise and you'll be in awe of its beauty. Don't pay for a tour guide, our tuk tuk driver was able to explain everything plus it's fun when you've done your own research. Some bits have been restorated eg the steps but some bits not so there kinda steep... Wear shoes not flip flops

Amazing. A must visit place when you're in Siem Reap.
My advise: Booked a tour guide to show you around the temple at the same time explain to you the history of the place.
Wear a good sport shoes. there will be a lot of walking and climbing up / down the steep stairs

Angkor Wat is a massive three-tiered pyramid crowned by five beehive-like towers rising 65 meters from ground level. Sur. Angkor Thom built by Cambodia's great king, Jayavarman VII. An eight-meter high wall encloses this ten square kilometre city, which is encircled by a moat. The famous Bayon, in the geographical heart of Angkor Thom, is a remarkable 54 tower temple. Initially the temple appears to be a shapeless mass of grey and brown stone, but it is only as you get closer that you realize every tower has the carved face of Avalokiteshvara on it.

This is not a temple!. To think that Angkor Thom is a temple is totally wrong. Angkor Thom is a very huge area that has a lot of temples like Bayon Temple, Phimenakas, Baphuon, Terraces of the Elephant and Terraces of the Leper King. There are other not-really famous temples inside Angkor Thom which you can explore as well, Some of the temples are within walking distant and adjacent to each other. But you need to know that from the entrance of a temple to the temple itself is like 1 to 2 kilometers away, so prepare yourself.I strongly suggest you to pay 1 day service for Tuk-tuk (I paid around USD 18 to the hotel to get 1 day Tuk-tuk ride and did the temples hopping). Better to save your energy to travel inside the temple and take a rest if you move to another temple. I thought I can move from Angkor Thom to Angkor Wat or to Preah Khan by foot, but glad I changed my mind and use Tuk-tuk instead. I saw some tourist walking from one temple to another, under the scorching sun of Cambodia - trust me, the heat is like a living hell on earth. I went to Siem Reap in April when the temperature is the worst (40-44 degrees Celcius).

Amazing architecture. A must visit if you come to Siem Reap. I was fascinated by towers that craved with different expressions of faces, each one shows lives of people these days. In my heart, full of appreciations to the Kings, they asked their people to build these temples, these become the livelihoods of Cambodia...tourism. A hotel mate just told me that he doesn't need a guide, he loves to spend a few days at Angkor Thom and Angkor Wat to take photographs of every corner.

Interesting Temple that's fun for photos!. Angkor Thom may not be as expansive and maintained as Angkor Wat but I liked how it had interesting features that one would have fun with, especially for photo shoots! The towers were actually faces and one can have a fun photo with its silhouette and yours "nose-to-nose" or even kissing ;-) The doorways and window openings make for great frames for photos also.
Really a must see.... We only had two days to explore and you need minimum three to do it justice. Absolutely amazing place. Make sure you are prepared to walk a lot!
Angkor Wat spectacular. Advise to go to the sun rise at 5am, but need to get there early because you need to get yr tickets at ticket box around the corner first the tut tut to Angkor Wat.

Tomb raider!!!. Once you done with the main template this one should be on the list to see next. The tuk tuk will Drop you off one end and you walk in and imagine jolie running about. The ruins are on average side compared to what the other sites are but its the trees over growing things that will provide a unique look on things. If you are in The area check this one out. Your ride picks you up on the the other end so no backtracking is required.
Astonishing!. Angkor Thom is very nice. Like the faces in the stone, and I like how the stone altered over time. More interesting for me than the big and famous Angkor Wat temple.
4 faces. A bit of mystique, archeological intrigue. Compact as compared to Angkor Wat, much smaller. Still worth a stop and visit!

Shockingly sprawling. Angkor Thom is more than just the faces of Bayon, so be sure to explore all of its nooks and crannies. Helps to have a guide to explain everything you're seeing. Detail in stonework carvings is just spectacular. This will be part of your itinerary and for good reason.

One of my Favorite temples!. Really worth it, you feel like in another dimension with all those Buddha's heads! Plus in low season there was lost no one, Perfect!
I had taken a one day guide, really worth it to have some historical explanations. He was very nice and accomodating: Cheavannak2005@yahoo.com.

Beautiful . Loved this place. Amazing structures and carvings. Less crowded but still busy. I disagree with the elephant riding and think tourists should be more informed through education about this terrible practice. Definitely worth a stop on your circuit of the temples.

Huge and impressive. One of the must see temples, this one is not huge on carvings, but is huge in structure. Here you will also see very impressive gateways and structures outside of the actual temple. This one is big and it's definitely worth a visit - be sure to take a guide to fully appreciate the history.

A truly fascinating place. If you are not well read on Angkor Thom, make sure you come here with a guide as the scale of this place could overwhelm you.The only downside to our visit was that many people seem to come here just to take silly pictures of themselves posing on these ancient ruins, which completely spoils the atmosphere that should exist in such an amazing place.
Great place . Wonderful site that's accessible and fun but leave the elephants alone, I don't believe they have the quality of life that they deserve.

Stunning temple!. Angkor Thom and Banteay Srei are the two most incredible temples we saw at Angkor. I can't decide which one I loved better, so I'd say they're both must sees.This temple was much less crowded than Angkor (although still somewhat crowded; it helps to go during the off season, despite the best!). The architecture was beyond words, and too beautiful to even capture in a photo! As a bonus, Baphuon is a short walk away, so it's a bit of a 2-for-1. Definitely don't miss this temple!

good place for at least 1 time to see in your life. Ankor wat ,ankor thom is the fantastic place to seen at least 1 time in your lifeonly 1 day you can see around Ankor wat ,Ankor thom,if you have time a lot , you and see it everywhere by slowly sitting or walking to see the beutiful carve stone.I suggest the car rent with driver,he is very good service mind,toyota camry with air conditioner. contact with facebook MSN: vin sing dmk
Beautiful but busy. Go when rush hour is over! (Everyone stops here after going to Angkor watt in the morning) It is beautiful and a must see though.

Beautiful. Must see this beautiful temple and lake.. Do the early morning sunrise tour. Loved it our friend did yoga so we had a great photo there. Take your time to explore the area. Treat with respect, it is a privilege to see
Amazing cambodia. Wonderful country. Wonderful and very friendly people. Amazing experience. Visited as a 3 day trip from Sapphire Princess, cruising Asia. Would go back again.
Very very beautiful!!. All the temples in this area is worth a visit. This is very particular as everywhere you look at you see faces and faces built in the stone. Incredible :)
Love it!. I am in love in Angkor Thom! These smiles are amazing! The khmer culture is great! Worth any penny spend on it! Climb and enjoy

So cool. This was the temple that my friend recommended to me, she said to make sure that I get to this one. To be honest, I don't think that my driver would have let us miss it, but I am happy that we got to see it. It was beautiful, as the name implies. As usual for the Angkor complex, make sure you have plenty of water with you.

Big historical site, so many temples, each has its own story. No wonder, some visitors bought 3days, 7days entrance pass. I bought one day pass and it really exhausting to visit BOTH Angkor Wat (main iconic site) and also Angkor Thom (another site which consists of many smaller temples). If you have time to spend, take it slower, take it steady. The hot weather also make it difficult to go too fast around temples.

Large temple although not as intricate. The most prominent feature of this place is Bayon temple with many places, but even besides that, the walls of the "city", the large buddhist sculpture, the entrance to the "city"...all these are worth touring. It is vast so you will need a transportation, but if you have time, go to these places within Angkor Thom after visiting the famous Bayon temple.

The Most Magical Temple at Angkor Wat!. Angkor Thom was the most magical of the three main temples at Angkor Wat. We walked in and were not prepared for what was going to happen. We had a driver for the day taking us from one site to the next but we were on our own to visit the site. We were approached by a tour guide working there, his name was Yort Domdin, and he introduced himself and offered his service. His English was excellent and he started describing the history of the temple with a great sense of humor. He offered to show us more spots and explained what the history was behind this beautiful place. Yort took us around the temple in a way I would have never visited the site and was staging us in strategic poses for pictures. He was really entertaining and caught up the attention of other tourists nearby. He took us to the royal room, a dark place where the Buddha statue is standing and where you can pray and connect with this vibrant temple. Yort told us about the spirituality and the meaning of the design, while we were surrounded by smiling statues everywhere you'd look. The experience lasted two hours and I got the most amazing pictures, thanks to Yort and his hospitality. It was well worth his reasonable fee and I highly recommend his service and take the time to visit the temple with him!

Excellent. You feel as if you are on the set of a movie when you come here. The temple is absolutely amazing. One definitely should get a tour guide to really appreciate it and see all of the different things at the temple that you may have missed if you were to do it by yourself.

Fascinating . Enter via the main gate with the bridge of snakes, demons and gods. Watch out for the crowds as this can be hectic as a main attraction. Definitely worth the visit - one of the principal temples/complex.
Fantastic. I just seem to be saying the same thing for all the temples. They are really a sight to be seen and truly awe inspiring. Visit!
Absolutely amazing!. I liked this temple more than Angkor Wat and all of the others. It is absolutely breathtaking and is not to be missed! The details are spectacular

Angkor Thom - heritage worth to see. It is a nice walk to savorthe renmants of the past. There are certain spots where you can take photos with special effects. Very interesting. A place worth to visit and spare some more time.

Just as incredible as Angkor Wat. What an amazing city this would have been in its time. There is so much history and the temple ruins are unbelievable. The are elephant rides going around the city if you like, price was in US$ and from memory is was expensive - we did not do it.
Excellent!. Of all the temples visited THIS was the stand out winner. Less crowds also helped but a n essential to add to the list of sites to visit.

On a Floating Moat? Amazing!!!. This is HUGE and full of great stories waiting for you to hear and experience. There are translators everywhere to be found in many languages, you will be surprised when you enter and find out you still haven't seen the real thing. See for your self and enjoy!

Many the best Temple. I conducted the site visit on the second day of my presence in Angkor and in the preamble to visit Bayon. Here is a summary of the main sites and evidence of the infinite diversity of Angkor. Elephants and their mahouts allow visitors in search of exoticism to approach the shrines and swaying to the slow pace of pachyderms. On my side, my tuk-tuk driver dropped me at the entrance, inviting me to join my visit ended at the other end of the scope. Angkor Thom justifies devotes the necessary time not forgetting to be well fitted, head covered, and for thinking of his supply of water.

Amazing. Another stunning gem in the Siem Reap Historical Park. The history of this area is best explored with the help of a local guide who will know the ins and outs of the site and be able to point out things the casual visitor would miss. A great place for history lovers and photographers.

A complex consisting several temple!. Angkor Thom is a complex consisting several temples, some of which are amazing! The gates are decorated with the famous smiling-face with sculptures gods and Asuaras.
Stunning. The sheer volume of work and detailed nature of it all is incredible to observe. Loved the entrance bridges and the religious underpinnings behind them.

One of the major must-sees in the Angkor complex. It's the Wandering Yank here. Mrs. Yank and I spent a wonderful 3 days touring the Angkor complex, and this was our first destination. Highlights include the Victory Gate, Bayon and Baphuon temples, the Elephant Terrace and the Leper King Terrace. Where to begin? Everything is spectacular in its own right. Give yourself plenty of time, and during the hot months, start early!!!2 enthusiastic thumbs up!
Stunning. Smiling faces.Impressive work in Cambodia. if you are a history-lover, this is the best place ever..
Another Temple but worth a look. To stand the test of time, through wars, weather and people. These buildings are amazing and interesting. To sit and ponder on life way back when.
Trip a deal tour. My favourite temple from my recent trip to Siem Reap Cambodia. The way these temples were made so long ago are amazing with so much culture and history.

Impressive. As I mentioned in my comments, it is impressive all the temples of Angkor and this is no exception.Stunning state after long time of neglect, but important to note that are needed urgent conservation work.
Woow!!!!. It`s an amazing construction. So many details. So many thing to see inside. I loved it. It was my favourite.
Another Cambodian Temple. There is no shortage of temples in the Siem Reap area, each one unique with its own story to tell. Make sure you have a local guide to tell you that story.

Another wonder.. We were lucky enough to have Angkor Thom on our tour list and the visit didn't let us down, another fine example of Khmer architecture. This structure covers 10 square kilometres inclosed by a wall and wide moats. Along the way we stopped at the Terrace of Elephants and Terrace of Leper Kings also the Baphuon temple, and the Bayon Temple as well, with the giant stone faces smiling down at us from every angle. Its a great place to explore and learn about the history of the fascinating place, one not to be missed.

Do not miss it.. This is not far from Angkor Wat and it is absolutely worth visiting. It is different and you can wander around the various passageways and tunnels like an explorer. There are many great photo opportunities. A tip : ask which gate that you enter.. North, West etc, so you can ask when you wish to leave as it is very easy to get lost.

A different style of temple again. Having done Angkor, Banyon and this on the one day they all had their own features. This one had a nature blend as trees have grown amongst the stone work. As they have got larger their roots have broken parts of the building...the might of nature. Some very interesting photo opportunities with massive root systems that resembled an octopus.
One of the favourites!. Very different, as are all the temples, none of the six we visited were alike and all spectacular in their own way, even the small ones, but Thom was superb!

Holidays. Angkor Thom is a beautiful place.The temple tells a thousand words.History is sculptured on the walls.The ancient architecture reminds us of the present era that nothing is impossible if done with great determinations.

You'll have to go back to Siem Reap if you missed this. Everything looks so geometric but yet organically beautiful- take lots of pictures and marvel at how well the temple design photographs. Highly recommned hiring a tour guide for all temple visits; it's rather difficult to get by without hired transport too.
Life time experience. In Angkor Area only. One can visit with Angkorvat Temple. Life time experience. never miss this. One can enjoy.

Stunning. Incredible architecture and bas reliefs, mind blowing that it is 1000 years old and still in such amazing condition. Definitely recommend hiring a local guide to explain the stories depicted in the bas reliefs to get a better understanding of the history.

Fantastic place!!. Magnificent views of history...the Eleohant wall and Bayan temple are awesome...many small and interesting attractions. This rivels the massive Angkor Wat facility out front if nit for sheer size and scope. Must see.
A Photographer's Dream. Angkor Thom is so beautiful with all of the stone faces everywhere. There's so much to see while there.
Our favorite smiling Buddahs everywhere. Don't miss this one, our favorite with all of the Buddah faces! Loved the carvings, get a guide and enjoy!
Match your nose. It is intriguing that everyone tries to get picture of their noses in contrast with the faces on the towers!,

Breath taking !. We marveled at the statues and the construction of this temple. The faces built into the walls, the intricate stone work. Just beautiful. Our guide explained the meanings of the carvings in the stone work with so much detail. It was very interesting. Walk all around and take the opportunity when it arises to go up the stairs and check out the views from higher as well.

Magnifient collection of temples. "The Great City" ...that's what they called it. HUGE... about 4 square miles of ruins/temples. I think my fave was Bayon. Must do! Gets hot as blazes FYI. Take lots of water and if you are here for more time than we were my TIP is to break it up.

Possibly even better than Angkor Wat?!. The carvings are remarkable. The setting is stunning. The size is unbelievable. Recommend getting transport. I hired a tuk-tuk for the whole morning for about $15, he took me around the whole site, waiting for me at each place and dropped me to and from my hostel in Siem Reap. Bargain!

My favourite. This is our 2nd visit to Siem Reap and this was the temple I wanted to get back to the most. This time we had no guide (though this is great for 1st time visit) and spent more time just sitting and taking it all in....I find this a very spiritual place...cant wait to come back again one day. Best photo opportunity would be early morning late avo.Take plenty of water and hydrolite tablets which help keep up your energy for visiting all the temples....April was very hot
Beautiful!. A must see if you go to Cambodia! was very hot ...114 degrees the day we were there.. lots of people tho so go early if you can I think it opens at 530am!

fortified city. the fortified city of Angkor thom has 5 entrances with the south entrance being the most popular and widely used one. the city of Angkor thom houses temples likes Bayon, Phimeanakas, Baphuon and Preah Palilay and Tep Pranam. the terrace of the elephants was used by the kings for the review of the military. the walls of the terrace is decorated with life size sandstone images of the elephants in a procession. there are images of tigers, lions, serpents, garuda also on the walls. a great place for some god photography.

Most Interesting. All of the Temples were unbelievable, however Angkor Thom resonated the most with me. I got there early with the sunrise and the light was perfect and there weren't many visitors yet. The faces and the engravings were outstanding and the overall condition of the Temple made it easy to view and investigate.

Beautiful temple. Absolutely worth a visit - even if you aren't into history - the pure size, detailed carvings and massive overgrown trees are a spectacular sight. Well worth a visit, but make sure you have a knowledgeable guide to take you! (And make sure your shoulders are covered and legs down to your knees are covered, or you can't go in)
Must see. Not as amazing as Angkor Wat but the entrance to Angkor Thom you can see the elephants walking and the history facts is really amazing. Don't miss it.

The city which housed Angkor Wat. Angkor meaning Capital and Thom meaning City (Wat meaning Temple), this was the actual city in which it's temple (Angkor Wat) resided and became famous... it's full of unparalleled beauty - with a slew of temples and walls and bridges to explore. You will spend most of your time here during your visit to Angkor!
Amazing. A beautiful temple with lots of history. Would recommend a guide to learn about the building and history of the temples.

Beautiful and Informative. We loved Angkor Thom. We hired a tour guide through Sam's tours named Han Heik, and he was able to give us so much information on the whole area, so it made the visit very informative and worthwhile. We are so glad we were able to spend time here and recommend it for anyone traveling to this area!

Another temple. But they are all unique., For some perspective, definitely read the book or get it from one of the guides, plus pick up the $1 DVD from one of the many shops in Siem reap that describes the past of the Khmer kingdom. It will give you a new perspective of the amazing accomplishments of these ancient people

Beautiful and amazing place. It's an amazing place, very beautiful as the whole of Angkor. But there is also a lot of tiny temples to see nearby. Sometimes you're all alone there and seems to be the first to be here and to discover these amazing stones in the jungle.
Amazing Temple. Perhaps one of my favorite temples. It's heavy shaded and ingrown. Best time to avoid the crowds is mid-day. The hiking trails nearby are nice.

NEVER RIDE ELEPHANTS. The temples are breathtaking and you should allow a few days to visit them properly and deserve a proper dive in history/mythology of the region. Reading a book/wikipedia page and visiting a museum in Angkor Wat is recommended beforehand as guides mostly are not very knowledgeable with very few exceptions. Most importantly noone should ever ride elephants there. This is the most cruel thing to do and you are literally murdering these animals if you do this. An elephant has died on one of these attractions recently. We visited in March and you could see how exhausted those animals were. I still regret I didn't go and try to stop them. If people cannot move their own fat up the mountain, then maybe they can do without that mountain.

Fascinating. We went to many temples during our visit in Cambodia but this was the largest. In addition, we did the elephant ride which was a real thrill for the children. The children also fed the elephants pineapples.
Another amazing temple. Yet another amazing temple with so many great carvings, these people were just amazing. Lots of walking but well worth it.
Large stone sculptures.. This is a great display of large faces and the story behind these is well worth looking up before you go.

Another beautiful archaeological site. Another beautiful archaeological site in this historical medieval Khmer capital. Not as large as Angkor Wat, though in my opinion much more intimate and personal site to visit and contemplate in. I'd dedicate 2 hours for the site and then dine in one of the nearby open air Cambodian restaurants. Traditional Khmer dishes are definitely worth trying!

Lots to see. Angkor Thom was our second favorite set of temples. There is so much to see here and plenty of places to buy things. There's also many places to eat here, although most cater to tourists and charge US prices.

Great temples, but you'll need a tour guide.. Great temples if you have a knowledgeable tour guide. You can walk through most of the temple areas, unlike Angkor Wat, where a lot of the areas are closed off to walker. Lots of great history here. Very hot.

Another must see to complete the experience.. You must see all the major temples to complete the story. Angkor Thom is one of them. It is Buddhist in style with many Buddha faces. An easier temple to explore than a couple of the others but is no less impressive than any. See them all as they complete the experience.

Interesting visit. I found it very interesting to learn about Cambodia's history through visiting these ancient relics. Our guide was very knowledgeable. It is a very popular attraction and therefore very busy but worth it. It was extremely hot when we went there.
temples.. again great place to visit. camera needed,water, biscuits. take your time or you'll miss lot's where good shoes.
Visit Angkor Wat first. Beautiful historical place. If you are a history buff all these temples will blow your mind away. Really beautiful temples.
Beautiful and breath-taking. A small place. You won't need much time but it's a 'must see' place. Go early to avoid the other tourists, so you can get good photos too.
Nice stone faces. 30 minutes is long enough for this .... no guide required and has some very steep steps and unsteady ground ... be careful :)
Impressive . There are 8 parts to this temple. Stunning views from the top of the temple that you can climb to. Takes approximately 2/3 hours to go round the site so take plenty of water

Obviously you have to go.. Angkor Thom is a must in the Angkor loop, particularly if you are visiting for 2-3 days. Personally, this was not in my Top 3 Temples of Angkor but I can see why this is one of most people's favorites. I did not like how some of the temple and bridge had been recently restored (think ash-colored asphalt amongst ancient stone). I did appreciate the stunning bridge leading up to the temple. This was different than the other temples. Angkor Thom does have more information available, which can make it more interesting (though more crowds)! If you go to Angkor, you will likely end up here at some point.

A city site with the fabulous faces of King Jayavarman V11. The jewel in the crown of this site are the many serene faces of (probably) King Jayavarman V11 who had the site built. There were originally 49 towers each showing four sides of his face - about 200 representations. It's fabulous. There's a little bit of climbing to be done to get to the heads and then more walking to move through other parts of Angkor Thom. It takes about an hour to an hour and a half to explore depending on interest.
Great. Another great temple. Magnificent carvings especially the faces on the bridge over the water. Very hot and busy.

Heavenly!. Make sure you wear sensible walking shoies because you will want to explore every part of this! and take lots of water as the weather is dehydrating - but just beautiful! To be somewhere that has so much history You can almost feel the ghosts of the ancestors wafting around you and lifting your spirits - like the Cambodians overall - they are positive and hopeful
Absolutely AWESOME!. Hire a local guide and you will learn so many fabulous facts and history about the Temple. They will take you to the best spots for pictures that will be with you forever!
Best in the group. I love Angkor Wat - Everyone does. But this beats the dream. It is more than what (Wat?!) I wanted. Go. Get coffee. Not beer - it's to damn hot!
Learning architecture . Architectures are really brilliant and a lot of faces everywhere. Architects drew the painting on the wall by stones are interesting.
Old City. About 2 miles away frm Angkor Wat. It was the residence of the Khmer King. There were hospital, library & schools. Unbelievable.

Angkor Thom- for History lovers. Angkor Thom is A massive site spread over large forest area..Entrance is by South Gate With Gian Face Entrance and its has many important site inside ..Bayon Temple , Phimeanakas, Royal Palace, Terrace of Elephants, Terrace of leaper Kings,Baphuon..prasat ruins..Angkor Thom is included in Short circuit trip in a day.

Our wonderful tour guide Mr Chaan . If you do stay at the privilege floor of Borei Angkor hotel ask for Mr Chaan to take you to these amazing temples and once palace's. He is a truly articulate and chatting lovely guide. We hired him for two days and he took us to all the sites we wanted to see. His knowledge of the history of the place is brilliant. He was waiting by a beautiful air conditioned car at the end of every historic visit we made, with freezing cold flannels and ice cold water. Which was such a relief after 40° heat and no air.He made suggestions of what and when to see, to avoid the crowds and see it in the best possible light. He even offered to pick us up at 4.30am to take us to Angkor Wat to see the sun rise. Which we politely refused. He was a wonderful man. Thank you Mr Chaan.

Angkor Thom - an amazing remain of a past kingdom . Angkor Thom is an amazing place, 9 square kilometers of forest and temple ruins surrounded by city wall. When you are inside the city walls you sense the greatness of the long gone Khmer Kingdom, there are plenty of places for a full day visit, but save the magnificent Bayon Temple for the sunset.

Hugely impressive. This is more of a complex rather than an individual attraction. Impressive history on a grand scale and needs a local guide to really get the most from your time here, or a really good guide book. There is so much to see in what was really an ancient city, with so much ancient culture for the imagination to deal with.This area was one of the highlites of our 11 day trip to Cambodia.
so many temples in this area. fascinating - my favourite was Baphoun. A large area so need transport to get around. It is much too hot to walk

Have to see it to appreciate. What an amazing place. From a distance it is great but when you get close and see the intricate carvings on the stone work it takes it to a new level. So many stories told on these walls of the daily life of these people.
Amazing ruins of temples long ago.. These ruins show the size and height of the ancient temples of Cambodia. Many steps and no comfort facilities. A must see on your tour of Cambodia.
Great Site. This is a site that covers many temples. You need a tuk tuk to take you around. Fantastic and a must see.
One not to miss. This is one of the temple complexes not to miss. One can stand and just stare in amazement at the skill and beauty crated from past rulers ego
Big place. It will take most of a day to visit the various sights, but save Bayon for near sunset. Our guide then provided a boat tour on the moat with the best G&T ever. See it all and enjoy.

Unique Angkorian art and architecture. It's a great place to visit as it's full of spectacular and interesting terraces of legendary ruins where you can see walls full of intricate carving. This is a 'must see' temple and takes a few hours to walk around.

Massive and even just the gates are worth exploring if nothing else. So this is a massive temple area with four massive gates rich in story and history. There is so much to see once inside, however take the time to stop and explore the entrances and exists. It is beautiful and I wish I was back there! (even with the 40degree temperature!)

Great To Visit - However Not in April! . The visit to Angkor Thom requires the visitor to be physically fit as there were a significant number of stairs to get up close to the sculptures. Room to wander and elephants take tourists around the relics. Not sure if they were treated kindly as it was so hot. Great guide Mr Sophanna (Miker) provided a great foundation of information and endured we were collected quickly after each visit given the heat in April. Worth a visit!

Amazing Temple. Worth checking this temple out, rich history. Worth getting a tour, there was someone there leading brief tours for donations. The temple is very worthy to visit. Especially our guide is very professional in guiding us to one of great temple in Cambodia. They descrisped about temple that is clarity to what you may not be able to understand on your own.

Great! See tip if traveling with kids under 12. The Bayon Temple is the highlight, which I have reviewed separately, so this review is on the remainder of Angkor Thom. The Grand Palace is the highlight of the remainder, but please know that if you are traveling with kids under 12 (the ones who don't require a ticket), then know your child will not be allowed in the Grand Palace due to the arbitrarily judged steeper stairs. There is no notification of that until you take the long hot walk over the long bridge to the entrance, so you can plan accordingly in advance to either not make the full long walk at all or to split up/have one parent at a time go. The views from the top are amazing.

Wonderful. One of a must stops if you are in Angkor for just a day (if you are there for more than a day, everything is a must stop). When we were here there were a lot less people here than in Angkor Wat, but you still cannot expect to enjoy it in silence

Very interesting and not crowded. Take your time to look at all the faces that make up the temple, and all the detail carved into the walls. There is more detail than Angkor Wat. Many children selling various items, they are friendly and persistent. Spending only a couple dollars solves the issue immediately and is the best way to go.

loved being able to explore. Really enjoyed visiting Angkor Thom and being able to look through the site at my own time and could climb through the site and take some fantastic photos.it was really hot but the air flowed through the temples and facescan ride there on a elephant but once i found out they work all day - i wouldnt support.i really enjoyed the attraction
Excellent. Awesome place to visit. Home of tomb raider and the only temple left as they were found, with trees growing through it etc.
Less tourists. Bit more space to wander around. We had a guide with us an his information made this visit more interesting

Another must see. A huge complex, a guide is a good idea to get the most out of temple visits. Well worth the time spent here. All the main temples have good toilet facilities, places to eat and tourist stalls!

Majestic. Awe-inspiring as you walk towards one of the gates and the 8m high wall that surround this ancient city. The Bayon Temple is situated in its exact centre. A slow walk, amongst the cicadas, singing in the trees, is a lovely way to spend some time in this beautiful complex.
Amazing history. This is so impressive, with so much history. How these were built back in the 12th century is just amazing.
amazing. What an amazing experience, very hot tho and a lot of walking, bring plenty of water and comfy shoes. My favourite of all the spectacular temples.
just amazing. one of the most wonderful temple city in the World. its just World of wonders. very very big temple city so you have to give 2-3 days for this place in your vacation plan.

Amazing artefacts. Not pleasant visit in April.
Extremely hot and the climb to the top on the stairs provided was taxing under the heat.
One need to imagine at its peak of power, the grandeur of the khmer kingdom at that time.

Temple ruins - Faces. Nice day trip to Angkor Thom.
Had a nice tour and photo shots taken in this interesting place.
Good to go in morning when it is not so hot. We went in the afternoon and it was extremely "sweaty"
Mysterious Smile. Thousands of different Khmer smiles and Apsara sculptures. Different people have different feeling. Too hot scenery spot that only at noon can visit silently

Stunning. You must make time to see this temple. By the time you get to it most of the tourists have disappeared and it is just you and your guide. Truly fabulous. Absolutely amazing, untouched and hidden by trees. I hope they don't clear any more trees... Too much clearing has been done.

Like the 4 headed statues. Cant go inside for a cmoser look at the statues but you just stay outside the wall and take pics. Go early in morning or else it gomets really humid n hit from the sun. Wear hat sunblock smsun glasses.
Amazing. Once in a life time experience, a must see for all. Just stood there in amazement and tried to absorb it all.

A Top Temple. The thing that will probably impress you the most are the massive stone faces with that smiling image that are all over the place. There are 200 of them. Make sure to see the Elephant Terrace and the Terrace of The Leper King.

Spectacular!!!. This temple is part of the Angkor Wat Temple complex and not to be missed!!!! The magnitude of the temple and its spectacular sculptures are a photographer and artist's dream. Even those with minimal knowledge and interest will be overwhelmed by this Unesco World Heritage site!!!

See to believe !. When you go to Siem Reap and do the temple tours, you only get to choose so much as there are thousand of temples. This is one of the top 5. You can pay for a day pass, or more... If you have limited time, do this one on the first day. You don't want to miss it! Very amazing!
Huge ancient city!. This was the largest city in the area at the time. The faces carved (or built) into the structures are amazing. Don't miss the Elephant Terrace in Angkor Thom as well.
another temple site not to missed. like all the other ruins around angkor just simply amazing - i keep going back to see again - another site not to be missed

start from Terrace of Leper King and end at Bayon.... It's quite big complex..we started from Terrace of Leper King after we've had our lunch ==> (stalls in front of this temple were quite good comparing with the ones at Angkor wat. Some tourists used their hammock and took a nap there ;-))It's quite different with the other temples. Bring water, it's a long walk from Leper King to Bayon, especially under the sun and you make some stops at each temple.

Magnificent a most. We did a group visit with a local guide who provided excellent historical information and an overview of what areas were being restored. An amazing experience imagining how people constructed the buildings and how they were lost for centuries.

Our favorite temple. This temple complex was great. So much variety and just really fun to walk the trail in between the temples and scramble up to the top of several. My teenager liked this stop the best, despite the heat. Bayon is the gem, but lots of fun to be had and not difficult to see the whole thing on foot.

brilliant site with the trees strangling the brickwork. another fantastic temple with the brickwork intertwined with the trees, many terraces are collapsed but some areas being restored,very hot when we went 40+c but some shade in the buildings, see one buddha where you can have your photo taken and it appears that you are kissing the statue!! and its 40ft from the ground
Another amazing historical site. Amazing historic Khmer city. Make sure you have a guide or have done research beforehand so you can truly appreciate everything you see.

Not my cup of tee.....sorry. The visit did nothing for or to me even though I had read the information about it before we went, while sadly the place was not in good condition and you had to be careful where you stepped.

Good and Evil. We loved the road leading up to and through the gate with its stone images, good on one side and evil on the other. Through the gate to the left climb up and see the carvings close up, great for photos, don't miss it
Lesser known than AW. This temple is close to AW but lesser known. I appreciated the carvings and the ruins, but once it gets very hot early and its hard to really give the place justice.
Another awesome experience . This place could take you days to check out. Lots of smaller temples. Go with a good guide. Start out early in the morning and beat the crowds and less heat. So worth it.

Amazing!. Loved it. Visited this and other temples with my family after visiting Angkor Wat in the morning and my 15 year old daughter said this one was her favourite! Definitely impressive and worth the trip.

Brilliant. Did this as part of our 1 day tour pass all the temples are amazing
We felt one day was enough , depending on what you want :)

the most impressive temple of them all. We left to Siem Reap to see Angkor Wat, but we were more impressed by the beautiful Angkor Tom. The details of the faces and the whole complex have something magical.
Huge heads abound at this temple. Another one not to be missed even in the heat of Cambodia. Probably a bit easier to navigate than some others.

Nice area to stroll around. Our tuk tuk give us advice to first visit Angkor Thom. Angkor Thom is an ancient city mainly by King Jayavarman VII around 1200 was built. Within the walls of the city are a number of interesting temples. He said we can walk around and will need a few hours to do that. We reach the south gate of Angkor Thom. The south gate is thoroughfares commuting for tuk tuks and cars with tourists. At the gates a huge face and other carved head images are visible at the top of the gate tower. We spent a lot of time in Angkor Thom area, there is so much to see. Several temples are adjacent to it. Bayon, Baphuon, Phimeanakas, the Royal Palace, Elephants Terrace, Leper King Terrace

Politicians worshipped. Every politician's dream came true here because the myriad huge faces carved on stone were "politicians who became gods" my guide explained. This part of the large complex that comprises Angkor Wat features daily life more than religious life. Carvings show people at work, fishing, baking, boating or at play playing chess and other activities. I found these depictions more fascinating and historical than all the religious figures and dancing girls at the Angkor Wat complex. One should really have more time than most tours take to see all of the buildings and their decorations.
Great photos. Very interesting place. Amazing how the king had all the faces in his image. Definitely worth a visit but try to get there at a time when there are not so many people.
Great history!. The entrance to this temple was a long bridge with stone carvings on either side.... on the left were pleasant faces, on the right were angry images.

Massive complex, and a day on it's own to fully appreciate. This is by far the largest ground coverage in the Temple complex. It is actually a city. We only had a hour or so, so really scratched the surface. get a guide or read up before you go to gain all the little nuggets of detail.The central Bayon is not in great shape, but it is like a maze. Plan longer than you think and as previously mentioned by many others take plenty of water.

Awesome. This site contains several amazing temples such as Bayon and Baphuon. An absolute must see. Would strongly recommend a guide rather than just wandering around, to give some background and other information.
Amazing . Another beauty ...No review is needed!! It may worth in investing some $$$ and book a guide. They will explain a lot about the history of Cambodia
Amazing!. This temple is famous for its faces on the towers and definitely lives up to its reputation - found myself saying "wow!" around almost every corner! Really amazing for photo ops.
great. Angkor Thom is my favourit temple i really interest this temple so much but during my trip this temple is to many people
Better without the Scaffolding. Obviously, and due to the dilapidated nature of the temple, restoration work being carried out on site detracted from the spectacle it could have been.
amazing. a long long day of walking but so worth it - far too much to take in in one visit - need good shoes and lots of drinking water.
Capital of the empire. This is not a temple, but a city surrounded by an huge huge man-made moat.Several temples are located within its compound.DO not miss!
Worth it!. Definitely worth the effort of negotiating the small steep step to see those amazing faces up close. The detail and carvings that tell a story are awe inspiring. A favourite!

The biggest of them all. Ankor Thom is SO much bigger than what you expect looking at it on a map. I believe it's something like 9 square kilometers, with a LOT to see within it's walls. Bayon definitely being my favorite! I also really loved the elaborate gates with their smiling buddha faces. I watched the sunset over the moat at the South Gate several evenings. I also found the "Dead Gate" to be completely un-touristed and peaceful and etherial, with just a small dirt path leading in to it! One could easily spend a whole day in Angkor Thom alone.

Not to be missed. It's easy to combine with one of the other temples, like the Bayon. It's an impressive complex, but best to be done in the beginning of your visits, before the more beautifull decorated temples.
Just WOW.....!!!. The place is breathtaking....no words, blogs, notes can justify the magic....Be there to relive the history ..
So many temples but don't miss this one. All of the faces make this temple unique. Not another temple I saw had these like a four sides clock.
Truly Amazing. Another temple not to be missed - quite different and well worth a visit. The faces here are ethereal, a photographer's dream.
Another great temple. We did this straight after Angkor Wat. There are interesting differences to each temple. A good guide is essential

A very large area to cover ... Thom means big and it is big.... This is a very large area and has heaps of temples within its boundary. The biggest is Bayon. The next is bauphon which is approached by a Long walk way. This is the only one where they checked whether clothing was suitable. Walking through the forested area the next was Phimenakas. We then headed out to view the Terrace of the Elephants. All extremely interesting.
not popular. One of lots of temples. Not popular, not incredible so if you dont have a lot of time you can skip this one
Beautiful archealogical site. A very important archealogical site, a must when visiting the region. Large site, hot during the day.

Big heads. What I remember most are the huge heads sculpted into the temples. Similar to Angkor Wat but also easily distinguishable. I'd give five stars but it was so crowded. Dress lightly, it is hot and humid and there is a lot of walking and some climbing.
Best temple: Angkor Thorm - Basat Bayon. There are lots of good spots for scenery photos and portraits. No need to climb too high and no queues as well when we came here in the afternoon.
Just Stunning. The site is stunning and the land surrounding it is vast. Would suggest wearing sensible footwear as if you wish to you can climb up similar to Angkor Wat.

Everyone is there but there is a reason. Not going would be like going to Paris without visiting the Eiffel Tower. These wonders are not to be miss. Of course as most of the sites it is crowded with tourist but try the end of morning and 80% are gone leaving you with some space to take some nice pictures !

Angkor Thom. This site is amazing, with all the faces carved into the stonework, must see in person! The size of the trees and their trunks were fascinating, trees that were hundreds of years old, roots grown into and unto the exterior of the temples.
Fantastic entrance. This is all about that gate, of course, but also some interesting carvings inside. Smaller than Angkor Wat, it's still well worth a visit.

Magnificent. If this temple had been anywhere else in the world it would have been the main attraction. Now it's rated second beacause of Angkor Wat. Rent a bike and enjoy the temples. It's easy and gives you all the freedom you need.

Great Temple. Another impressive structure with very interesting exterior, to be honest I was tired from all the stairs climbing in the temples before Angkor Thom, I had no courage to walk on top of it and see the view. To see it all the way it deserves you need to spend more than 2 days in Siem Reap.

Massive place. We hear about Angkor Wat but not about the other temples in the area. Angkor is 3 kilometers square with the Bayon Temple in the centre. You really cannot separate the two. The size is impressive.
Family visit. Oh oh, Cambodia has so many temples. I spent few days in Siem Reap but it is still not enough time to visit those temples. I may spend more days to see these wonderful ones.
Faces all around . Big old time city. .. must see ..has a beautiful Bayon temple in the complex. . Must must see.... can't imagine what the guys in those days were upto.

Love everything . Prefer to have a local guide who can lecture you while visiting the temple . Buy a travel book and read it before you get there. That place is amazing and yes, a wonder place for humans kind.
Amazing. One of the best places that i have ever visited and not been re built unlike ankor wat. A must for anyone travelling in cambodia
Smiling Budha. Really loved this place with its smiling faces looking down at you from a greats height, well kept....

Impressive Structure. Structure is impressive. The place is full of sculptures designed and created by ancient kingdom. It was great to have a glimpse of an ancient world. It felt like we can connect to these people long gone through places such as this. And these structures served as a silent witnesses to changing times and era. Umbrella will come in handy in case you come here during midday.

3 Day Tour, day 2.. Great experience. Part of he biggest religious site in the world. Get there early to have some space to yourself. Of the temples in Angkor Wat this is one of the best with Buddha looking out into the 4 cardinal directions. Its easy to just get carried away taking photographs but stand back and look too.

Beautiful Ruins. I visited Angkor Thom while visiting Angkor Wat, well worth the addition time to visit this site which is only a mile or so along the road. Beautiful site which is much more compact than Angkor Wat. There are quite a few steps as you walk through the site. I could have spent hours here wandering around the fascinating carvings and sculptures

Carved faces everywhere! Amazing place!. This place is huge, since the entrance you'll be amazed by the statues that surround the bridge entrance. And once you get to Angkor Thom, you'll see many structures with 4 faces beautifully carved. If you are in Cambodia you must visit this place and I garantee you'll be amazed by this beautiful place

Lovely day seeing wonderful sites. Thoroughly enjoyed our day seeing the sites at Angkor Thom. I have been to many world heritage sites and seen magnificent ancient structures - this is right up there with the best. I would highly recommend a visit to this attraction and take your time to go through it at a leisurely pace. I would also recommend doing it with a guide - he added significant value and gave the necessary context to what we were seeing.
Brilliant . Love this. 3 temples together - very interesting ! Love the crafted stone! Amazing! Keep clear of the unofficial guides who will attach to you! Quite safe to do by yourself

All part of the temple trail. You just cant come here and not visit these places. Each one is different but on a similar theme but still equally impressive at the construction and detail. Buy the book 'Ancient Angkor' it is worth it

Culture, religion, old civilizations. Very interesting place to visit, recommended to go with a Tour guide as the history is very interesting, you can miss a lot of small details that a guide will be able to point out, and that adds value to the visit.
Bayon is an architectural marvel. best time to visit in the early morning. its so beautiful and heavily carved. it is the temple of faces
Great. Another worth a visit. All part of the complex another history filled experience with great carvings to follow the Hindu stories.
Stunned. We didn't reliase that this was the biggest part of the ancient city lot of walking and climbing but the overall site will be something to stay in the memories for ever

Angkor Thom tour . I loved Angkor Thom, especially the Bayon temple complex, with the enigmatic faces of Buddha.
Be sure to come early before 7 am, before bus loads of tourists arrive. They are sometimes unruly and extremely noisy.

Wonderful carvings. This temple has wonderful gates to the area. The temple has many towers, all carved with faces looking in all directions. All temples are so well preserved considering their great age.

My lifetime dream come true: a visit to Angkor Thom. My trip to Cambodia was very memorable because I have realized my dream. I have always want to come here and whenever you see these ancient temples in National Geographic magazine, he get so enticed. The trip was made easy because I was fortunate to find a good Taxi driver by the name of Saroeun and his number is 0985-00554. He was very reasonable and compared to USA the daily rate ,unbelievably cheap. I have found that visiting Cambodia now is really affordable since food and everything is cheap. I would recommend this place to anyone but be little careful when you enter the Siem Reap Airport as some official may be act inappropriately like misguiding you..

oneof the "must see" temples. I would recommend seeing any and all the temples on your list PRIOR to visiting Angkor Wat...because after Angkor wat, the rest pale in comparison. That said, Angkor Thom is magnificent!As for ALL temples in Cambodia...dress appropriately, take lots of fluids with you., read up on the (required) dress code, prepare for lines at some, and be prepared to be blown away.

Check out the one budda that is smiling and has teeth!. Secret........the budda is located on a western wall near the bath on the south side of the temple. Smiling apshara with teeth! Be sure to get the obligatory nose to nose photo op!

Huge sprawling citadel, with Bayon at its heart. There's a lot to Angkor Thom and its worth having at least a couple of hours (more if you can) to wander round the parts of it other than Bayon. You'll want at least an hour for Bayon itself, which is the highlight but also the busiest area.
My favorite temple because of Bayon. When visiting Angkor Wat be sure to go on to Angkor Thom. THe center is Bayon, and has four-sided statues with the face of the king who built it. Very cool smile.
Another mystical temple. This place was also very beautiful and unique. I loved the smiling faces. It was such a fun experience.

If you like temples you will like this one. Such a different feeling to this place, as compared to the other temples. Specifically, I'm talking about Bayan in Angkor Thom. The faces looking at you is just so much different than any of the other temples.
Great photo opportunities. Possibly the most photogenic temple in the complex. The massive stone faces are characteristic of the temples and tend to be what you associate with Angkor Wat.

A Capital worthy of the name. It is important to understand the purpose and chronology of each of the Temples and monuments in the Greater Angkor area. Time spent letting your imagination and vision of the period of its construction and use will enhance your visit.
Wonderful. Extraordinary place with carvings and ruins and restructured temples everywhere.Water, compass and tuk tuk needed.
Different again.. Another site not to be missed. Sufficiently different to the others to make it well worth a visit with its spectacular gateways and terraces.

Along with Angkor Wat this is a can't miss visit, 7 temples/sites in a very small area and a few more very close. Angkor Thom-This is must see along with Angkor Wat, especially if you have limited time. Angkor Thom is a walled city with the iconic Bayon, with the large faces carved into the temple spires, Baphoun a large and impressive temple that has been recently restored, Phimeanakas , the royal palace and the elephant Terrace and Terrace of the Leper King. We entered vis the South Gate which has the large Buddha face carved to the entrance arch, and a bridge with 100 large figures lining the side of the bridge which depict a Hindu myth. Spent 7 days in Siem Reap including a 4 day guided tour and Angkor Thom is a top tier visit along with Angkor Wat. Also if you have limited time you could spend a worth while day or two just visiting Angkor Wat and Angkor Thom and the temples that are very close to Angkor Thom.
Amazing old temple. One of the most beautiful places in Angkor are, amazing old temple with smiling faces on walls :) This place, as well as Angkor Wat, is quite crowded
Another fine example of artistic skill. Impressive and interesting but quite tiring to get around the site especially in the heat. Needs quite a bit of time to enjoy the magnificence of the carvings.
Great attraction. . Just like Angkor wat. This is a must see temple. Tomb raider location and worth seeing on the unesco list. Good comfy shoes though essential.

Very Impressive and Interesting. I didn't need all day here (I saw Angkor Wat, Ta Prohm and Angkor Thom all in the same day) but it was great - even with the small crowds. It was super hot and humid on the day I was there so I highly recommend carrying water and wearing a hat or a visor.
Excellent. Another temple but with another completely different story. Go see the temples!! Go first thing in the morning you won't regret it.

Awesome. Amazing place to see how this could have been built in the middle of nowhere and it is well worth the visit to all sites in the area. Tried not to buy things from kids as they are encouraged to beg and sell so they don't need to go to school but it is a little sad to see how they live.
Angkor Thom. Very interesting archeologic site next to Angkor What , not a Temple like Angkor What, nor as large, but still an amazing place.

Angkor and Siem Riep. I have waited a long to time to get here. It's been on my list forever; I should have been here sooner. Unreal and surreal to be in the presence of these glorious temples. All I can say is GO.
Impressive all-day activity. Angkor tom is the place for a complete day trip. Many temples there, and most of them are different from each other.
Beautiful temple!. Really impressive to see. Temperature could be very moist, so be sure to bring some water. Definitely worth visiting!

Visit to Angkor Thom. Overview of towers with Buddha faces was really exhilarating experience. 49 towers though some of them have fallen down n few faces are damaged n hopefully restoration work takes place to make it even more visible beauty.

Beautiful and Inspiring. This was one of three that we went to and all of them are amazing and are a must to have on everyone's bucket list. I would recommend guided tours to get the most out of these amazing structures. The guides know the history so well.

One of our favourites!. There are so many temples to see in this region....they are so different and the history and background so interesting....make sure you have a guide with you to tell you all the important features of each one and take the time (if you have it) to travel to the outlying ones too.

One time Capital of the Khmer Empire. We visited Cambodia as part of a group tour in November, 2015. We were in Angkor Thom, the onetime capital city of the Khmer empire of the late twelfth century King Jayavarman VII. This has a complex of temples dedicated to Lord Buddha and is generally in ruins and is being restored with international help, including from India.

Temples at my own pace. Angor Thom is truly wonderful place but very busy also which is why I would suggest hiring a mountain bike/bicycle 3$ and doing the temples the opposite way round from the tourist circuit, this enhanced my experience a lot as i was able to get some decent pics without anyone in them.

Heavenly, calm, peaceful faces looming out of the jungle.. How could one not be impressed and moved by this temple, our favourite from all the wonderful temples in the Angkor complex?We were fortunate enough to have the services of a brilliant guide, Yann Sorn, with whom I had visited the temples 12 years previously. His excellent English, fund of stories and knowledge of the history, both the distant past and the more recent, brought the site to life. (Find him on LinkedIn.) We saw the sunset, sunrise, and many other temples, but Angkor Thom was the highlight.

Fantastic! Avoid the morning rush hour & visit late in the afternoon!. The biggest temple complex out of 3. Avoided morning rush hour by arriving at 3pm. Best decision ever but bear in mind the temples close at 6pm. We started the visit with Bayon temple. Continued to Baphuon & Royal palace. Very hot so come prepared (water, sunscreen, shading). If you want to enter the sacred Buddha chamber in Bayon temple bring smthg to cover your legs. Otherwise you can wear shorts & T-shirt and you can access the entire complex. Defo no flip-flops as some of the stairs are very steep!
Totally worth it. This one is also beautiful as the other temples. Worth a visit. If you wanna see the whole temple area, you need more than one day...

One of the best. 54 heads lining the road to the South entrance are spectacular, great photo opportunities, we stopped on the way from the entrance to the temple to hot graph the monkeys and a train of elephants.The temple and the stonework is fantastic, I would recommend taking a guide to get the full insight of this and the other temples.

Awesome!. This was such a cool temple to see! There are some great photo ops with the giant Buddha heads and be sure to explore some of the inner workings of the temple as there were quite a few monks there who were praying during the time that we were there. One of them even showed me the proper way to perform a Buddhist prayer then gave me an orange bracelet to tie around my wrist! Take the time to truly experience this place of worship!
Another spectacular temple at Siem Reap. This is on the way to Angkor wat and usually covered in the Angkor circuit. Definitely a must visit sight in the area

A must do. It is really worth a visit. Also try to dedicate some time for a visit as worth it. It is three main sections. Just follow the signs. Be prepared for the pyramid as it is a good climb on steep stairs. Do remember dress code as enforced. There are little shops at end near car park but remember to bargin hard!
Same, same....only different. More of the same.....rocks and trees and rocks and trees. Plus lot of people trying to sell you a guide book.
Not over restored. To me this was better than Ankor Wat temples. The carvings are far better as they were done in sections off site and then assembled. Whoever designed them was a genious
Our favorite temple. While we enjoyed those we visited, this was probably our favorite. We did not pre arrange for a tour guide. Found an excellent one at the site when we arrived.
Get it on the 1 day pass. Another 'must see' temple - lots of steps - great history and fantastic architecture - you see why this is one of the 'new wonders of the world'
A Must see in Siem Reap. Very busy but an amazing experience. Take plenty of water and covering as it is extremely hot with little shade. Wonderful

Intricate carvings and large faces!. Angkor Thom was beautiful. Form the intricate wall carvings that told stories of local life in Cambodia's history to the large faces which allowed for great touristy pictures! We also loved having sundowners while being paddled along the moat around Angkor Thom. A lovely was to watch the sun set.

Another humbling experience . The size of the whole place is impressive and the quality and planning that went on to build this city is mind boggling.
Visit in December.

Do NOT miss it. This tempe complex is fantastic. The Leper King Terrace and Elephant Terrace are some of the most intricate carvings (on large walls that go on forever). Can't imagine how many artisans or how long it took them to complete these spectacularly carved 10-foot tall walls.You have to see this temple plus Angkor Wat and Ta Prohm - and you can see all 3 in a 2-day visit (using a multi-day pass). Worth every minute and every penny.

Fantastic. In many ways, more appealing than Angkor Wat, somewhat more compact, an interesting combination of ruins and restoration with some amazing stories that go with it. Plan on walking unlevel steps in lots of heat, but again, it's worth it!
Gorgeous. Hot- bring lots of water, sunscreen, HAT ! Go early like 645-7 am. avoid the crowds-go all the way to the back and work your way to the front. get car and driver for day!!! AC is great!

Angkor Thom. Angkor Thom is a good appetizer before tackling Angkor Wat. We found our guide from Heritage Suites to be invaluable in helping us to appreciate everything there is to see. Ancient, influenced by many cultures over centuries, it was quite amazing and some of the staircases daunting. Do bring a hat and water!
Great detail. Really likes the carvings but with so many people crowded in it was hard to absorb the atmosphere. Better to have a good look from the outside before going in

Worth it!. Like most of the temples in Siem Reap, this is also worth visiting. Again, bring water if your are going to visit when the sun is up. Everywhere we go, it seemed like the sun is following us.

Best temple!. I loved Angkor Thom the best out of all the temples I saw. The faces in the stone are amazing! I hope Cambodia figures out a way to preserve this important heritage site. I definitely recommend this as one to see. It was hot, so a hat or umbrella is helpful!
Magnificent. Words cannot do justice to the magnificence of the temple complex. It was busy but that did not detract from the visit - so much to see.

well worth a visit. extraordinary carvings and impressive buildings but go with a registered guide to make the most of the experience and remember to wear good shoes to climb and navigate the uneven surfaces
Beautiful temple. Get there early.. Very detailed carvings. Its simply beautiful. It should take you a couple of hours to see the whole thing.

A must-visit!. Every traveller that comes to Siem Reap must visit this place! Angkor Thom is actually a ancient city built by King Jayavarman VII. Inside its walls, there are several more temples and other buildings built by the King. This place is rich with history and mystery that was never told to the modern world. The place seems a little run down and dusty as it has been abandoned for many hundreds of years, which was then found and restored by the French during the French Colonialism. Till this day, there are joint efforts by other countries to continually restore and reconstruct the whole ancient city. Be prepared to come here with a good pair of walking shoes, lots of drinking water and a cap, as you will need to do a lot of walking and it can be quite hot.
A must. This is part of the Angkor area visit and must to visit. Again allow enough time to enjoy and take all this site has to offer. Truly amazing!

A Truly Great Temple. Angkor Thom is arguably the second most popular temple in the Siem Reap area. It has a wonderful moat and wall surrounding it, as most temples do. Unfortunately, most of the state heads on the entrance to the temple have been looted long ago and replaced mostly by reproductions. It is sad what people will do to great works of art to make money. I guess you have to realize how impoverished the cambodian people have been for a long time. Look out for the monkeys on the way in. They are very aggressive and like to steal your water. If you put it down on the ground then forget it. DO NOT try to fight them for the water, they will actually bite you--just let them have it. Inside the temple is very impressive. There are numerous great photo opportunities and it is fun to walk around and explore the inside passageways. I would go here early in the morning and catch Angkor Wat after lunch. The crowds do the opposite.
Amazing temples. Amazing and massive! The complex is huge, so much to see. Be prepared for a lot of walking... And climbing

Fantastic but crowded!. I spent at least two hours here as I wandered throughout the complex. Many photo opts. Unfortunately, this is also a popular place to visit for the tourists. Best time to visit is early in the morning when it isn't so hot by mid afternoon.
Make sure you bring lots of water.
The human side of Angkor. Angkor Thom is the human side with daily life depicted, it is probably my favourite of the temples I have visited, and that is quite a lot
magnificent temple to visit. A must see place. bring your best cameras and enjoy the marvel of architecture. get ready to walk and enjoy the scenery
Angkor Thom is wonderful. Wish we could have spent more time. Enjoyed every minute. would loved to have seen more temples but we got to 8 in two days.
Don't miss out. Everyone goes to Angkor Wat but Angkor Thom is definitely worth a visit. It does however get very crowded so be patient.

Interesting and Fantastic Temple. Angkor Thom is much like visiting an Egyptian Temple. The engravings on the walls tell the story of the people during it's time! Very interesting to learn the difference between this Budha Temple versus the Hindu Temples in the area. I even got to ride an elephant.

Group Bike Tour of Angkor Thom and Bayon Temple. As part of our group Tour in Cambodia with World Expeditions, we biked to the walled city of Angkor Thom. Once there we biked along the top of the wall from the main south gate (the agricultural gate) to the west gate (the ghost gate) before entering the city and heading to the Bayon Temple at the center. Once we were done exploring the temple, we then left the city through the east gate (the victory gate). I particularly liked our tour as the bicycling allowed us to see more of Angkor Thom than the typical tourists who would head straight to the Temple. If you're there early enough in the day, you can pay for an elephant ride. Apparently the elephants go for siesta after noon. I didn't notice any real shopping here, save that for Angkor Wat. I'd say this is still a must see if you are in Cambodia. The river around the 3 km square city is actually a moat built to protect the city. It's quite amazing to see. I will review Bayon Temple separately so the photos in this review are from the entrances and walls.

Perfect day at Angkor Thom. I was so impressed with this magnificent temple ... We had an amazing guide for the day .. His name is Pen Salon & I can highly recommend him ... His local knowledge & courtesy as a guide is outstanding ... He is also a fantastic photographer ... He took the best photos that I've ever seen ... I now have awesome photos to remember my trip to Cambodia ...Pen Salon's email is : okpiseth@hotmail.comDefinitely try to book him if you visit Siem Reap ...

A must see . I feel in order to get a full appreciation for Angkor watt. You must see bayon and Angkor thom as well. Even though it will take two or three days. But this is a great sight as well. Bring some water and Sun tan lotion

Angkor Thom was a city of 1 million people. Angkor Thom was a city and built in a nearly a perfect square. It was surrounded by a moat filled with water and crocidiles. The moat is now dry.It is believed at its peak that Angkor Thom may had a a population of one million people.The city of Angkor Thom contains many stone temples and has five monumental gates.Sights to see are the The Terrace of the Elephants ,Terrace of the Leper King, Bayon Temple, Baphuon Temple, and Phimeanakas Temple.

big complex, some places a must to visit. Angkor Thom is a big complex. Take time to see the elefant terrace and the lepraking terrace, not above, but the reliëfs. Take also time to vist the Bayon. Phimeanakas has less decoration, the building is imposant. The views from Baphuon ar worth to see

A City with Several Temples. Angkor Tom was the last capital city of the Khmer empire, built in the 12th century. Angkor Thom is not, as some reviewers here seem to think, a temple. However, there are many temples located within the old city of Angkor Thom, the most prominent being the Bayon Temple.Angkor Thom is surrounded by a wall, with North, South, East, and West Gates allowing access into what remains of the old city.As with all of the temples and other ruins around Siem Reap, you have to marvel at the manpower, skill, and time needed to erect such cities and temples almost a thousand years ago.We travelled through Angkor Thom by tuk-tuk from the South Gate to the North Gate, with a few stops on the way, and thoroughly enjoyed our visit.
Must go once in your life. It was amazing in terms of historical things. There were many fantastic sculptures. The temple was very huge and beautiful.

Mesmerising!. Beautiful and worth going to see - although smaller than the other temples. It is different! Once you have seen it, it worth going to see the elephants and having a ride on one or just feeding them!

My pics are awesome. Love Angkor Thom.. Of course Bayon, but also the Elephant and Leper Terraces. Climb up to the side at Victory gate for great photos. Check out the East gate for solitude. This is the heart of the small circuit so expect big crowds at the major sites but the area is large so it's easy to get away from the crowds. Day 2, do the big circuit for more breath taking temples but with a fraction of the tourists.

Not really worth it . Most guides would recommend visiting this temple at the end of the day in order to watch the sunset from it. What is important is to be there well in advance (our guide said 2 hours in advance) as space on top allows for only 300 people - and staff is counting them so they just won't let you in. Once you are there you realise that this is not the most spectacular view you have seen this day. Don't get me wrong - the temple is spectacular but being on top of it let's you only watch the sun setting over the jungle - not really what you would expect if you have been at Angkor Wat for the sunrise :)
Second best. Next to Angkor Wat I. Would rate this as the second best to visit. A large comp,ex with some excellent carvings still clearly visible

Amazing!. What can you really say to describe how awesome and beautiful this temple is! It was my favorite. The restoration that has gone on over the many years to get this place so accessible is beyond words. I will visit again. The temples are amazing, the carvings are unlike anything you'll ever see. I love Cambodia!

AWESOME. SPECTACULAR. DONT GO - WITHOUT A GUIDE !. We have planned to come here for about 10 years and after 20+hours on planeswe finally arrived ro see that its more impressive than the pictures ( just like Macchu Picchu and The Great Pyramids are) Usually we find it the other way round.We booked with HAPPY ANGKOR TOURS a month in advance and JIMMYs explanations made this an unforgettable experience.DONT GO WITHOUT A GUIDE !

Lots of History and another must see. Well worth the walk to learn the history of this land. You see similar but different designs as you tour the different temples. Angkor Thom was as the name implies one "Great City" now still being unearthed and spreads out into the surrounding woods.
Wow. We love checking out temple ruins & this site is well worth the visit. All the temples in this area are interesting. This is a large site with lots to see.

No compare to europe cathedrals. If you think that the curches in europe are amazing, than you need to see this, its enormous and back in time all the roofs where tinted with gold, sadly in the wars with the cham they lost those places.But nevertheless its amazing about the size, the reliefs and everything.Ask here for a guide, otherwise you wouldnt see all those small details.
We visited 5 temples. This was one of them. Each one is different than the other, so you are looking at all kinds of carving. Absolutely fantastic.
My FavoriteTemple. Angkor Temple was my favourite temple during my visit to Siem Reap. Lots of cool places to explore and the stone faces are awesome.

Massive site. Get a tuk tuk for this one as there are many stops worth visiting within the massive site. Some of it can feel a bit samey after Angkor Wat, but there's enough unique bits to make it worthwhile if you have the time

Spectacular.. There was a moment, just as I reached the stairs to the higher platform of the temple where the spectacular nature of where I was hit me. I was floored, absolutely floored.This temple is by far my favorite of all the sites. The faces, the carvings, the masonry - everything is spectacular.DO NOT MISS
Might as well. After a while they all starting to look the same but since you are in the area you might as well visit.
amazing city. 2nd best after Angkor Wat ..would say take a tour with a tuktuk and see this and other nearby attractions

Massive sight. Visited this site next to Angkor Watt, once more it involves climbing on the walls which can be steep at times so be prepared.Lots of interesting things to see and good views from the top of rhe city.
Wow. This is an essential part of the day at Angkor. There are so many unique spots here where you can take in the expansive nature of the temple complex. Wow!
Amazing. I definitely recommend visiting this temple. The temple is amazing and a definite must do while in Siem Reap. Incredible experience

Bayon is nice. Be sure to check out Bayon if you're strapped for time within Angkor Thom. The serene faces may just strip the stress of Siem Reap's oppressive heat off you. But it might only happen at sunset when it's cooler.
