Sweltering. We visited four temples in Siem Reap and each one was different. This was a beautiful site with well preserved carvings in the rocks. You will not be disappointed and will find it very different from Ankor Wat. You need to wear a hat, take water and perhaps an umbrella to keep the sun off. Good walking shoes required as the walking is rough.
Another temple. Another fantastic temple. Incredible experience for the whole family. History galore for those from a country only 200 years old!

Huge, beautiful, do it!. We were travelling with a 4 year old so we're not sure if this would be a bit much.We didn't see as much as we would have done if travelling alone but it was definitely worth it. The scale is huge compared to the main Angkor Wat complex and the green surroundings and trees give the whole complex a restful and serene atmosphere, with no crowds - a feeling that you miss at the main Angkor Wat temple.
Amazing. The entire complexe of Temples in Angkor is amazing and worth visiting. From a Spiritual or historical or cultural point of view a lifetime experience.

Angkor Thom. the entire stretch of the Angkor Wat and all its temples are quite cool. If you are staying for more than a week at Siam reap, I would recommend a two or three day visit to these temples if you are into archeology and history

Not bad for an early morning stroll. We had just watched the beautiful sunrise over in Angkor Wat, so it was lovely to start our journey across the bridge and lakes. Such a photogenic place especially early morning and early evening.
Smaller than Angkor Wat and although similar, it is different.. Well worth going to see this temple as it is different from Angkor Wat and the reasons for the differences is very interesting.

The Welsh Nomads!. Personally I preferred Angkor Wat as it wasn't as busy when we arrived in the early hours but Thom was heaving when we arrived, you couldn't move! Still though an amazing feat of architecture and a must see in Siem Reap!

Must see...... Another Cambodian beauty. As with other temples, Angkor Thom has its own story to tell. I would always suggest a guide when looking at these monuments. Unless you are travelling with someone who has knowledge of the history you will miss the awesome tales of the struggles between faith, the good and evil in the history of the stones and all that the smaller but as important story that this temple has to tell.

fabulous place. This is the second time and not the last i was at Angkor Wat. I want to take my friends and daughters there in the future. Some things to know are: bring a passport picture for your entry visa. Know the address of the hotel on line the taxi drivers don't. Don't be a sucker for the taxi driver who tries to sell you on the way there. It is better to land and let someone guide you and Tuk Tuk drivers are about 15 a day and more fun to get around. I stay at the Paris Angkor Hotel which is fabulous for the price of 25 or even 19 a night in the old part. Breakfast is included and the nice pool. Near everything for walking and close to a money machine.
even better. this is probably even better than angkor wat. its a lot of walking but there are amazing ruins of the temples. we enjoyed the multiple buddha faces.

Massive sprawling temple. This temple is much more relaxed than Angkor Wat and involves a lot less climbing than Bayon. The causeway into the temple is interesting architecturally, due to it being man made.

Best thing in Asia!. Don't fall for the scams when people offer to tour you around inside. You can access everywhere without them and it's better to just wander around, take loads of photos, and move on at your convenience. These places are like playgrounds for adults, so be prepared to take silly photos, climb around to get a good shot, and make unforgettable memories!
Inexplicable awesomeness. Angkor Thom is one of the busiest temples from the Angkor Wat complex. You need to visit it at least once in your lifetime!
SO BEAUTIFUL. You cannot go to Cambodia without seeing the Temples. something you will never forget. be blessed by a nun and go early
Amazing. Visited with Angkor Wat, simply amazing well worth a visit, like the land time forgot, so old and very interseting.

amazing. my driver stopped short of the bridge so that I could take photos of the statues on the bridge. they are wonderful as is the gate that I walked to and around and over. the advantages of employing your own taxi driver on arrival;; he was first class... Then Angkor thom temple with all the heads. this was more interesting for me than the vaster angkor wat. the fee is for all the greater angkor site. you get your photo taken and buy a valid pass for a number of days or a week...thanks to my taxi driver who knew what was needful for best. i went in october 14 but the website doesnt cater for that date.
Another amazing place... Great n must go place again for anyone coming to siem reap... Tiring in the end but worth every minute of it..
Wear good walking shoes. There's so much to see here, and it's amazing. Wear comfortable shoes, and bring water/snacks. Happy exploring!
Not to miss. This is one of the tourist spot not to miss. Ruins of building but prepare for a hot weather and nice rubber or walking shoes.lots of room and Buddha to see.
Beautiful people. Loved this place. Cycling around is the best transport. You see so. Uch. Butterfly Hotel was amazing and do cheap.

Gateway to sheer beauty. When you are about to enter you will be greeted an amazing doorway. The complex houses many ruins. Baphun is must visit.
There are staircases which takes you all the way to 3rd level. Must visit

Best by far. My favourite out of them all
If you get tuktuk he can take you along the small circuit for 15usd, so if you have 4 people to split the price with then it works out real cheap
great for sunset. Most popular place from Sunset tour, longest queue ever. Issue one comes down, then one goes up for the spectacular view of Angkor Wat

Put thei one on your list for Siem Reap. Uncle Tom is another great temple. It's huge - the biggest one in terms of land mass (the actual temple at Ankgor Wat is bigger). It's a must see if you come to Siem Reap. Take a stroll around and get away from people. I recommend hiring a guide to give you the full history and background of the temple.

Must Go!. this was the 3rd temple we visited and were still in awe by the magnificent structures that were built then and how they're still around. great for photography. definitely recommend to anyone who is in the siem reap area!
A must see. Do not expect to be alone in this magnificent place. It is very crowded, especially for the sunrise. Nevertheless, the atmosphere is really unique. A guide is recommended
It's a must. Another amazing temple you must see. It's very unique and big and you will love it. You need proper shoes to walk around this place.
Awe inspiring. Not to be missed-amazing. Make sure you are well protected from the heat and sun and take plenty of water
Unimaginable, Wonderful and amazing histories. Cambodia is wonderful and its my own country. Bayon Temple is one of the most beautiful Temples in Kingdom of wonder.

elephant ride to enter the gate . We took an elephant ride from outside the gate into Bayon. It was about 30 minutes. It was fun for the young children and it made a great picture when the elephant is entering the Angkor Thom gate.

Astonishing!. Just the most spectacular visit to a complex of astonishing buildings. It's like putting all the great cathedrals of England into a 10km sq area to explore. You cannot comprehend the architecture and carving and building capacity of this nation. Get here before it gets ruined by over tourism!!
Nature involving culture. Nice temple! the trees are outstanding!!! Some part of the temple is destroyed, but is good to see that they are triyng to recover it.

More intimate than Angkor Wat. Try to visit this straight after watching the sun rise over Angkor wat as most tourists head straight back for their hotels for breakfast & it is much quieter at this tiem.
Such amazing stories back to the time.. Really really, awesome temple compares to another temples in this amazing place. I love it so much. the words cant tell enough about it.

Holiday to Vietnam & Cambodia with friends. Very large site with various temple's & buildings from ancient times.
Great place to explore the ruined buildings
Must Visit. Excellent and you need one complete day to see Angkor Thom Great place and great experience indeed!!.

Angkor Wat will exceed your expectations. Not to be missed. One of the best known sites in the world and deservedly so. Amazingly well preserved. Can be very hot and worth taking an umbrella for shade. Allow 3 hours at least to see it comfortably.
astonishing!. Great place to visit. it is a must after Angkor Wat visit. You can only imagine how this place would have been constructed about 1000 years ago.

Loved the gates. Two things about Angkor Thom impressed me. First, the statues on the causeway leading up the gate. I took the time to look at the statues and their features made the effort worth it.Secondly, the gate and the face high above the entrance are to be seen. Take the time to study the details of the construction of the face and head and marvel and what was accomplished and wonder how they did it?

A must see.. After Angkor Wat this temple seems to be the next most popular and justifies that popularity. It is close by and one of 5-6 temples that can be easily seen in a day without temple overload.
Better than Angkor Wat. Angkor Thom was far superior to Angkor Wat. The large roots were unbelievable.. We just wound thru the area, just in awe of what we saw.
O.k. not the most special. Anyway you will pass through this gate on your tour.But didn't find this spot as the most interesting on all perimitter.
Temples. Awesome holiday visiting Angkor Wat and Angkor Thom temples. The awe of these places, highly recommend both of these. I'd you don't like the heat is not a place for you.

Early Morning Wonder. Wow. Do the early morning visit. We arrived for sunrise and what a terrific atmosphere! We spent 8 hours touring the mass of temples in the surrounding park lands. If you have time maybe get a 2 or 3 day pass so you can split it up. Hot but wonderful.
Don't Miss. Lots of temple options but don't miss the "faces" of Bayon. Amazing how they have rebuilt these ruins, very impressive in its own right.

Bucket list tick. I absolutely loved this temple. More so than Ankor Wat. Loved that it was not so busy too. Visited this temple twice. Once with a guide (who rushed me) & then I did a Gopro workshop here with a French photographer. He was very good. This is bucket list material. Blew my mind the architecture & amazing mind behind King Jayavarman VII who built this city at the end of the 12th century. Would love to come back here again one day.
Great day. Had a wonderful day seeing the sun rise at Angkor Wat. Seeing the incredible temples was a dream come true.
Angkor Thom - Sean Riep. Great experience unimaginable to put into words. It is a place that we wanting see to see for a long an it did not disappoint.

Vast area take your time. Take your time as there is a lot to cover...right from the entrances to the 11-12 buildings...some are almost in ruins but there are some still intact (for want of a better word). Be prepared to walk. We took about 3 hrs just for Angkor Thom.

Spellbound . Crazy-super-beautiful, big budha followers-soldiers, big khmer soldiers, architecture, sad history, clear blue sky, sun smiling on it and spellbound view ... you got to see it to believe it.

Amazing Buddist Temple. Fantastic Architecture, the "HEADS" are amazing if you have a guide they will advise you of where to position yourself to get the best/multiple shots of the heads.take plenty of water, can get very hot there

Ancient Capital - must see. Amazing and certaintly worth seeing, and not just the main sites, get away from the hordes and visit the Western gate or walk along the top of the walls surrounding Angkor Tom. Marvel as the sheer scale and grandeur.
The Real Gem. Breathtaking local religious carvings cover this beautiful temple. Ankor Wat might be more famous because of its sheer size, but Angkor Thom has much more personality.

Awesome awesome awesome. The first temple that were shown to us and this is one of the biggest temple. We were amazed with the sizes and the beautiful carving all over and the story that they were saying.

Great place to see, don't skip this!!. Very impressed to vist this place. It is in the standard tours you do when you are visiting Angkor wat but definitely worth to go to this one. A little less touristic but for sure as beautiful as the more famous ones. Have fun!
Amazing. Awe inspiring, the temples here are all just amazing. It opens your mind spiritually but also makes you ask how did they build these.
Fascinating!. Well worth seeing and we were glad to have a guide who could tell us about the history of the precinct. Glad to see the preservation work being undertaken.

A sight not to be missed. Some parts are better preserved then others, but it's an amazing place to see. There are lots of tourists. Try going early and with a good guide, otherwise you don't know what you are seeing.

Hire an elephant to make a regal entrance!. This was probably our favorite site in the whole Angkor complex. We hired elephants to make the procession into the main gates, passing monkeys playing in the trees was especially exciting.

Just like the brochures but crowded and commercial scams spoil it. Plenty to see, take your time but see if you can get a guide who is not a rip off. We were followed by an informative policeman who before we knew it became a guide. Near the end he took us aside to advise his "study" was expensive and suggested a tip,of $10'to $15. Just one more example of the corrupt scams that riddle Siem Reap.
Rise early for this one. Go for sunrise and have the place to yourself. The photos we got were amazing. By the time we left we had about 5 other people there. So amazing
Amazing!. Stunning workmanship, I went there at 11 am so it was hot and busy with the crown. Still I love it. Will go there again next trip but the early morning.

Simply stunning.. Our driver took us here first on our day tour to avoid the crowds. It is impossible to adequately describe these wonderful temples. It really is a place that must be visited and experienced first-hand.At any time of year these ruins are not for anyone unsteady on their feet. There is a lot of tricky steps, stairs, cobbled pathways and low entrances. It is also extremely hot and sweaty work walking around these sites. Not for the faint-hearted, infirm or hung-over! A dress code of long sleeves and skirts/trousers is requested by the authorities out of respect as these are religious temples. This is also a good idea to prevent getting sunburnt, as can easily happen here. Take drinking water with you!The Cambodian government and World Heritage are doing an admirable job preserving, reconstructing and promoting these artifacts. The whole area and people is brimming with pride and a professional approach to allowing others to experience and witness these amazing, historic achievements.We found Angkhor Thom far better and more interesting than its more famous next door neighbour. Anghkor Wat has been heavily, obviously and rather poorly preserved and reconstructed. Angkhor Thom is being maintained and cared for with a greater view towards returning it to its original condition; not just preparing it for tourism. The former is enabling this, I know.All of the temples are fascinating. They provide wonderful photo opportunities (if you have the patience) and are something that will stay in you memory forever.I have great admiration for the Cambodian government who are controlling this site with care and consideration for its preservation, not just going for the fast, tourist buck as is usually the case. I hope that the local population genuinely benefit from the vast amounts of money that is being gained through tourism and not just through the small stalls and hawkers trying to sell trinkets.
Well worth a visit!. Large area with many temples, including Bayon Temple and the Elephant Terrace and Leper King Terrace. Beautiful.

Spend a full day. Spend a full day here alone. There is a lot to see within the walls of Angkor Thom, don't overlook some of the lesser known temple sites for some quiet time away from the crowds. The main temples are an easy walk from one another. Visit Preah Pithu for a picnic in the shade.

A highlight. Another must do in the Angkor Archaeological Park. If you are short of time make sure this is in your top three. The ruins and carvings are amazing. Quite a large area to cover, and quite spread out so be sure to have plenty of water and a hat. There is an area where the mini vans wait that has stalls with water etc, so if you forget yours you can buy some there.

Bucket List Item. Spend a couple days visiting & enjoy. Don't try to cram into one day. Get a guide, all languages spoken. Visually impressive, but the stories behind the carvings & buildings fascinating.
A must see. This is what I expected to see. The trees and root growing over the temple are surreal. A gorgeous and inspiring experience.
Awesome . Another fantastic temple in the Angkor site. This is a pretty one with a great photo location with water, or mud depending when you go , in front of it.

Angkor Thom. Very amazing historical attraction and admire the authority's hard work to preserve this place. It was a very hot day on the 23rd of September 2015 when we visited Angkor Thom after visiting Angkor Wat. The natural green surrounding here at Angkor Thom has made this place more cooling compared to other places of similar kind.
Second best temple in Angkor: not to miss!. Second best place to visit in Angkor. The temple of Bayon in Angkor Thom is just fabulous! When in Siem Reap, do NOT miss Angkor Thom!

It looks like an entrance to middle Earth!. This was a fortified city where the elite and government officials resided. That was probably why the entrances were so grand and dramatic, with sculptures of gods and demons flanking each side.

Amazing temple. Worth seeing. An amazing place. We had a guide which I think is a good idea. Ours especially knew the good times and also places to take photos etc and also knew how to avoid the crouds.

The remains of what was once an amazing city!. Roughly in the centre of the Angkor Historical Park the remains of the once thriving ancient city are amazing. The Southern gate is a destination in itself, if you have time, try to see all 4 including the more wild West gate. The highlights inside are the Bayon Temple as well as the twin terraces of the Elephants and the Leper King (excellent carvings).
Great place.. This is also a very large walled temple area, but a bit smaller than Angkor Wat. Great views from around the temple site...if you can snap quickly between the annoying tourists!
Angkor (Siem Reap). It was an eye opener experience and everyone should have the chance to experience this adventure before its gone.
Best view in the afternoon from Bayon temple. That is so nice when you visit Bayon temple in the evening from the west side entrance. also you can have the reflection picture from the water too.
Angkor Wat temple visti. Go for Sunrise at Angkor Wat temple and complete the tour also. Do not come back to hotel for breakfast. You will save time, the day time heat and crowd

My Favorite!. Not the most popular area in the park, the Bayon temple in Angkor Thom was hands down my favorite. The library temple has steep stairs but it also gives great views of the complex. The smaller temples outside Bayon and within Angkor Thom are also great to walk through.

Wonderful place. What an amazing place I liked the surroundings, hard to believe that a city was in the grounds of this temple a must see make sure you have comfy shoes as there is so much to see and lots of walking

Get out and explore and have a real adventure!. Wow Wow Wow, but there is more to Angkor Tom if you get out and explore!Hint, Walk the wall! Enter in the South Gate and climb the wall. Take the 1.5km trip to the corner for a hidden temple and some great views of the river. The walk is moderate and track is easily followed. We did not see another sole for an hour. If you have a tuk tuk for the day, have them drop you off and then pick you up at the West Gate.Not for all travelers but worth the trip and an easy walk on a wide track.If you want a real adventure and have some trekking skills and path following ability, go to the North gate and walk to the Victory gate and on to the East Gate. On this trek you feel like an explorer, coming on a destroyed temple on the corner and the East Gate is very rugged and used by locals only.Hint, Have a Tuk Tuk drop you off at the North gate and drop you off at the East Gate.Hate telling people about this as it is a special place, and we did not see any one doing this walk. But it is not for everyone, you wont see a bus load of tourist doing it. This was one of the highlights of our trip.

Magical Architecture. What a way to spend a morning, exploring the runs of Angkor Thom, Hidden in time for centuries , Restoration has been ongoing for a number of years and you can often see modern workers rebuilding and restoring much of the original stonework, A place to come back to in years to come to see the progress of reviving it's former glory
beautiful ruins. amazing place and fascinating ruins...must see, don't skip it in the middle of the tour. just make sure you have enough snacks and water on you

Wonder of the world indeed .... Visiting with a tour guide Sam Sophea for the one-day tour. good to dedicate a full day or even 2 if you have the time to see the many temples. the restorations are impressive and you'll be able to spot what is original and what is a replication for certain statues.
Awesome. Definitely best temple complex in Cambodia, been there with my wife, and even tho I visited all of other temples after visiting this one there is no need to see the other ones
My favourite temple. This is the site which I liked most of all the temples in Angkor. It has a misterious atmosphere that Angkor Wat doesn't have.

Spectaular Angkor Wat. The reaosn we came to Siem Reap was primarily to go to see Angkor Wat. It did not disappoint. We used a local tuk tuk driver to be our 'guide' for the day. We went for sunrise, and even though it was cloudy and the sunrise didnt really happen, just to see the temple silohetted against the sky was magical and being there in the cool morning air was a beautiful way to start the day. We visited many temples during the course of the day, all different to each other, each one incredible. One thing we learnt was that a private vietanmese company have actually leased the land from Cambodia for 99 years, and we are in year 15, so all the entrance fee you pay goes into Vietnam rather than Cambodia which seems very sad, especially at $20USD for a day.Make sure that you wear shorts/skirt that reaches to your knees and a t shirt that covers your shoulders otherswise you will not be allowed in certain temples. This applies to both men and women, we saw both being refused entry into the Phimeanakas (Royal Palace )temple. It was a fantastic day and well worth the trip, the early start, walking with loads of others through the temples.

Amazing . Must see place.. Total highlight of my trip to Cambodia.. Miss at your peril.. Hire a tuk Tuk for the day for about $10 and have him take you to all the temple's in the park.. $20 ticket fee

Brilliant piece of work of the ancient era. Take a guided tour when you visit this place. We went with the odyssey tours and they did a very good job. I was mesmerized with the enormous temples and the fact that they have stood strong for 1000 years is amazing. I felt like i was in an Indiana Jones movie , really awesome!Would totally reccommend people to go visit it.

Ankor Thom visit with Rany and angkor wat services. great temple to visit and our guide Rany from Angkor wat services was fantastic he knew how to tell the history and made it very interesting for our teenage daughters very professional and made sure we did the visit at a quiet time
Mysterious Ancient Temple. This is my 4th Visit to Angkor Thom. I like the mysterious feel of this ancient temple ...I believe that I might come back again in near future ...

Majesty and Mystery. The temples of Angkor are now firmly placed on many peoples lists of 'must see'. We have all seen the movie and the images of ancient remains held in the grip of the forest. Nothing quite prepares you however for the sheer scale of the temples and palaces in Angkor whose sites extend many miles beyond what the average tourist can take in in a few days.Friendly people and amazing sights- well worth the trip.

Angkor Thom. I found these extraordinary sites to be more compelling than Angkor Wat! Both are great, but these have amazing character. Visit these first in the morning and Angkor Wat in the afternoon. Most tourists go to Wat first but it is huge and can take large numbers. Thom temples tend to be smaller so by going to them first, you have the place to yourself! Use a professional guide to get the most of the experience.

Don't miss it!. Just a lovely part of your tour from Angkor Wat tour! I suggest you book a tour guide for a days tour of the ruins. Cold water, and cold towels. Makes the summer day a lot more memorable.

The Great Gate. On the first day tour on the way to the Bayon temple the great gate of Angkor Thom, it is set in the middle between many Buddha statues pulling a NAGA as a bridge, an amazing lake view from there.

Superb!!!!!. It`s just another amazing place to visit when you get to see all the temples.It´s one of the biggest complexes so be prepared bring lots of water and snacks with you, because sometimes you are too far away from places to eat and rest.
cambodia 2015. awesome perfectly clean enough shops inside the park with water and beer wild monkey elephant ride all angor atleast 2 days

Not to miss!. When in Angkor try to visit every little place there is. Angkor Thom is one of them... really close to Angkow Wat, take a tuk tuk or taxi to Angkor Thom, because the walk is a little long and really hot.

Worth The Sweats... Angkor Thom is one of those place that you need to spend half a day to really see the whole place (alot of temples here) It was a city during the ancient time and alot of stories installed in this spectacular city during those days..You will definitely need a guide here..The Elephant Terraces, The Burned Down Palace and some other temples that I had walked were totally worth it..Get ready for a long walk with amazing view of the temples and there was a maze and inside it was a huge long winding walls that had all these craving and inscription on them..Get ready to take lots of beautiful amazing pictures here..
Amazing Place!!!. Truly Amazing Place. Gives one an insight on how majestic the Kmehr Empire must have been during its height. A must visit place!!! Checked this one off my Bucket List...

Temples of Angkor. The Temples of Angkor are truly amazing and a must see. It is worth the money to hire a registered guide and tuk-tuk driver; (about 35USD/day for guide and 20-25USD/day for tuk-tuk & driver). The advantage of your own guide and a small group is that you can change your order of visit and try to miss some of the big crowds and you don't have to have your head buried in a guide book. Most guides are also happy to talk a little abut the more recent history of Cambodia.
What a place!. This is an incredible site to visit! Just the south and east gates are amazing. Do not miss that! Huge site to visit by cab, bike or tuk tuk!
One of the best experiences. It really is a wonder of the world, i was overwhelmed by the size. Take your time though as it is damn hot.
Another remarkable view of history in Cambodia. This was part of our day with Buffalo Tours. Surrounded by a moat the ruins are continually being upgraded. A must see for anyone coming to Seam Reap.
nice. enjoyed it very much but did it late morning and was really hot. Try to do it early morning or late afternoon
Amazing Ankor Thom. One of the most elaborate and mind blowing ruins in the area. A must see. Take a guide to learn as much as possible and to help you find the best photo spots.
who am I to review Angkor Thom. Utterly breathtaking. Go very early in the morning 6:30, before the the tours arrive. Unforgettable!

Don't skip this. It's hard to believe that someone would skip this site if you've traveled to Siem Reap for the temples, or specifically Angkor Wat. It's best to visit with a guide so you can truly appreciate the history and stories behind what you are seeing. Or read up plenty ahead of time to gain full appreciation. Lots of people, though, so make sure you are mentally prepared for crowds. It's also very hot and humid so be warned to wear appropriate clothes and drink plenty of water. Also be on the look-out for monkeys as they like to hang out on the gates and can provide some fun photo opportunities.

A Must See; Not as Impressive as Angkor Wat. This is a must see, but was not as impressive as Angkor Wat. You can't leave Siem Reap without visiting. The tour guides are helpful, but not necessary. If I were to do it again, I would buy the guide written by Michael Freeman and Claude Jacques entitled Ancient Angkor and use it instead of hiring the guides. They do offer a personal touch, but I'm sure a lot of added value.
Another must see. Although not as big as Ankor Wat, this temple is also included in "the small tour" and one of the highlights of the park again crowded but a must.

Mystical. Angkor Thom is a fabulous place. The gates to get in with the gods and demons are magical against the backdrop of the moat. Once inside if quiet, climb up the gras verge to get fotos of the faces close up. One inside the city of Angkoe Thom the first place to head to is Bayon. This temple has an amazing amount of faces on the towers. Some extremely well preserved. You will not regret a visit here. Bring lots of water. Is was busy in low season so I can't imagine high season and v hot.
Angkor Thom. Awesome. Loved visiting the temples, nothing like I'd ever seen before. Take your umbrella for shade and rain. Have time to explore.

Must do. Visit at sunrise and sunset, but be aware lots of crowds then. Go to Bayon first thing in morning as very quiet, then Angkor wat.If you go for sunset an arrive after 4.30 ticket will get you in all of next day also.

See Angkor Wat first, but make time for this as well. Less crowded than Angkor Wat but orders of magnitude less spectacular as well.There are a number of other Wat and ruins very close to the main part of Angkor Thom so plan an extra hour or so to stop and look at them: walls, temples and a bridge.

Biggest Temple. Exotic gate awaiting you at entrance, with pillars of statues. Has to get there very early in the morning to avoid the traffic jam on a one lane entrance/arch. Was there is September, get hot and humid during late morning, but for the scenery, definitely worth it.

Loved It!. This is a must-see and must-do when in Siem Reap. It's within the Angkor Wat UNESCO Heritage Site. Pictures will not do it justice but I'm gonna post them anyway. History buffs will love this ancient city with stories and chapters carved into it's walls. The guides are very well trained in different languages to give you a steep insight into what have been discovered and learned from this enchanting past.Highly recommended but not for the physically challenged.
History alive. Very nice, plenty of history around it. Monk's around, friendly people, great place to take amazing pictures.

If You Do Not Visit Then You Are A Criminal Of Travellers. A must see while you are in the area you can't visit Siem and not go, it would be a crime! Yes it can get busy, yes it can be crowded but then you should appreciate how lucky you are to be there!Later in my trip while in Vietnam I explained the wonders of Angkor to a Vietnamese tour guide, very upset that me a Brit could be blessed to see such wonders yet a man in his 50's from a neighbouring country has never and could go to see this stunning wonder of the world!

Mystic yet peaceful!. The South gate entrance and the 4 faced towers create a very mystic environment. Very much accessible by tuk tuk rides, and suggested mode of transport. The moat around the temple complex adds to the aura. Very glad to see renovation work taken up
Angkor Thom. Gosh, a must see before you die.The history is written on the walls. Rain or shine, it was a pleasant experience.

Gorgeous historic landmark. Gorgeous, must see example of Cambodia's rich past. Go all the way to the top gallery to get epic views of the surrounding forests as well as the entrance of the temple. Getting to top gallery can be a bit challenging for the elderly as the stairs are extremely steep. Please do 'not' carry any children with you to the top. It isn't very safe in case they are scared of heights
Temples. The main temple was under repair and too many vistors. They should control the flow of the vistors. It's not easy to take a good picture.

Wonderful. Try to go later in the day when there are less people. The sunrise is spectacular from here. Get a guide if you want to find out more about the place but if you are just looking a good guide book is very helpful.
Must see!. what an amazing trip! stunning views, walk amongst the ancient ghosts of cambodia, do not miss this Wat on your tript to Siem Reap!
Magical!. came here after Ankor Wat. This place is nothing short of magical. The carvings and structures are just amazing.
A must see and do!!. A fantastic place to visit. Take lots of water and a hat! Plenty of facilities and places to buy water and food. Rich in culture, a history lesson not to be missed.

Historical site rich in culture. Truly magical experience. We didn't manage to capture sunrise at Angkor Wat because it was raining all day (15 hours) but in return we experienced light mist that made the place looks magical. The site was huge, surrounded by large pond. It took almost 3 hours for us to look around inside the temple. There are food stalls and souvenirs shops on the left side if you're hungry or just want to buy some gifts.
Nice ancient city. Nice for rock climbing and also for photo session. please pack a good walking shoe on it as the road is bumpy
Must do visit while in Cambodia. Must do attraction while in Cambodia. Our guide was excellent in knowledge and very helpful. Not sure if it should be number one on unesco over Egypt pyramids.

Angkor Wat was great, Angkor Thom was Wow!. We selected a half day small circle temple tour to avoid temple fatigue at the end of an intended holiday to chill out. The tour brought us to Angkor Wat, Ta Phrom(famous because of Tomb Raider) and Angkor Thom. Standing at the entrance to AT, one could not not experience a skipped heart beat as you soak in the grandeur of the ruin. 54 towers each with 4 calm stone faces facing NSEW is a sight that will take your breath away. Even when dogged by an upset stomach on a terribly hot day could I not appreciate the moment of an amazing sight. Must go, must see, must experience.

Superb architecture. Visited this after Angkor Wat. Totally different & awe inspiring. All of the temples are different to each other which makes visiting most a must. Bought a 3 day pass but think it would have been better buying a US$20.00 day pass & if wanting to visit other temples on another day, buy an additional day pass then.
Tres ineressant, Very interresting. Passionnant surtout pour les bouddhistes et la comprehension du peuple Khmer, Very interresting especially for the Buddhist and knowlegde to Khmer story

Angkor Thom isn't a temple itself. Important to know that Angkor Thom is actually a large area with many temples inside of the walls. Bayon temple was amazing with almost vertical steps to climb to see the carved faces. We also walked to the Royal Palace, again with steep steps but beautiful views from the top of the jungle surrounding it. We got lost trying to exit the Phimeanakas temple and ended up at Preah Palilay. This tiny and pretty much destroyed temple was one of my favourites because it was free of tourists and we were the onyl ones there scrambling over rocks and roots. However it was very very hot and there is a lot to see so take loads of water and try to go early when its cool.
Angkor Thom. This was my favourite temple the trees growing through and over sncient stone breathtaking and where Raiders of lost tomb was filmed a must see.

Totally Amazing at every turn. You have to see it too believe it. Angkor Thom is full of wonderful sights and temples. The city gates are awe inspiring which is just the effect they must of had on people those eons ago. Its a shame that these places have been defaced in the past but they are still overwhelmingly beautiful.
Must see. If you are visiting angkor wat you also have to see angkor thom as it isn't far away and it's all together.

Amazing. Beautiful, breathtaking, historical. I really loved visiting this temple- it takes you to another place - feels like you're on the set of a movie! The only negative would be the crowds, but it is a very popular tourist destination so I guess it is to be expected.
Fascinating Architecture. Delightful Carvings of the Ramayan & Mahabharata on the Temple Walls still intact....Quite remarkable that these were etched some 1,000 years ago....

cooler than Angkor Wat. This area was actually better than the famous Angkor Wat, for me. The temple in the center, Bayon I think, was much cooler. In the compound are several more temples/buildings which are also nice, but also importantly, shaded (but you still sweat your shirt off).
Start Early er. Great but you need to be there at opening. Gets real busy quickly and so for the true explorer experience head out with breakfast in hand.
Awe Inspiring. visited this in conjunction with Angkor wat really needed more time, weather was wet and slippery. but that didn't detract from a historic memorable visit

A great architectural site besides Angkor Wat. The temple is full of sculpture which showed about the religion respect and people's living style during the war of the Angkor Period. Some part of the architectural work was left in progress which need to be researched more about its secret history behind.

Temple Heaven. Another amazing place in the Angkor complex. This site is well worth visiting. I have been twice and and will be heading back in December 2015. It might be thought that all these temples are much the same but each has its own personality and identity. Angkor Thom is one of the stars of the complex and should be on your must see list if you are to get the most out of your visit to Angkor Wat.

Beuty of Ancient City. This is a great place to visit. It has beautiful rock carvings. You will get the best value if accompanied by a accredited guide since there is lot of information about this place.
A must See. Its a Must see place in Siem Reap. just good place to go any time of the day. better to avoid it during the noon. its very hot during that time of the day.
jungle meets temple. this is a "must do". very cool place. take an afternoon or morning and enjoy. the trees and how they have grown into the temple are as interesting as the temple itself!!

amazing. all of it, the work that went into it, and questions that cant be answered, like, who designed it, who were the builders, what plans did they work from, where did all the stone come from, how did they cut it.
great !. best place to visit in Cambodia - so much culture! such a blast and should never miss on a visit! also the town siem reap is so cute!
Angkor Thom is in the Bayon style of building. Angkor Thom is in the Bayon style of building it is quite amazing to see such beauty and wonder which is still standing now .
Great place. Don't pass this site up. Some of the best pictures you'll ever take. Great ruins and surroundings. Great people. Best time of year is December and January.
Unbelievable. I really think that the experience here must make one understand Cambodia. The detail, the history, the culture, the beliefs the people,

Angkor Thom. One of the best places I've ever visited. The carvings are intricate and they adorn every pillar and statue.The temple is magnificent and awe inspiring. I would recommend to every traveler.

Fantastic. We got told that Angkor Thom was a city, that is the reason why it is quite big. It took us 3hours to complete though. The main temple of Angkor thom is Bayon, which is now becoming to my the most favorite temple.

A must thing to see in whole of the Asia. Its Beautiful.
Its like, looking into the past with your eyes.
And walking among it, is beyond words. Its worth full to see this place in Asia.
Amazing!. If you are in Cambodia and do not go here, you must be a bit silly. its unforgettable! I could not think of any other way to describe the beauty of the place.
Fantastic. Fantastic. Amazing site. Lovely knowledgeable guide and attentive driver organised through sofitel angkor. A must do if visiting cambodia.
Absolutely brilliant. All the Angkor temples are brilliant and this is one of the best. I was speechless at its beauty. Must visit now before it all gets too touristy (its well on its way).

Angkor Thom . Is a walled city and home to the bayon temple with its huge stone faces. A fascinating attraction
So much stone work 9 centuries old

Wonder of the World. This is one of the worlds wonders a must see and visit.in places in the Temple show carvings from 900 yrs old, you stand in wonder as to how they got all the stone blocks 60 km away to the sight 900 years ago.
A must see.. Incredible experience. Largest religious site in the world. We hired a driver and he drove us around all day for $30. Well worth the cost.

12th Century mega-city. Should be on the bucket list of most people. Huge 3x3 km walled and moated city near the shores of the Tonle Sap (London in 1300 was only 1 km x 0.5 km) . Incredible that this was built in the 12th century The town which was made of wood has perished with time and nature, but the stone central Bayon temple has been partially restored and is a must as well as the Elephant Terrace. There are licensed tour guides who can speak most languages (heard Spanish, French, Mandarin, Japanese, Korean etc). It is going to be hot with lots of uneven steep stone steps. Dress light, shoes for walking, wear a sunscreen and hat. Don't forget to bring water. Unfortunately, not for the disabled or very young. Note there is no mobile phone signal in Angkor Thom, so make plans to meet somewhere in case the group gets separated.
Spend 2 days there. Great site as part of UNESCO. The whole of Angkor Wat is very large. I recommend at least 2 days to visit Angkor Wat Walled city and surrounding areas.

Wow - the scale and detail is breath taking. . We got a tuk-tuk to Angkor Thom so We could tie it in with other temples. Amazing place. The detail in the carving and the scale of the place. Hard to comprehend Totally worth the visit. Take good shoes as it is a lot of walking and some climbing.
simply breath taking. A world heritage site rivalled by none. A tuk tuk is quite adequate to get there from Siem Reap as it's only about 5 km from town.
Unique site. Well worth visiting Angkor Thom when visiting Angkor Wat. The four faced towers are unique and the site is huge. The elephant terrace carving is also unique and very well preserved.
Intriguing, memerising. The stunning ruins overrun by the giant trees makes this place truly seem 'out of this world'. Plan to spend at least a couple of hours. Any time of the day is fine,
Beautiful sunrise. Awesome trip with early rise for the sun up over Angkor,beautiful temples my faves were Angkor Bayon and Ta Prohm.

Astounding . This really makes you feel like you found a city lost in time. My personal favorite, I would highly recommended reading up on the history/ style or hiring a guide. You will get so much more out of it.
Amazing. Wander around this temple alone, a guide isn't as necessary as at Anchor Wat. reconstruction of some parts have been fully completed and other parts show the immense job ahead.
Awe inspiring. Wow!! incredible history. Don't miss a visit to this temple. This is a incredible feat in architecture for the period of history when it was built.
just passing through on the way to Angkor Wat. the nice facade makes a good picture, had a very quick walkabout as there were way too many people so we probably missed out on a lot.

Angkor Thom is Second to None. I LOVE this place. Everybody knows Angkor Wat and travels to Siem Reap specifically to see it. But Angkor Thom is absolutely spectacular. All of the Buddha faces carved into the temple are stunning--I could stare at them for hours.

a place to marvel! . simply a sight to behold!! you can't help but wonder about the mystery this place holds, what it was really like during its glory days. Managed to visit this place at the time when there was minimal people around. This is one temple you should not miss.
so so beautiful temple. Amassing temple with four faces of this temple so i looked so beautiful and very attractive temple should go to see in evening time the not too much hot...

Clear wonder of the world!. Wow! A clear wonder of the world! See this place early in the morning when visits are a minimum. You will have the place to your self if you go when they open. Just enjoy, take pictures and soak in the culture.
Majestic. An epic , mind blowing, mesmerising and majestic ancient monument appropriately named ' A Great City'.

Stunning.... Ive been a couple of times now and never get sick of looking at the many faces on this temple.If you are lucky you may come across people in traditional Khmer costumes who will pose in the temple for you, makes for a great picture.

Amazing & must-see in Cambodia. The Thom is a really beautiful place, I highly recommend it.
It has a unique atmosphere with al the tree roots growing through the walls and floors, very unique.

Angkor Wat is a must see in every Asian visitors itinerary and a must be once in a life time!. Go before it is too late and the Indian's try to copy it, or the Chinese hordes destroy it it is truly unique, pure and essential, come well prepared and well read to this visit, knowing and understanding how this marvel of architecture was built and why it is a true marvel of humanity, in its style conceptions building technique, a true human becon and icon of humanity at its most inspired and best ever!Go for it!BMW

Excellent. If you are in Siem Reap, you need to visit Bayon temple in Angkor Thom. But try to go earlier, before the truckloads of tourists turn up. It's a great site with really fantastic photo ops, which would be difficult to accomplish with too many tourists crowding around. I didn't have time to visit other temples, but there are smaller temples around to visit too.

An incredible experience. Angkor Wat is a once in a life time experience everyone should seek. All the temple complexes in Angkor Wat are beautiful, and set in the middle of dense forests. Go there and prepare to be struck with the sheer timelessness of it all.
Angkor Wat. A must see when you visit Siem Reap.Throughly enjoyed the visit as Angkor Wat is totally underrated.
Beautiful peaceful amazing to see. You need to allow a few days to see all of Angkor Thom. Perhaps if you have a choice the cooler part of the year

Bayon temple. Just a short tuk tuk ride from Angkor Wat and well worth the trip. Buildings are smaller than the impressive Angkor wat but the separate elements make up for a glorious whole. The bayon with its hundreds of faces was a magical place.

Neat temple that you should stop by to see. The Sight of the Enigmatic faces which has four huge smiling faces is awesome. This temple is pretty close to Ta Prohm, there's a shortcut that you can take to get there quickly. Loved also the Terrace of Elephants they look so real will never forget this day.

One of the true wonders of the world. These temples are truly amazing considering that they were built by hand and with none of the tools we enjoy today. Every corner is breath taking, the carvings are so beautiful and the atmosphere, wow! Everyone has to see this at least once in their lifetime
Good Tour Guide. Getting a tour guide who speaks good English and has a bubbly personality will make all the difference in your tour.
Don't miss this !!. A must to tick off on your bucket list. A stunning spiritual, geographic and historical experience that stimulates the mind.
Great place!. A very big place to explore! Was amazed with the history behind every carving, walkway etc. Happy to have ticked this off my bucket list!
how nice !!!. How good people that time , big big seton how they they carry on with them self , when I think about that now we are............la.....z..
outstanding. Visiting the Temples was our highlights, staying at a very nice hotel was the icing on the cake and al transport was taken care of
Angkor Thom vistit. Unimaginable. You would not believe the scale and the architecture of this ancient structure. You got to be there to see and feel it for yourself.

Incredible!. We had a local guide named Nary Heng - look him up on Facebook, (or Englishguide33@gmail.com) very knowledgeable and friendly with own tuk tuk and extra if needed for a larger party. Unforgettable experience. Bring plenty of drinking water!

Amazing site. Angkor Tom is all part of the Angkor Wat complex. It was built at the end of the 12th century by Jayavarman VII as the capital the Angkor empire. Large carvings of faces looking in 4 directions are amazing. Also the massive works gone into the building Thom is hard to take in. It is a 1000 year old building well worth the visit. Easy to access from Siem Reap by taxi or Tuk Tuk. Not a difficult walk

Unreal. Angkor Thom is massive and includes Bayon, Baphoun, Pimineakis, and many other temples. All located on what is essentially a man made island with the moat acting as a river encompassing Angkor Thom.For some hidden gems, check out Prasat Pallilay near the royal building, and a great trek is along the top of the wall. Rigt after entering the main gate to Angkor Thom stop the tuktuk and walk up to the monument you drove under. You can see all path that leads up the wall, and can walk for miles up there. Small temples at each corner, monkeys, and a lot of fun...great trek!

Wow! The temples of Angkor Wat and Thom are amazing. We chose our tour because it included Ankor Wat but we hadn't appreciated the full extent of the temple area. You really need more than one day to explore although as we were travelling with teenage kids they were fed up by the end of our day at the temples. Truly a spectacular sight and well worth a visit but wouldn't necessarily take your kids. Be aware that it's very very hot here in August.

wow. Angkor thom is the lesser known cousin of Angkor wat, it is however, no less impressive, take sunshade and waterproofs if you go in august, the weather can be rather erratic but no amount of rain can disappoint the temple

Amazing. Really great to see such an amazing piece of architecture. We visited in the middle of the day and the heat was near enough unbearable. Take plenty of water with you and ladies should cover up appropriately. I was wearing shorts and had to fork out for a sarong on the premises. The lady I bought it from initially asked for $25!! I managed to haggle her down though so don't be afraid to do that
One of the world wonders. Lots of stairs a wonder of the world well worth the visit .Recommend three day pass as a minimum . Good walking shoes a must.

One from the bucket ist you must visit. An amazing sight. Certainly one place not to be missed. Suggest visit early before the tourists. We headed there at 6am and certainly beat the masses ! All you could hear were the birds and insects and there were still snake trails across the path (no snakes though). Erie and fascinating to say the least

Exquisite !. How amazing it would have been to have lived during this era of beauty & wonder. This is a MUST SEE ! The vision of the design and incredible skill of the artisans who created it are only equalled by Angkor Wat. You can spend a whole day in the Angkor Thom area - cycle, take a picnic, savour the timeless beauty and serenity..

Angkor Thom..stunning. This place is amazing. The history and the culture preservation is wonderful. Photo opportunities abound. I had a young man offer to take some photos for me and they were really good. Me and a couple of the faces got close and personal. You could spend a day here without too much effort. Worth the trip. Loved Cambodia, although really hot this time of year.

Amazing Ancient structures. Nothing short of amazing what was constructed so long ago without automation.The huge trees with roots entwined within the temple structure tops off what is one of the most spectacular ancient sights of the world.
Different. Uniques and beautiful in its own way - I love the feeling and energy you experience in each individual temple
Awesome.. I loved exploring these ruins. I wish there was more information provided within the park to help provide further information about the historical information.
Wonderful architecture. Lovely to watch at sunrise. But we didn't get chance as our kids still sleeping. however we did the sunset instead, unfortunately it was cloudy and rain. Hemm no chance again!

Angkor To. Classic site. You just plain have to go if you are making the visit.
Worth the time and the patience.

A must visit place if you love history. This is righly said as 'Pyramid of Asia'. It is so huge and grand and magical !! It made me get lost in history and almost visualize the past ! But yes, if you don't have a guide to explain, you may get bored of broken structures and big stones.

Amazing!. Beside Angkor Wat, this site is one of my favourite. The area around the temple has this vast green shades, makes it perfect to visit any time of the day.
I visited here when the sun almost set, there were cicadas sound, birds.
Just amazing...

Great view. You can go really high up in this temple, but remember you slso have to climb down. The ladders you have to climb are very steep so take care. The temple it self is not as great as the other, but it is also very difficult to compare the diffrent temples. But for a great view visit this temple. It also has a nice patway coming into the temple.
Don't Miss It!. Beautiful place, could spend hours looking at it from every angle and studying the carvings on the walls (that tell stories of the history).

Fascinating. Arrived at sunrise, but unfortunately it was a hazy morning, so we didn't get the view we had hoped for. Nevertheless it was worth it. The temples are all absolutely stunning. We did the temples on the small circuit, but our tuk tuk driver kindly drove us to the others just so we could take photos. If you are in the the region it's well worth making time to visit the temples.
Beautiful. This is site is almost unreal. I felt a lot like I was in a Lara Croft video game! Make sure you have the right clothing to get out and explore a bit.

Be early ;). Impressive and if you have the idea to do some photo shoots during sun rise, be aware that you are never alone. I was told that there are around 200 photographers at 5:30 am (opening) during peak season (November - February) but I joined around 4-500 Tourists at this morning in September. So, be early to get a good place for watching/photographing.

iconic views of Angkor. Some of the most iconic photos of Angkor complex were taken here. Very much worth visiting, especially if You rent out a tuk tuk for the whole day.There are a lot of children trying to make you buy something, so it's not always very peaceful.
ruins with a view. Fantastic old ruins with trees growing right through them. Quite a bit of walking required, up and down steps, care is needed, but well worth the effort.
Awesome!. Really enjoyed Angkor Thom. Beautiful scenery and temple! Would definitely recommend visiting this when in Siem Reap

Complete this as part of your intinerary. One of the many temples to visit. Make sure you take a few days to spend time in them all. But please be respectful as they are temples, and historical footprints.

Breathtaking. We had a guide for our tour which made it so much better. He was able to explain the stonework and tell us stories that made it so real. If you can I would suggest doing this. It was a beautiful walk even though the humidity was high that day. We have some beautiful pictures as memories. Definitely can't leave Cambodia without seeing Angkor Thom.

Mind blowing experience. We bought the 24 hour ticket - meaning you can access the park after 5/6pm to watch the sunset and then come back the next morning to experience the one day tour.We hired a tuk took driver for the whole day which cost us $15. He was super accommodating and waited patiently while we explored the numerous temples on site.This trip should be on everyones bucket list! Enjoy!

A Must Do. This is one of the truly great examples of historical architecture and culture. I visited with much excitement and high expectations. The kind of expectations which can frequently lead to disappointment. No chance of that here. This is a magnificent, beautiful and awe-inspiring structure.
One of the Wonders of the World. Great site to visit. Take plenty of water and sun hat though. Visited in the afternoon and watch sunset. Colours and reflections excellent

Great place to visit. I loved this place. I may have liked it even more than Angkor Wat because it wasn't as crowded and you get a beautiful reflection in the pond for photos. There were friendly monks walking around which was cool and a nice operating prayer temple across the road. It's easy to walk around here and there's many shade trees around when it's too hot.

Excellent day out - Wear good footwear. Similar to Angkor Wat, this is an absolute must see in Siem Reap. We spent a half day here and our daughter loved climbing over the slabs of rock everywhere. Wear suitable footwear as it is quite a temple with different levels and always be prepared with some rain gear as it tipped down halfway through and we sheltered in a rather crowded space with loads of other tourists!
Angkor Wat Tour. Fantastic place to walk around and see around in this history place in Angkor Wat but a bit hot weather in Siem Reap.
Wow. One of the best Wat I have ever visited. I booked my tour with 'Happy Angkor Wat Tour' and would highly recommend them.

Get ready to be amazed! !. Amazingly breathtaking. .be prepared for the heat. .we paid $15 for a guide..The info was good but he yelled it at us ws I regretted getting guide ten mins into it..but he was lovely enough. Larger than Angkor Wat, tour on a bike if possible.. Visited Angkor Thom on a bike tour with Grasshopper Tours. After Angkor Wat, this is a great temple site to visit, especially Bayon, with the amazing four face Buddha statues.
Loved it!. One of my favourite temples in Cambodia. Definitely a temple you should visit if in Siem Reap. Try going early in the morning to beat the crowds
cool Trees. has a lot of cool growing trees which assimilate the ruins. Walk through takes about 30 minutes and brings you to the other end.

Mesmerizing. All of the monuments and building structures in Siem Reap is mesmerizing. The place and people are beautiful. Still old fashioned in its way of life and sense of culture. Food is awesome. I love to mingle with the locals. But the big city Phnom Penh is being westernized in modern day life moving in the fast lane. I've been to Siem Reap many times. Born in Cambodia and raised in the United States all my life. Siem Reap is a destination everyone must visit once in their life! Ancient temple ruins and structures dates back thousands of years.
Great food. Great food prepared and served by ex street children, here they are given the opportunity to gain skills.

day tour around Angkor Wat. lucky to find a tuktuk driver who didnt charged much on a whole day tour around Angkor Wat..just be ready with your hat or umbrella and flat shoes and take pics in every structures.ruined as it is but its amazing to think how it was built and still stood up until now

It's better than Ankor Wat. I went on September 2015.It's definitely better than angkor Wat. Yes it might be smaller than Angkor wat, but the temples are scattered around the forest which is nice. I enjoy every little bit piece of the templeBut the cons areThe price of things in the market are higher than in town. And the vendor ladies were very aggresive and it surely disturbing. Overall. It will provide you with information on almost every aspect of your life..
