brilliant!. It is unique ancient stone temples. We were able to climb amongst the ruins with our wonderful guide to explain all to us. The highlight of our trip to cambodia

Stunning . This whole area holds a bunch of temples to explore. Take the time like we did and explore them all. You will not regret it. If you do not have the time then do bayon and the palace. Follow the signs in the palace area because it will take you through the back to this beautiful and peaceful temple.

A bucket list event. This is indeed one of the architectural wonders of the world, but the most amazing thing is there is better temples to find outside of this main complex. Everyone will go, the one very overated thing not to do is rush to the sunrise photo sessions, as depending on the time of the year it is permanently overcast in the morning. Sleep in instead!

Travelling into time, amazing views and structures. Like most people, we didn't really realize how big this complex of ancient temples was until we actually visited it. The most famous of these temples is the Angkor Wat and usually people refer to the whole complex by just naming it "Angkor Wat". There are several temples and old towns in this region (which spans up to 400 square km-thats a lot!) and its probably impossible to visit all of them if you are planning to spend only 3 days. We had only 3 days and we managed to cover the basic and most known sites/temples but unfortunately we didnt get the chance to see the sun rising and sunset views because of cloudy weather. Planning your visit at this temples can be done by internet before you arrive or on the spot (usually hotels can arrange a tour for you). You can either hire a driver (motorcycle chariot- its fun) or you can hire bicycles and cycle all the way to the temples (thats a lot of cycling though..). We hired a driver and he was available for the whole day, he did not follow us into the temples but waited for us to finish our tour and then drove us to the next temple etc. First day we arrived we did the Vespa tour (evening) which was really fun, the guide took us around Siem Reap and we had a walk into the night market were we ate some local BBQ and had a try on some insects and "weird" stuff. The guide (very good english) was really friendly and gave us a lot of info about the local and the way the live. Second day we booked a driver and we did the so called "small circuit" but you can amend the tour and do whatever you want as the day goes on. So in one day we managed to visit the Angkor Wat Temple and then we went to the Ta Prohm temple (Tomb Raider movie - trees) - spend a few hours in each of them. We also managed to go to Angkor Thom in the same day. Angkor Thom was a great city and its huge! The city walls are 3km x 3km (you can cycle the perimeter of the wall = 12km) and there are four amazing entrances (N, S, E, W). The highlights of Angkor Thom are located at the centre, where the Bayon temple is (temple with faces). A few meters away is the Baphuon temple were you can go up the main structure and have amazing views. In the same vicinity there are the terrace of Lepperds King and terrace of Elephants (small structures that can be viewed by walking by) and a market where you can get tourist stuff like souvenirs etc (you can bargain and you should :) )The last day we asked the driver to take us in some of the temples that are located in the "big circuit" and just drive us through the rest of the circuit. It was worth it! We visited the Banteay Kdei and Preah Khan only because we didnt have much time but they were definitely worth it. Overall we had a great time, walked a lot and took hundreds of photos!Enjoy
stunning. A stunning place to visit, photos just don't do it justice! Take plenty of water, camera, and good walking shoes as you won't want to stop expliring.
Must see in Siem Reap. Very cool, loved wandering around, it was just too crowded by the time we got the the main temple with all the faces. Definitely a must see.

Parks family visit to Angkor Thom. My family & I went through our hotel Saem Siemreap Hotel to reserve an all day van driver, who took us to all the temples, one of which was Angkor Thom. The fee included visiting every temple that we wanted to as well as the van and paying the driver. We loved the van ride, which had air conditioning and the driver was knowledgeable and so polite. He wore a perpetual smile on his face. His demeanor was meek and mild and he tried so hard to please us.We stood outside the temple and he gave us basic information on it. We then went from room to room exploring while he talked about the religion associated with the temple.

Surprised by Beauty. Around every corner and tree was something new and amazing. The wall carvings, green moss, huge trees and the stories they told gave us picture of a civilization about which we were not aware. So worth the time involved to get there. Would recommend getting a personal guide. We used Mr. Voeun Savuth with About Asia and he showed us areas that were not heavily populated and provided wonderful meals.

One of the temples you have to see. Admittedly, as horrible as this sounds, given what incredibly significant landmarks these are, after a few temples, they start to run together. However, Angkor Thom is reall amazing. You cannot miss it.

Stepping back in history. When you attend Agkor Wat, and by extension Angkor Thom, there is this feeling of walking back in time. The feel of the stones, the sight of the trees growing on top of walls, helps to bring thoughts of Laura Croft racing through your brain. Be sure and allocate enough time to see not only Angkor, but also the remote ruins in the surrounding areas. I wish that I had the time to do it

Inspiring. There is nothing more to add than had already been said a million times on here. In a time that we Europeans arrogantly call the "dark ages", the Khmer empire was at it's apex. Very little remains in Europe from this time period, yet the Khmer still have these treasure troves of history. It's sad that they are owned by Vietnam rather than Cambodia, but that's the way it is...

Another awesome temple. My reviews are getting a bit samey now but for good reason. All the temples in siem reap are worth going too. This was one was pretty awesome. You can really appreciate the shear man power that was required to build them
Better than Angkor Wat. I enjoyed this more than Angkor Wat. We took time to explore the grounds. Worth spending a few hours here to enjoy the full experience.

Amazing nature and temple. Great millenary temples surrounded by lush vegetation and enormous trees. You feel hunger for history and wonder about ancient civilisations. Get yourself a guide or just bring your own book if you want to do it a your own pace.
A must to see. There are many temples to visit which could take you all day . In all honesty once you had seen 3 or more they become much the same but well worth the visit to
Wonderful Temple Visit. Angkor Thom is a wonderful temple to visit and is an absolutely stunning place to visit. The temple is so well preserved and offers a glimpse into the past!
beautiful. i love the view it is beautiful there and i think when i visited there is was amazing if i had a chance i would go again!!!
Must see. try to go there very early in the morning although it will not help you to stay cooler, however there is much less people around :)
Quieter, peaceful temple.. Amazing temple, quieter than Angkor Wat. We really enjoyed climbing to the tops of these and enjoying the peaceful and relaxing views.

Breathtaking!. Absolutely breathtaking, a must see when you're in Cambodia. $20 you pay for for one day trip is totally worth it. Just make sure to rent a bike or a tuk tuk to drive you around, you'll need to pay around $15 for it.
Can't miss visit to Siem Reap.. Ancient history. Awesome to know these were built many years ago. This is where Tomb Raider was filmed. M

Slice of history!. We were blown away by the sheer scale of the temple complex here. We explored in the rain, which made it more atmospheric somehow (as well as getting rid of other tourists!). Amazing place.
Bayon = BOSS!. My personal highlight of my visit would have to of been Bayon (apart of Thom), absolutely blown away by it.

You must go, i loved it.. Amazing - We hired a tuk tuk driver from our hotel for $20 for the day. You can get them for $15. He was lovely and gave us ice water. Kids are free under 12, they will need to show a passport if the children look 12. Paid $20 for a one day pass. Set off early. It was very hot. You will be in full sun a lot of the time. Wear a hat. Make sure you are wearing a t shirt or top that is covering your shoulders and a skirt or shorts that goes to your knees. You willn't be allowed to go into the temples if you are not dressed correctly. Where good shoes and the flooring is very uneven. We took my 5 & 6 year old girls, they loved being our guides around the temples. We saw monkeys jumping on the temples and running around the grounds.

a visit of a lifetime. This is a visit of a lifetime. We expected the tress going on and over buildings to be creepy, but it wasn't creepy at all - just amazing. If you are going to Siem Reap, you must visit here
interesting. wear proper walking shoes... the ground is uneven with stones and tree roots at some point.. remember to take pics with the magnificent trees that are huge! :)
Relics of history. These are relics of history that amazes one. How so many years, they made such beautiful carvings without any of the modern support mechanisms being available.
Angkor Wat. One of those places that is a must see and does not disappoint, go well prepared so as to avoid temple fade.

Bayon, Baphon and beyond. I want to write about Angkor Thom, because I found the temples there just as interesting and beautiful as it immediate neighbour Angkor Wat. Bayon temple with the four faced stupas was my favourite photo subject, followed by the elephant terrace and Leper king terrace, then Baphon temple. Allow yourself at least 3 -4 hours to visit all these temples. And because the area is well travelled, you can do like me and just hire a Tuktuk for the day, unless you really need a guide.

Beautiful site - spolit by poor crowd control.. I really did like this place - but all significance is lost by the noisy masses that clamber and push through all of the many nooks and crannies. Do use a guide who knows their way around and ask to take you away from the crowds. Again - more tourist police needed to control the unruly masses. Maybe the Vietnamese government who gets 80% of the entry ticket to the park (yes that is right!) needs to be a little more giving rather than taking...

Be the attraction. We rode the elephants into the site as soon as they started tours (9am), as soon as we mounted the howdy people started taking photos of us. This continued until we disembarked at the end of the ride. It was a bit embarrassing but the ride made it worth while. Because we were on an elephant the monkeys were not afraid of us so we got closeup with them as well and getting great views especially of the amazing boats as we crossed the bridge to Bayon. The temple is amazing, take breakfast and enjoy a seat somewhere inside but remember to take away your rubbish. Treat Bayon like any other religious site, dress appropriately and be respectful, especially around sites being actively used for worship. This is a big area arrange to meet your tuktuk driver at a particular place (otherwise you may not find him) I suggested the big old tree beside the road near the end of the elephant walk. If you don't arrange a meeting spot the driver will be with all the other drivers which is fine in June and July when there are few tourists so few tuktuks but other times of the year it can be impossible to find anyone. Speaking of Tuktuk driver try Mr Pahna he is the best in the business. Phone him on +855 1286 45 81 or 855 975085708 e.mail and facebook panhachhouk@yahoo.com and arrange him to pick you up from the airport. If you do get him as your driver ask him to take you to the local market for a tour, well worth a look and you can get real gems stones there. Beware of young people trying to get you to donate to their school fees, maybe not what you expect. If you want to help Cambodians try this .... On your way into Cambodia you are unlikely to have your full quota of kgs of luggage. Most airlines offer 30kgs but most people take nearly empty suitcases into the country and fill them while they are there. Don’t take a half empty suitcase into Cambodia, fill it up with children’s books, educational toys (no battery operated toys), toothbrushes, soap, shoes, technology items and other useful things. The items don’t need to be new, just in good working condition. Please don’t take lollies or sugary stuff and don’t offer religious items, Cambodians have a diversity of religions available to them, let them choose. You can ask your hotel to distribute the items or take them to the Children’s Sanctuary.

Chilling out around the Angkor temples. All the temples around Siem Reap are well worth a visit, the history that surrounds these wonderful temples is amazing, and Siem Reap is a very laid back city to sped some time in.
I needed more days!. What a wonderful site. I have only had a day to experience Angkor and I completely regret no having booked more days.
The best of the world. Very Very special place of the world. You should not believe whom if you still not go there which see by yourself.
Impressive Faces. Angkor Thom was thoroughly impressive with the large faces covering its facade. Maybe my favorite temple. Can take a couple of hours to enjoy that construction.
Fantastic. One of the best archeological sites in the world. Nearly unbeatable !!!! Big and elegant at the same time. Fascinating because of the natural location.

Grat place!!. Great, amazing place, worth every minute and penny, sorry dollar :) All Angkor Watt is worth to explore, not only for 1 day!! We've been there for 2 days, and it was also few places we haven't managed to see! I recomend it very much!! The best option for 2nd day is to take tuk-tuk and make an "express" few hours trip. The driver will take you in few amazing places, they know the best what is worth to see!
Dont miss. Great. Ride the elephants. The mahouts own their own elephants and seemed very good with them. Vist the Bayon - spectacular centre of the walled city
Angkor Must see. one of the main three temples in Angkor, an absolute must see.great opportunities for artsy as well as silly selfie pictures. My wife's favourite one of the 3.
Unforgettable!. Great place and an unforgettable experience! The structures are so huge and amazingly built that you can´t believe what you are seeing.

More temples than you can poke a stick at. . We did a day tour that went to Ankor Wat, Ankor Thom, Bayon Temple and the Temple Tomb Raider was filmed at. Our tour guy Leak was hilarious, knew so much about each temple, took the time to stop and explain the carvings as well as what each building was for and took us to the best places to get photos. The tour was meant to finish watching the sun set, however due to the afternoon storm we missed this part, but that didn't take anything away from the day. It's extremely hot and there are thousands of stairs so take plenty of water and wear a hat. The stairs are more like ladders so good comfortable shoes are a must. At the start of the tour you purchase a temple pass that gets you into all the temples. Don't lose it and be prepared for them to take your picture. The pass is $20usd. This was an awesome look at history and a must do in Siem Reap.

good place!. nice,amazing~~Angkor Thom is undeniably an expression of the highest genius. It is, in three dimensions and on a scale worthy of an entire nation, the materialization of Buddhist cosmology, representing ideas that only great painters would dare to portray.
WOW. Amazing site - the amount of intricate detail within such a large structure is really impressive as is the historical back story provided by my guide Yous Sopanha.

Angkor Thom Mini Tour. We joined the Angkor Thom Mini Tour on our day 2, and we visited all the temples inside the compound of the Angkor Thom. We hired a tour guide and ride a tuktuk all arranged by the hotel.

A Must See while In Siam Reap. A beautiful Experience! Be prepared to walk heaps but be prepared to be mesmerised by the ruins that have stood here for so long. The breath taking history of civilisation, architecture at its best - even if it lies in ruins in many cases, the natural world almost appearing to claim the ruins as part of its territory is all, pretty amazing. I won't be forgetting these experiences for a long time. Yes there are a lot of people around but its to be expected! August is a very hot time of year to travel and its also the rainy season so just be aware as you plan your trip. Otherwise, mornings are great because its not too too hot.
Not to be missed. I enjoyed this temple more than the Angkor Wat temples. I loved the carvings and the trees which grew from the roof. Really good photos.

A great guide makes for a great tour. I first met Souphanna (Phanna) in March 2006 on my first of three trips to SE Asia. I fondly remember our trip to Siem Reap and the amazing tour of Angkor with Phanna. We appreciated his knowledge and passion of his country and his pride of showing the treasure of Angkor Wat to visitors. We should all love what we do and the country we live as much as Phanna. This is remarkable given the history and difficulties that Cambodia has endured. He was the first guide we experienced in SE Asia and I think about our time to this day. He guided us around the grounds of Angkor skillfully, avoiding the bus crowds. At mid-day we paused in the shade and he told us the stories that we were about to see on the walls of the next temple. Phanna had water and cold towels at the ready when we returned to the car after our visits to various temples. I have stayed in touch with Phanna since our visit. We visited the floating village. We saw so much in just the 3 days we were in Siem Reap, and Phanna wanted to tailor the tour to you. He wanted to know you, and what you wanted to see, offering his suggestions. He was relieved when we passed on Angkor at sunrise, but he did provide a great view for photos of the sunset. I have referred family and friends to him when they have visited Siem Reap. He is knowledgeable, thoughtful, kind and has a great sense of humour. I would highly recommend Phanna if you want an experience you will carry with you forever. This review is 9 years overdue, but it should demonstrate the impression he made. I hope to see my friend some time in future. I would welcome a return trip to Siem Reap to visit with him again.
a lot of history and appreciation. Beautiful city Siem reap is. This is one of those places where you get a feel of the Old century cities and temples.
Outstanding. Outstanding...once in A lifetime location this will never leave my top 3 places in the world to see...

A testament to Time, Nature and Humankind... all together, all at once. If you're planning to go to Cambodia, chances are that you'll be legging it to Siem Reap and (so) to Angkor Wat. But its next door, perhaps lesser known cousin Angkor Thom is a beautiful remnant of the legacy of the Khmer civilizations of yore. With surreal jungle overgrowth, these ruins stand testament to Time, Nature and Humankind... all together, all at once. But bewarned, there will be tourists. Lots of them. Armed with cameras and selfie sticks. So try and get there as early as you can - in the wee hours of the morning. Thats when most of them flock to Angkor Wat, to get that perfect postcard photo opportunity at sunrise - leaving Angkor Thom and its stories, for you.
City temple. Huge area with central temple. Lots of Buddha heads. 54 columns one for each providence of the kingdom. Compact and some good carvings.

Absolutely fantastic, not to be missed. Angkor Thom was an absolutely fascinating place to see. It is something that you could take 100's of photos and still not capture all of the amazing trees, 300 years old and the Temples - 12th century

get there at 5 am. Best place ever especially in a foggy morning.
The trees make this place magical. Sadly the government is cutting the trees because they think they are destroying themonument .

An amazing place of visit with all the temple replicas. It is a great place to visit and to take photographs of all the replicas. One wonders how these could havebeen built without any machinery and only human labour together with the elephants.Great place of visit.
Spectacular site. Love this place! It's amazing that until this day we are able to see these ancient treasures. It's such a wonderful experience that one has to come and see!
A dream come true. This place was my husband's dream come true. I am so glad that we were able to visit it now. Who knows what it will be like in the future, perhaps not so easy to access.

It was too hot during the day. Should have gone late or early but it does get busy then.. Very interesting. You do have to pay $20 US to get into the park but that covered all the temples in Angkor Wot
Amazing. The temples are absolutely amazing, lots of walking, visit early in day if possible as they all get very busy and hot.

interesting. one of many temples; some people around selling various things like at every site: but remember they are just trying to earn a living. the temple itslef would take about 1 hour to visit by taking your time.

Amazing place - so many beautiful temples!. What an amazing place! We entered the Ankor Thom site by the south gate, arriving in style via tuk tuks. Fantastic place with it's three dimensional representation of Buddhist, Cosmology and sculptures of Buddha-like images on its temples. The site includes The Bayon and Bahpuon temples, Elephant Terrace and Terrace of the Leper King. There is so much to see, many stairs to climb but the views are worth it. I could have spent much longer at each site but we had a lot to cram in that day on our tour. This is truly a spectacular site and one not to be missed. Very interesting to listen to the history of each temple, would recommend visiting with a tour guide.
Iresistible Nature's Power. Angkor Thom really gave me the more understanding on how nature can do, that human made things can't resist.It is naturally beautiful.
breathtaking !. lucky to have been there on a day where not thousands of noisy and hectic tour Group tourists invaded the place ! an unforgettable view and experience

A touch of spirit. Captivating temple steeped in awesome history - some climbing but less strenuous than Angor Wat - touching noses with Buddha a highlight !! ( talk with your guide about this experience)
City in the rainforest. Most impresive, much larger than I had imagined. Walking on the city wall was an unexpected highlight, especially as few people choose to do this.

Even better than Angkor Wat. We arrived early enough that it was still relatively quiet, and I loved the character given to the place by the faces. There are lots of nooks and crannies to explore, the only thing that took away from it a little was a huge coach tour party lining up around the top of Bayon temple to get their picture taken with people dressed in traditional Cambodian dramatic masks and outfits. I found it a little too commercial for somewhere like this.I thought the terrace of elephants and leper king were disappointing, but other than that this is a brilliant place to explore and I found it far more interesting and beautiful than Angkor Wat!
Beautiful and big!. Very big! I now understand why they do 1-3-7 day tours. So much to see and it's a huge park where you can walk around and explore.

Interesting visit. Walk around with the guide who explained history of Angkor-wat and Thom. Very impressive temples. We decided not to go far as there are just too many temples to visit. We just stuck to the bigger temples.
Terrific tour. This was a fantastic trip dating back to the eleventh century. My wife and I enjoyed this trip very much.

Amazing!. This is one of the more mesmerizing and amazing temples in the Angkor Empire. Though ruined by time and unscrupulous temple raiders, the beauty and mysticism of the place have not worn out. A must visit!
Another stunning place. Amazing manpower made construction. This place is one of the most beautiful place that I have never visit.

Beautiful however busy. Beautiful views, with a small group (5 +tour guide). We found the other much larger tours very noisy and disturbed the beautiful peace and tranquillity of the area. I would highly recommend a tour guide as we were shown hidden extras that made the trip feel special.

A MUST TO SEE AFTER ANGKOR WAT. The last capital city of the Khmer empire, Angkor Thom is a short drive from Angkor Wat. The most significant part of the complex is Bayon Temple, with its massive carved heads.You enter the walled city via one of two causeways lined on each side by giant carved mythical beings called devas and asuras. The statues depict the chuning of the mikly sea myth which is depicted in a fine carve base relief within the Angkor Wat.Also within the 'city' is Ta Prohm temple made famous by the Lara Croft movie, with its giant trees whose roots wind their way over walls to create the most errie of sights. There is much more to be found if you have the time and inclination to explore. Overall the entire Angkor Archeoligical site is certainly one of the wonders of the world and well worth several visits.

Amazing Angkor. Quiet large and spread out. We went as a family of 4.with 2 little kids. We read about the place on Internet and only went to Bayon temples. Quiet amazing Buddha temples with the 4 face Buddhas

Once in a Life Time visit. To experience the past and see what has been left behind for future generations to visit is a must for all who visit Cambodia it is truly a once in a life time experience and if you fail to come here then you have not been to Cambodia
Must see!. A must see when in Angkor Wat. Incredible temple, especially the faces of Bayon. Don't miss the gates and the reflections in the nearby natural pools.
Amazing. It turned out to be the amazing place you expect. Definitely more than just ticking of a bucket list item.

Spectacular . Amazing place to see. We didn't do a tour instead used a guide book and didn't feel like we missed out on anything, personal preference really, either way won't set you back much ($5usd-$15usd max). We got here about 8.30am after doing sunrise and Angkor Wat and the crowds were smallish so would recommend going early if you can.

Amazing Angkor Thom. Amazing, no wonder it's world heretige listed and one of the top tourist attractions in the world. There are a lot of steps to get to the very top so remember this as it's also very hot.

Beautiful Bayon. One of my favourite Wats due to the Bayon with the wonderful heads and smiling faces and the stunning 'Elephant Terrace'. August is a great time to visit as the site was relatively empty.
Temples. It is a beautiful temple. To see it in person is just magnificant. The artisans and workmanship are unbelievable for a temple built in year 1000.

Spent 1/2 day at this large complex of temples. Our family spent 1/2 day at this complex of 6 separate structures, the main one being Bayon Temple. We got there early at 7 a.m. and started with Bayon, the most popular. It is good to get an early start to beat the crowds and the heat. Baphoun has many levels and climbing the stairs to the levels are a workout. The Terrace of the Elephants is impressive. Our guide shared that the King had 60,000 elephants during his kingdom. The elephants would battle in the open area and kill the water buffalo as the king and spectators watched. The many stone structures in front of the terrace is where the acrobats would perform for the king. It must have been an amazing sight during the kingdom.
Not to be missed. Even larger in area than Nearby Angkor Wat. So even another must see, truly impressive what the ancients achieved.
awesome. wow, what a great place to visit. I recommend it. go with a Cambodian guide, he will show you the nicest things and the "hidden" things too.

Sights that continue to amaze @Angkor Thom. Angkor Thom is my favourite area of the Angkor Archealogical park. I have been before and Bayon in particular I find fascinating and beautiful, however there is so much to see with amazing stories of the past. I find having a guide is great as you gain so much from their knowledge, which thanks to ongoing research continues to be built on helping us understand further the civilization that existed here in the past..

Very hot in August!. The whole complex is of course beautiful if you like to visit temples. It is tiring, takes a day or two or 3 :) I would recommend a tuk tuk for the whole tour, you can rent a bike too, but for August it was too hot, especially after 13pm. Vsiting at sunrise, gives a spectacular view and feeling. They open at 5am so even after spending 7-8 hours there you have the whole day in front of you.

Angkor Thom is the one Angkor to rule them all.. Angkor Thom is where it's at for the Angkor experience. Much larger that Angkor Wat and perfect for grazing around the historic ruins. Loads of temples. Most have been Buddaized, but you can still get a feel for the Hindu past. Here there is a great variety of near complete temples and decaying ruins. The vastness allows you to roam around without a guide or guidebook and make your own discoveries. For literally a couple dollars you can hire a tuk tuk for a few hours or the day. In our case we spent about five hours in the complex. I highly recommend doing this. Tuk tuk drivers know where the most common sites are. You can use that as a starting point and return to your driver once you're ready to move on. Our diver was great and we give him a nice tip for the great service and advice. Angkor Wat is the main draw to Siep Reap, but don't miss this part of the experience.
Hot, Damn Hot!. A fabulous ancient, historical, monument. It is worth the stair climbing to see the entire vista. BUT, if you are not fit and can be heat affected be aware it is very taxing.

Siem reap. Another wonderful experience. Well worth the heat to see this.this is also the place where tomb raider was filmed(if your interested ) The tres amazing and don't forget to go nose to nose with budda a photo must!

Smiling Buddhas. The facade of this ancient city is impressive. The carved faces look down on all comers and are in differing states of repair. It is interesting to see which of the faces have survived the ravages over the centuries. As you move closer to the center of the temple the faces take on a less forbidding look and seem to smile more. The faces smile more as they reach enlightenment.
A must see. Simply amazing! Breathtaking place. Expecialy if you go there with a good guide, this can become an unforgettable experience.
Temples. Fantastic! Our best temple along with the "Jungle Temple". Bayon is the standout feature of Angkor Thom.
I liked this complex more than Angkor Wat. as it's so much easier to navigate. The giant heads are amazing as are the main entry gates/causeway. Magnificent.
Awesome!. Absolutely amazing temple and a lot of temples around. Bayon has a lot of sculptures and meaning. It's very nice to explore the temple.
A very special place. Wow! We had an excellent day here and couldn't recommend it enough. You can't go to Siem Reap and not visit here.

The many faces of Bhudda. This temple is not as large as Angkor Wat but it has the many faces of Bhudda. It is easy to get around I out too much of a climb. You also cross the Bhudda bridge with evil and good on opposite sides.

My favorite of the temples..... My favourite out of the temples I visited. Angkor Thom was magical... We were able to roam freely, unlike the other crowded temples. We were able to take photos without a thousand other people. We were able to stand and marvel without being knocked and pushed along. A great experience and a must do...

small version of Angkor wat. nice place to view temples of two different religions, Hinduism and Buddhism. It is just like a small version of Angkor wat but it is counted as one of the must go place along with Angkor wat.

amazing. Felt very proud to have reached and walked through the temples. Made me amazed how the old civilization was able to build something so majestic and beautiful.
For our getaway to the temple and complex, you can visit my blog at http://katmeifucan.blogspot.com/2015/08/sunrise-at-angkor-wat-complex.html

My favourite of all the temples. The Bayon (central temple) at Angkor Thom was my favourite of the many temples in this UNESCO World Heritage area. Whilst all are unique and spectacular in their own way, I found this one particularly spectacular due to the many faces of Avalokiteshvara carved in the towers and the extraordinary views from the exterior, plus the amazing entry gates (the south one we used is apparently the best-restored).
One of the Top 5 Temples who should visit. It was an amazing experience. There are a lot to see and learn about the old times of Kmers and we were very astonished for the quality and enormous work.

Better than Angkor Wat. We were pretty underwhelmed by Angkor Wat and thought that Angkor Thom was much more interesting - the faces on the temple of Bayon and the elephant promenade were highlights for us. Definitely get a tuctuc as the heat was unbearable!
Nature loves Ruins. The old ruins merging with nature as trees wrap their roots around the buildings is an incredible site!
One of my fave. this is one of my favorite temples in Angkor. We had the one day tour and paid $20. we were able to visit a total of 8 temples.
truly amazing. truly amazing site containing too many temples to count. the engineering and craftsmanship is extremely good considerably the age
Stunning View. Marvelous Sunrise and day view. Stunning. Be prepared for lots of climbing if you want the view. Your hard work will be repaid.

Exceptional!. the tuk tuk driver drop us to here, and we were amazed with the Angkor! One of the best sites must visit before you die! Luckily we visit the Angkor National Museum before visit Angkor Wat Area, so we know more about the Angkor.

Superb. The faces carved on the stones are amazing!
It makes you think how hard it was to create all this.
There should be information on signs to help everyone understand about the history of the site without tour guides.

Went looking for a King and found so much more.... Going to Angkor Thom for a second time I was still in awe of the grandness of it. Read up on the temples before going, it helps a great deal. It and the whole Angkor Wat temple complex will take your breath away.
Wonderful experience. Fantastic experience. Beautiful ruins. Great tour guide who took us from our hotel. This is one of the world's best sites.

Reconstructed ruins. Whilst I didn't have any illusions of untouched ancient wonders, and was fully prepared for the swarm of self sticks, what I found most disappointing with these "ruins" was the sheer amount of reconstruction that was going on. Everything it seemed was being repaired. Cynicism aside, these are still worth seeing. By the way don't go in Feb-July, my guide says the heat will kill you.

Amazing temple. The ruins were truly amazing and can only imagine the inspiration behind this great work. We can only reflect the tribute they gave to their gods. It is truly a place to reflect of the past and people who created this place. An awesome experience.

Old ruins. The place is HUGE. To imagine this was the first civilisation to reach a population of 1 million people over a millennia ago is astounding and mindblowing. Definitely worth going to take a look.

WOW a must see on your trip. We visited this amazing place in July and only had time for a day pass , should have taken the forur day pass. This was the highlight of our trip. Amazing on such a large scale.Hired a tuk tuk driver who picked us up from our hotel and dropped us off to each temple in between.Just waiting for us in between then dropped us back to our hotel for $14 US dollars.

Refereshing. This is one of my favorite Temples. I enjoyed the gates which is very picturesque (minus the hoard of tourists). The drive or ride around this temple is very relaxing. Too bad I didnt see the monkeys. :(
really enjoyable and intresting. this is very interesting, but go to less known temples and don't spend too long. The temple is frankly amazing.
Angkor Thom. The causeway leading to Agkor Thom is lined with statues on either side. Demons on one side and Gods on the other.The archway at the end of the causeway is stunning.

remains of a Khmer city of the XII century. What's remains of a Khmer city of the XII century is impressive.You will see it to go and visit the Bayon, however it is a place to go and spend time for itself.The Elephant Terrace is an interesting place before the flood of tourists (sorry for this note because I was one as well...), i.e. early morning.Just stroll through this city, these ruins should I say (at least somewhat) in the middle of a lush vegetation, with a working excavations and reconstructions of the most interesting archaeological point of view, this provides relief. I insist .. but I like including the creation, those from human as well!

Just Wow.. Another amazing site offering a range of temples from the many-faced Bayon to several smaller temples. This place offers a great chance to walk between the temples, making the most of the dappled shade.
The Great Ruins. The Temples were everything I expected. You can feel the spirit of the builders as you walk the grounds. One of the great sights to see on this earth.

Stone faces will look at you!. The temple is very inspiring and the stone faces are special. Make sure you come in the early morning, then you will have the best experience from the daylight with less people and enjoy some quietness. Also, it will get quite hot later and exhausting.

Angkor Thom. Spent many days only on this site and it's my favorite !! Angkor Thom means "great city." It was the last great Angkorian capital of the Empire. It is the largest site in the Angkor Archaeological Park. It was estimated that the city had a population of nearly one million. To enter the city, you must go through one of the five great gateways that are topped with four giant faces and bridges leading to the doors are lined with statues ....... .............. Angkor Thom has several templesThe Bayon Temple:It is located in the center of the great walled city of Angkor Thom, it is well known to shelter dozens of faces of sculptures, there are aroundBaphuon:Baphuon temple is located between the Royal Palace and the Bayon within the walls of Angkor Thom. It is the largest mountain temple of Angkor. It was built around 1060 during the reign of Ydayadityavarman II, to the glory of ShivaThe terrace of the Elephants:The terrace of the Elephants spans 300 meters. The great interest of this terrace consists of the very long sculpted frieze depicting a procession of elephants, as well as the back porch walls, with their trained mythical animalsThe Leper King terrace:This terrace is located at the north end of the Terrace of Elephants, she was named for a statue on top of the wall which is supposedly the "Leper King". The statue of the Leper King currently on the Terrace of the Leper King is a replica, the original is in the National Museum in Phnom PenhPhimeanakas:Is a Hindu temple in the Khleang style, built in the late 10th century, during the reign of Rajendravarman. It is shaped like a pyramid with three levels, as a Hindu templeThe Royal Palace:It remains in ruins ...Huge complex so you need really time to visit completely the site.. Great place

Breathtaking and otherworldly. The scale of this place is unbelievable. You drive in through one of the ancient gates and you feel like it should be somehow forbidden to go there. Even though this is one of the more touristed temples it doesn't feel like it is too busy because the place is just so huge. There is so much to see there, so much to take in. If you plan to climb to the top of the temple overlooking the complex you should be ware that you need to bring a shirt with sleeves to show respect. They also don't allow heavily pregnant women in and you should know that the climb is daunting and very steep. There are only a limited number of people allowed to the top each day and they don't know how long it will still be possible to allow public access before the ancient structure starts to crumble beneath the burden. We were among the lucky ones who got to go to the top. The view is spectacular.put a bottle of water in the freezer the night before, it will be melted by the time you are inside. You will spend a lot of time walking and climbing so dress comfortably. This complex is not as well preserved as Ankor Wat in its entirety but parts of it is and it is all definitely worth seeing. Its also worth taking an official guide with you to tell you about what you are seeing and where you are. We would never have known that the forests we were wandering through was once the royal palace or that the ponds were their swimming pools. You should also be aware that you need to buy a pass from the registered office to visit any of the temples around Siem Reap. Ask your hotel for more details. Should be $20 per day or $40 for 3 days.
touristy. this is my favorite temple of all the wats in siem reap. very unique and feels like you're in the other dimension :)

Better than Angkor Wat. The statues and carvings in Angkor Thom is far more impressive than Angkor Wat and it isn't any smaller than Angkor Wat either. My favourite feature of Angkor Thom is Bayon (imagine the 4 faced giant Angelina Jolie was fighting over, just numerous of them). The 54 Gods and Demons lining the bridge over the moat is equally impressive. And then, there's the Terrace of the Elephants. Unmissable!

Temples are amazing street stalls are a rip off. Street stalls within the whole complex are a total rip off. Food in sub standard at 5 star prices. Where does this one go as it not in the presentation of the stalls
Angkor by tuk tuk. Better than expected , get the 3 day pass. Try and get a good English speaking tuk tuk driver as it is a better way to get around
Awesome, incredible and amazing. No words can describe the temple - incredible, stunning, awe inspiring ... you need to experience them.

Visit to the Byon Angkor Thom. Just another huge must see complex which is better know as Byon the face temple. There are 5 main entrance gates to the main temple. The distance is about 2 Km from either gate at least. Each of the gates can be visited free of charge and the small stuff in the corners of the compound. As well as the elephant terrace. Only the main temples are staffed with ticket checkers who are very rude. My last visit was last year in August not September.
Best photo opportunities in Siem Reap. Part of Angkor Wat tour, lots of natural beauty intertwined with the temple. Definitely worth a visit. Take a tour guide to explain the history
Very hot, very crowded. Very good but very crowded, we got so hot it was hard to keep going. We were going back for a second day but decided to lounge by the pool instead.

My favourite temple!. This place is just breath taking.We took in sunrise at Angkor Watt and instead of following the crowds in - we went straight to Angkor Thom by tuktuk. At 6:30am we literally had Bayon all to ourselves in the cool morning breeze - amazing!Walked on to the Elephant wall and Leper King - again all alone.As we then headed back to our hotel for breakfast at 9am the crowds were descending and loud tour groups. Left them to it

ancient temple complex will take your breath away!. This ancient temple complex will take your breath away. A visit to this ancient temple complex will take your breath away. Enjoy the ancient architecture and the grassy knolls.
Angkor thom Temple. If you want to come and visit cambodia please don't forget come to visit Angkor thom temple, that is the most one one the main temple in siem reap.
WOW WOW WOW. WOW, must see temple simply awesome. Once in a lifetime experience. Put in on your bucket list you wont regret it.
Beautiful. Beautiful ancient temples and so very well maintained. A must vist sight for those who love travelling
Hot and bothered. I found it an interesting place but went on a very hot day with a lot of people so there was a lot of stopping and standing around

Smiling stones. Totally crazy, you can't believe that this smiling stones were built in the 12th century by man power. It's a unique feeling you will get during strolling through the temple, hard to describe with words.
I love Siem reap. Fantastic place in the world .everyone should come to visit this temple during your vocation in siem reap
Enjoyed this a bit more. This was the 2nd stop in our day visit. The sights were a bit better than Angkor Wat. Remember to take a "nose to nose" photo!

The Best of the Local Sights?. What a place is all I can say. The towering faces are spectacular, and the way you can just get in amongst it all is awesome. Of the three key sites around Angkor Wat this is my favourite. The only caveat is there are so many tourists there, but the place is large and you can find a private moments and vantage points from time to time.

A Must for everyone. Just wandering about, at a leisurely pace....... what a wonderful place to be. Loved how so many locals are still employed to keep the moat in perfect condition for the building. What engineering!

Go first thing the morning before the tourists and full sun. Quite incredible, huge array of different temples, amazing to see with green all around. The scale of Angkor Thom was unexpected and awe inspiring. A magical adventure to walking through various temples that make up Angkor Thom.

Archeological wonder. Archeological Disneyland, at first sight, but if you take the time to explore it by bike, at your own pace and find your own little corners, it's unique and thoroughly impressive.

So much to see. Wear comfortable shoes, cool clothes and a hat. Also don't forget an umbrella for the afternoon showers and lots of water. There is lots of walking and most wonderful sights to see, but you won't make it if you aren't hydrated and comfortable!

Never give candy to the seller kids. My friend got cheaper souvenirs than me from seller kids from the faraway temples. (nail clipper, magnet, postcard pack) She just ask for the price and walkaway pretend she don't interest in their goods, the kids quickly give a lower price than we have expected.

Lots to see....take your time. A must visit spot, allow plenty of time and be prepared for thousands of other tourists doing the same thing. We bought a 3 day pass the day before we planned to visit (it has photo ID attached and is not transferable to another person). Buying it a day early just speeds up the process the following day and can be used anytime over a 7 day period. Go early, it opens at 5.30am and closes at 5.30pm. The first wave of visitors come to watch sunrise at 5.30 so come a little after this to avoid this lot but dont leave it to late. By 10.30\11am the place is crawling with tourists from around the world.....time to head home at this point. There are lots of temples to visit, many that I preferred to Angkor Wat and all worth visiting.We hired a local Tuk Tuk driver and her took us all over Angkor Wat and Seim Reap during our stay.

A marvellous trip. Siem Reap is a tourists' haven. People from anywhere around the world can feel comfortable here without spending a lot of money. Th ancient temples a short distance away from the town is wonderful to wander around.
Amazing place. A must in the city, totally worthed!The sunrise there is the most beautiful thing I have seen and everything is cheap

Great temple but very hot work.. This is one of my favourite temples in the Angkor area. Not as crowded as the more famous Angkor Wat so easier to take it all in and better for photographers.Very hot so make sure you take your time and drink plenty of water.

Faces . Beautiful temple and surrounding. If you only have time for 1 more temple beside Angkor Wat, this is it. The whole area is very well marked for visitors so that you wouldn't miss any of the attractions in this massive area.
Stunning and breathtaking in scale. Don't just visit Angkor Wat - Angkor Thom is impressive but different in terms of scale. The moat alone is like a small lake.
Amazing Angkor Thom. amazing in the world and make me wonder of the building. big size and nice i would say that i do love the Angkor Thom.

Breathtaking!. Angkor Thom is just breathtakingly stunning. I have been four times - the first time some 28 years ago. There are now walkways to stop people from climbing the ruins but nevertheless it is a magical place. Go very, very early before the tourist busses arrive.

Great place, but hot. What a great place. But prepare for the heat if visiting during summer. It is stifling - carry an umbrella, water and light, breathable clothes. After two hours, the sauna-like heat gets you.

place & hotel. sofitel great hotel
and place very historic
had fun..
stayed only for one day.. wish could have stayed more.

NR 1 WORLD MONUMENT. Angkor Thom is beautiful, a very interesting and holy place, one of the Angkor temples near Siem Reap, Cambodia. It is very busy, best time to visit is in the low season, the rainy season (mostly only rain in the evening or night). Please visit also the other temples near Angkor Thom! Some of them are less crowded and beautiful and interesting as wel.Extra tip: plan and buy a ticket for at least 3 days to visit the Angkor Temples, 7 days is even better.

One of the three temples we would recommend in Siam Reap. As per my review of Ta Promh, we recommend three temples for families travelling with young children such as us (aged 3,6&7): Angkor Wat of course, TP and Angkor ThomWe actually did in reverse order so started w Angkor Thom, both to beat the crowd and also not to be blasé after AW. It was thus not too crowded and we were able to climb and visit at leisure. Not stroller friendly given lots of large and uneven stones. Our kids loved it. What we saw as historical vestiges they saw as a huge playground!!! Afterwards we did a tour on an elephant, again a big hit w the kids but also offered a good and different perspective on the temple. Would highly recommend!!
Great!. The highlight of Angkor Thom is the Bayon temple but generally the whole area of the city is very nice to walk and see.The entrance is very interesting part with the guards sculptures.
Must visit great Temple. Enjoyed visit , crowded to visit top level but worth wait. Enjoyed every part of visit, great hindu temple it must have been
Magical atmosphere. One of the most spectacular temples. Very tranquil place with astonishing architecture. Must see if in Siem Reap.
Must visit. Love this place... Make sure when u go there u wear the right attire as the weather can be so hot.. and yes.. do hydrate yourself..

An absolute must do - cross this off your bucket list. This has to be one of the must do's, you move have to be up at 3am to catch the transport (moped buggy) to the site, pay your entrance fee and walk to the temple pools. Beware the crowds build very early and you have to stand your ground if you don't want to lose your prime position.
Awesome. Awesome. Do not start late...if possible start as early as 6 am otherwise the hot and humid weather will get to you
Must see!!. Definitely worth a visit, as it is part of the Angkor park. The place can be crowded, but still worth going to. Lots to see.
Amazing. Fantastic experience to see all the temples within Angkor - so old but so well kept... don't miss the "Tomb Raider" temple - unbelievable!
wonderful experience. A wonderful 1/2 day tour to see the magnificent temple. Hot and humid - as always - but well worth going to the highest parts to see everything.

Must See Landmark. It was a very good experience for us. Make sure you dress comfortably for all the climbing you will be doing. It was quite beautiful just experiencing the walk under the stars with everyone else to watch the sunrise at Angkor Wat.

Love the bayon temple.. so many things to see at angkor thom. the bayon temple is great but beware of the fraud tour guide. They seems to help you with the direction in the end they will force you to donate sum of money.
Worth it. This was smaller than Angkor Wat and was much more enjoyable to explore. Definitely worth stopping by on a one day tour.
fantastic jungle temple complex. like stepping inside an Indian Jones film, or a Lara Croft video game - amazing to see this huge collection of temples, with amazing carvings, in the jungle
Must see!. One of the greatest places on earth! We came here in the morning with the rest of the tourists, and it didn't disappoint at all. Loved seeing this beautiful place.
angkor Thom. went on trip to the temples on a day trip which included this one / all very special and a little over crowded. It helps to have a good tuktuk driver

Visit in the morning. The ruins are truly in ruins - this place is falling apart, or at least looks like it. Visit in the morning - there's not much shade to hide from the sun unless you want to hide inside the corridors.

Worth the short trip. Angkor Thom was actually more interesting to me than Angkor Wat. Before entering the grounds on every side, visitors are greeted with a massive gate, foreshadowing the ruins inside. The most interesting point for me was Baphuon. Travelers could actually hike to the top of the pyramid, unlike many of the other structures.

Beautiful... Big and Alot of exploration to be done.. Bigger area to cover than Angkor Wat. Very busy area alot of the times.. Sunset is super beautiful. Try to arrange your tuk tuk driver to go Bayon Temple around 5pm so you can take fantastic photos!
Interesting temple and photo ops. Should be included in any Angkor Wat itinerary. Be sure to organize a driver, or you can take a tuk tuk from town
AMAZING & BREATHE TAKING. if you visit angkor wat, you must visit angkor thom. the temple is very big lots to explore. so must history in these ruins. i like angkor thom alot better than angkor wat.
Ruins, ruins, beautiful ruins. Beautiful ruins that are rich in history. Our guide Sam Pich with Intrepid tours was brilliant! I learned a lot about the history of this beautiful place!
Amazing site. Amazing site - a must see for any visitor to Cambodia. Allow yourself sufficient tine to just wander, explore, and take in all the details of this amazing place.

Smiling Faces Temple, 4km grounds, temples everywhere, fantastic!. Loved it here! The smiling faces temple was probably my favorite! So much to see, the grounds are something like 4km...My poor feet felt every bit of that! It was a scorching hot day too, so being in the open sun was a bit much, but there are so many different temples to see within Angkor Thom that I can't recommend this stop enough! Should definitely be on your itinerary for Siem Reap!

One of THE highlights of the Ankor complex, a must see.. Amazing temple complex and one of THE temples to see while in the Ankor complex. Incredible ruins and remains and sculptures and carvings, as well as the trees and roots taking over buildings.

whow. With all the temples around it is difficult to choose which one is better. But if you want a bit of piece and quiet compare to Angkor Wat temple Angkor Tom is good, still very busy, but less than the afore mentionned

Make sure to visit the Tomb Raider temple whilst in Siem Reap. A really interesting temple, quite different to Angkor Wat and the other temples in the area. It's the setting of the film 'Lara Croft: Tomb Raider' so if you've seen the film you'll recognise parts of it. Even if you only have the 1 day temple pass, I'd recommend this is one you see. (The temple pass was $20 for 1 day or $40 for 3 days.)

Magnificent Even in its Ruins. Angkor Thom is the most celebrated temple in the entire Angkor Wat complex . History says that it was constructed as a Hindu temple but subsequently converted to a Buddhist temple. But religion is not important here. The beautiful artwork that adorns the structure , the design of the structure itself , its surrounding , the complex internal geography . . . . All these contribute to the overall image of Angkor Thom. The moment one approaches the site and the structure looms in the horizon , one is awe-struck by its size and elegance. This feeling of awe remains till the visit is complete. It needs many difficult stairs to be climbed and many corridors , crevices , temples to be seen. If you want to learn while seeing , take a guide.

Still a must see in Asia....amazing. It was my second time here. 20years ago it was of course much better......now they are restoring and really they have to take care before its getting broken.But still worth a visit....its still a must see in Asia......so go there as soon as possible.
Another amazing Wat!. Just wow ... such history in all of these ruins! The Angkor Wat tour and all the other Wats are such a wonderful way to spend your time in Cambodia.
Atmospheric. Visit early morning when everyone else is waiting at Angor Wat to see the sunrise. Beautiful and deserted.
Unbelievable. Angkor and its many temples (wats) surpassed my wildest expectations. It would take days to visit it all.

Great temple. I initially tought that this temple is less attractive from the famous Angkor Wat, but I was wrong.I like Angkor Thom areas better. It is a huge past time city, 3x3 KM dimension. Started with Prasat Bayon temple. It is a temple with four faces: buddha, brahma, vishnu and shiva (though you can't really tell which one). Here, a lot of places to capture if you like photography. Not so many people around during morning. The second temple and third temple (Baphoun, Phimeanakas) are not as beautiful as Bayon, but they are worth to visit.

Brilliant experience. Excellent day out, but I recommend going early in the day to avoid the heat and the crowds. They offer week-long tickets, but you can easily explore the whole site in a day or less.
The Temples. The 3 main temples were incredible, & not to be missed. The age of them is amazing... built in 11th century. The stone carvings were amazing.
Gotta go. If you came all this way and don't go here then you better have a good reason, like you ate some bad street food and couldn't leave the hotel!
Amazing. This is an incredible place, I loved it more than Angkor Wat (which was in itself amazing), I think its the setting in the forest that is amazing - loved it.

Lots of temples.. I always worry about going to famous world sites: will they live up to the hype? This one exceeded the hype. Siem Reap is touristy, and so has accommodation at all levels. I had only a half day, and booked the motorcycle taxi which my hotel had sent to collect me from the boat for a private tour. I hadn't realised how many temples exist, in various stages from well maintained to nearly derelict, and overgrown. One, filled with writhing roots, was used as the set for an Indiana Jones movie. For me, about four sufficed, and I had run out of stamina by the end. The day was right up with Taj Mahal and Macchu Picchu for interest, and ahead of Borobudur and Pagan. I was there in about 2001, my second Cambodia visit. I was back in Siem Reap on my third visit, but for other reasons, and didn't go temple chasing.
Must See. This is obviously a must-see but suggest you go rearly as it becomes very crowded with tourists during the day

Awe inspiring. This complex is just amazing. We went to see the sunrise at Angkor Wat and immediately left for Angkor Thom. We got to have the complex almost to ourselves at 6:30 in the morning and found it wonderful. I would say "definetely visit" but I doubt anyone would come to Siem Reap and not visit this enormous complex of temples.

Must See in your Lifetime!. Truly an iconic attraction...with a total area bigger than the Taj Mahal. A must see for everyone. See it with aguide to fully appreciate its history.. then come back again on your own to just linger and enjoy its majesty.

Big things also come in big packages!. Amazing mind blowing in size and scale and scope.Truly a spectacular site. Needs at least two days to properly cover the area. Beware of the hawkers though they can be rather pesky and demanding. Just ignore them and go about your business.

Flowers, stones, naturalistic views of scenery. Visited this in one of the section of the grand tour offered by the hotel. Interesting to visit . The carvings and built are impressive. I think visiting these during the dry season will be good. but do prepare hats, caps, sunblock lotion if u need. Also sunglasses are highly recommended.

Crowded but fabulous. It's getting ever more popular, for good reason. The carvings and the Bayon are spectacular. The earlier you come, the better to beat the hordes. If you want real solitude, however, walk the top of the perimeter wall, the entire 12 kilometers. On one side is the moat, on the other the jungle. When I did the walk, I saw only some workers from a restoration project.
Amazing temple. All of Angkor temples are truly amazing. I had spent a day here. it was really a marvelous experience in my life. The temple architecture of olden days were really worth mentioning

Magnificent!. What can someone write about this place? As Great as Advertised. This ancient city is incredible. The gates you drive through, the temples that are inside it make it an amazing experience. It is included in the ticket you buy to get into Angkor Wat and other places ($20 USD). Enjoy!

Marvelous. The entire place of Angkor Thom is beautiful and staggering. It really captivates the mind and the sights simply warms the heart. The gate's door is probably not the largest. Inside, all the temples like the Bayon temple (Faces temple) is amazing and a sight to behold.

Amazing. This place was stunning. Get ready to do some climbing as there's plenty of stairs. Worth checking out. It's worth seeing its neat to see the temple that hasn't been restored like Angkor wat you can fit seeing both of them in on the same day and there right by each other so why not.
war museum amust to visit. war museum was very worthwhile. Was interesting to talk to the land mine victims and of their terrible experiences during the war

Splendid, Immense, Magical. Angkor Thom is an immense city that dates back to the 12th century and was the largest city in the Khmer Empire. Surrounded by a 26 foot high wall (the wall itself is surrounded by a moat), the city can be entered through five gates in the cardinal directions with an extra gate on the east side.Our group entered through the south gate. We crossed a stone bridge over the wide moat and couldn't get enough of the 154 statues that guard the gate; demons on the left and gods on the right; and the gate itself is crowned by an immense stone face gazing just above our heads into the distance. The gate opening is only wide enough for certain vehicles, mostly tuc-tucs and small passenger vans. We had to leave our motor coach behind. I really wish I had several days to explore this city, but was fortunate to be able to spend some quality time at the South Gate and at the Bayon.Don't miss this World Heritage Site. Your Angkor Architectural Park Pass will get you into Angkor Thom as well as most of the other exciting temples in this area.

At least as good as Angkor Wat. It is impossible not to be captivated by this place. It offers a wide range of different sights among which Bayon is, of course, the most notable. But beyond that Angkor Thom has so much more to offer that one would need to dedicate almost a full day to really experience the place.
You will not be disappointed in the slightest.. The temples (all of them) are an absolutely fascinating look back at what was. The stories are just wonderful.A good chance to be mesmerised.
Great day out. Worth a visit!! We had a tuk tuk take 4 of us around for the day. It cost us $40 usd for the tuk tuk so $10 each and $20 for the day ticket.
Very impressive visit. Very impressive, well worth à visti. Bit crowded with large numbers of tourists. Very hot, bring good shops and lost of cold water. Much more meaningfull with à good guide

Angkor wot Anglor thom. We travelled with indochina odyssey tours. They were excellent. Tour guide was fantastic and very knowlegeable , quite funny and made us feel very comfortable and relaxed about the whole experiece
Must see. Book a guided tour in advance, there is a lot to see (about 9 square km), especially Bayon is a must.

Add this to the list of temples to visit around Siem Reap!. Yet another amazing temple to marvel at within Siem Reap. I don't know if there is a good time or better time of day to go when there isn't as many people. I felt at times that I was forever dodging people or waiting for them to move out of my way so I could get a good photo. Then again, I suppose everyone was in the same boat as me. Still a great piece of architecture, archaeology and history to go and see!

Beautiful complex, must visit in Siem Reap!. Angkor Thom complex welcomes you in through its beautiful, massive and ornate gates the gallery lined up with massive trees following the gates.Bayon Temple is the crown jewel but there is so much more to see.

The Elephants of Angkor Thom. At The Elephant Story, we are all about elephant conservation. Therefore, we wanted to research the cultural and practical significance of elephants to the Angkor area. Although elephants were used to build all of the temples, they are particularly represented in Angkor Thom from the three elephants supporting each side of the entrance way to the compound to the elephant terrace where elephants are shown with their mahout and hunter hunting deer at the time of the 12th century. Elephants mean strength in both the Hindu and Buddhist faiths. Unfortunately, during the Khmer Rouge reign, many of the elephants were killed for ivory or maimed by land mines. The fortunate ones were able to flee to the Surin area of Thailand where they live today. Therefore, the culture goes on but not in its original home.

The Best. Don't skip it! . We loved exploring Angkor Thom.It was the highlight of our time in Siem Reap.Make sure you do not rush past this or miss it if you're only in town for one day.Your Tuktuk driver will tell you that two hours is enough, but if you're like us, we needed four. It's just breath-taking and I preferred it to Angkor Wat by far because of the diversity of architecture and the wow-ness of that architecture. Angkor Wat was more about sculptures than architecture for me.
Angkor Thom, fancinating and very large. Don't just visit the main tower and go back to your driver - there is so much more to see here if you wander out of the gates and over to the outside areas

A must to see. This is where Tomb Raiders, Angelina Jolie movie had some filming done. The huge fig trees through some of the temple area is just spectacular to see. The people are preserving it well too. It is found within the temple complex so a three day pass allows you plenty of time to view all

Words cannot describe how amazing , breath taking temples!. You simply can't possibly conceive how amazing these temples are. Take a guide to learn about the history to understand just how they built these temples. Note it can be very hot and humid. Also lots of people. Go as early as you can.
Superb Architecture. The temple is approximately more than 900 years old. The architecture of the temple is amazing and it if you are visiting Siem Reap it is a must see.

Nice to meet you. I'm simply in awe of man's worldwide cultural development - to visit ruins constructed in Mexico, Egypt, Israel, Italy, Greece, Indonesia, Cambodia - all basically built around 800AD WOW!!!

Crowded but a must!. The restoration going on is amazing. You can see some of the before and after pictures there. Incredible! This is not to be missed! It's so cool to see the nature around Angkor Thom. Such a great, unique place!!!
Love Bayon Temple. The bayon temple is very beautiful and we spend 2 time to visit this temple, The caring very good. best temple
Incredible. Visiting this temple you can agine how it could be on the past. I think that you could find the elephants amousing and climb to the top aswell.

Bayon and Baphuon Highlights of Thom. Don't make the mistake of thinking that Angkor Thom is a temple; it's not. It's a compound containing many temples created by and for Jayavarman VII. As with all of my Wat-recommendations, get there early (if possible by 5:00 a.m. when it opens) to view in peace without the crowds. As has been mentioned in other reviews, the artistry of the Bayon--though more in ruins --surpasses that of Angkor Wat. The Bayon is more self-contained and less spread out, too. The top of the Baphuon allows you to see the lay of the land, so ascend, dear friends!

Amazing. Probably the most amazing place Ihave ever visited. We had a tour guide, well worth the minimal cost, and he explained the significance of every part of this amazing place. We hung off his every word as he explained the history behind the ruins. We will definitely re visit the area when next in Cambodia. Make sure you arrive for the sunrise over Angkor Watt
Historically a must see. Must see, historical and truly unique experience. There are many temples in Cambodia and this is one of the more famous.
mesmerizing feeling. its a place one wants to feel the time and nature together. one need to feel its pulse if just give little time to feel it.

Be Indiana Jones...go here.. Such a cool place to visit. Seriously a must see temple. I love the ruins aren't fully restored so it really gives you a feel for how it used to look while maintaining the integrity of the exploration.

Lots of history and temples. It holds a lot of temples including the Bayon and Tomb raider temple. You should have good stamina and patience to explore the whole city. The entrance to the city seems marvelous and each there are 4-5 such gates. We hired a guide for a day and he gave a good description of each and every temple.Do hire a guide if you really want to understand the significance of the temples.
A Must See!!. A must do! It was fantastic. All of the temples are worth seeing, but this is a top 3 for me. Don't miss out on this one.

Its not all about Ankor Wat!. After visiting Angkor Wat we proceeded to Angkor Thom ( Bayon temple). It is totally different to Angkor Wat in so much as it it not on a huge scale and on one level that bought you closer to the amazing rock faces surrounding the temple. There are 4 large carved towers each one facing outwards keeping watch on each compass point. Their are 51 small towers surrounding this sight, each with 4 faces of its own. The heads range in size from 3 to 4.5metres. You can get up close and personal to these while walking through this amazing sight.It was built around around 1190 AD as a Buddhist temple but has some elements of Hinduism. Surrounded by lush tropical forest. It is not far from Siem Reap and less crowded and more peaceful.Remember to bring your water,sunscreen and insect repellant.It would be a shame if you missed it. Keep an eye out for a group of local men playing in a little band, they are landmine survivors as is easily seen and they are so very grateful for your donations.(if you find this review helpful please tick the appropriate box tks )

Glimpse of an old civilization. As you enter Angkor Thom nothing you will remember accept what you see in front green vegetation and grey ruins.Awesome temples and their wonderful artwork keep one absorbed .Angor Thom is really Great as it name implies Great City .If one one decides to visit Angkor wat or Angkor Thom my suggestion is to have some study . Then one can enjoy to the heart content . After returning I understand I missed few points listening only to guides .Bayon ,Baphuon ,elephant Terrace ,Terrace of Leaper king and Big Pond are sure the big catch of the day . Holiday. The history is very interesting, to be so old and to note how it was constructed in very early years was amazing. The atrwork on the Temple so is so succint and to know how the stone work was lifted into place is a majpr feat.

amazing!. absolutely amazing.
if i have to tell you why to visit, then you're ridiculous.

Great place to visit. Great place to visit and really as wonderful as Angkor Wat. Definitely recommend to anyone who visits Siem Reap. Our driver was great with cold compresses and cold water when we returned, which our hotel set up for us (Borei Angkor Spa and Hotel)

favorite. this is one of the best attraction among the angkor tour! and a personal favorite! great for photo souvenir and a must see!

Phenomenal!. Such an phenomenal place! I was so impressed with the beauty of this majestic space! I can't wait to go back and see it again some day!

Amazing. This was my favorite temple in the whole park. It was breath taking to just to spot it from the distance and walk up to this temple. There were so many things to explore on the grounds,

The BEST temple in the Angkor area. By far my favorite temple of all the Angkor temples. There's an ethereal sense around this temple, with hundreds and hundreds of faces looking upon you as you walk around the partially restored ruins. It's incredible - don't miss it!

More than what you can expect in your wishes. Frankly, once you have seen Angkor Vat, the expectations are high. And I have not been disappointed. Larger, less restored, and I would say, more genuine. I love it
Wow, wow, wow!!!!. I have been home 2 weeks now and can't get this place out of my head. I'm planning on going back. One of the greatest places I've ever visited!

Mind-blowing and probably worth more of your time than the better known Angkor Wat (which was still incredible) partially as the latter is simply overrun with selfie-shooting tour bus groups. Amazing. A visit to Angkor Wat is a must, it is absolutely amazing. There are various different temples so you can get a 1/3/7 days ticket, depending on how many days you want to visit the temples. We just got a 1 day ticket and saw the main temples. The cab/rickshaw drivers are usually your guides and will take you to the main temples.You can see the difference in the temples as well in terms of the architecture, and we visited the temple where Tomb Raider was filmed.We stayed in Siem reap so that we could visit Angkor Wat. Lovely historical giant.. For those who love historical culture. But we need to conserve these ruins properly and hope the authorities step up with rules against these "ugly" tourists!

An amazing highlight of Angkor. Incredible! While perhaps not quite as famous as Angkor Wat, the Angkor Thom temple complex including Bayon is incredible and a real highlight! Definately a must see and worth dedicating some time!

Never miss the opportunity to visit. Definitely a must do when you visit Siem Reap. "Angkor" means city and "Thom" means Big so literally, Angkor Thom is a Big City. The tour is like walking in the past offering you a glimpse of the earlier civilization. Truly an educational experience as I am a sucker of historical places, this is an excellent choice for me.

Absolutely a must see.. Let me start with my background is in fine arts, so I studied Angkor Thom and Angkor Wat while in college. The reason I took this trip was to visit this two temples. For a person who is an Archeologist, Artist, or Architect this is mind numbing experience, an overwhelm of the senses to experience the beauty of this place, its history, and the craftmanship necessary for its construction. Visiting this temple is an experience you will cherish for the rest of your life, a must see , and in my opinion one the wonders of the world
A must-see. This ancient city, with temples, palaces, and walled areas, is definitely a must-see. It's quite extensive and so hiring a guide can help make sense of it all!

Magical place of outstanding interest a must visit. Angkor Thom is as close to being Indiana Jones that you can realistically get, many parts are still in deep ruin, some areas are possibly a bit iffy and if it was in the UK you would not get anywhere near!Strong sensible shoes and a good hat are a must and do like we did and get a guide to show you round, it is well worth the extra few pounds to get a professional to explain the history of any of the ancient sites in Siem Reap.Early morning or late afternoon is good for taking pictures and usually a bit quieter with less tourists. I found Angkor Thom a bit more interesting than Angkor Watt mainly because of the fact it is still in parts in unspoilt condition, yes you will always reflect on Angelina Jolie raiding tombs as you have your picture taken next to some of the film locations but they are few and far between.If you are lucky you may get to see the Royal Ballet dancers in full traditional costume, just magic!
Angkor Thom. This covers a large area with many remains of buildings, so you have to walk a bit. It was fun wandering around the ruins of this ancient civilisation. I liked the elephant terrace best.

Bettter than Angkor wat. Big and have included in the price of Angkor wat visite, day pass 20 $ us per per pet day. No need to change money, in siem reap, they use US money in touriste area.Have to have long pants and over the shouder shirts, they don't do renting.

Not just another temple.. I loved Angkor Thom - just when you start the day thinking that you are 'templed out' the next one has something different to amaze and surprise you - that sums up Angkor Thom.
Very interesting. Great place to visit , very interesting but very busy , choose time .early in day better as gets very hot also take umbrella for shade
my favourite. in my opinion, the best temple in the whole city! watch out for the monkeys! easy to walk to the terrace of the elephants behind it
Historical. Very good site for photography and its really gives the current engineers a run for their money.....

Great temple. Be prepared to walk or to bike at 36°C. This is the largest and one of the most beautiful temples in the Angkor area. My advice is to enter through the South gate, it's the most beautiful as there's a huge bridge and gate that crosses the green river, where traditional boats are sailing. Don't only visit the main temple, but there are other small ones rounding it.

Guided tour with local guide was excellent. It was very much worth the money to get a local tour guide for 35 dollar, who takes you on a 6 hour guided tour through the ruins of Angkor Wat and Angkort Thom.

Highlighted visit of Angkor.. Many people put Angkor Wat on the top list, for us Bayon is the best !
The influence of Hidduism and its architect is so prominent in this temple.
When you look at the stone faces, you will feel the signature of time. The big carving on the north door is very impressive too.

Just Incredible. The Angkor Thom complex is one of the must-see attractions. From the entry over the awesome bridge and through the historic gate. The main complex is just brilliant - you're allowed to climb around almost all of it - it's just stunning.

Angkor Thom, the "Big City" has so much. Angkor Thom, literally Big City was the central metropolis of the Angkor region.
