While Angkor Wat gets the spotlight (and the crowds) Angkor Thom has so much more. Just the entry gates are spectacular, with their huge Buddha heads gazing serenely off to the distant horizon, and there are 4 of those, the popular South and North gates, but also the much quieter East and West Elephant gates which are really worth a visit for some quiet jungle contemplation. Then of course there is the Bayon Temple, which is situated right in the centre of Angkor Thom. I believe there were originally 216 (Exact numbers are not my thing) huge stone faces of Buddha in the upper gallery of the Bayon, not all remain but they are a truly spectacular sight to see, especially just after sunrise or sunset when the side lighting really brings out the serenely smiling features.There is so much more to see at Angkor Thom, the Baphuon temple with the spectacular views and huge reclining buddha, the Elephant terrace with the huge bas relief carvings, and the terrace of the leper King with the hidden carvings that were buried for hundreds of years when the building was modified and a second wall built in front, effectively preserving the carvings from decay and pillage (from tomb raiders). There are also many smaller hidden temples in Angkor Thom where you can get away from the crowds that descend on the place after 9am (nearly 4 million visitors a year!) and enjoy some peace and contemplate the ancient culture that built these intricate and vast works of art.Angkor Thom is worth a few days of exploring, and its worth getting up early, really early, (4.30am) to beat the crowds. You won't regret it.

Shouldn't Miss this World Wonder. An experience no traveler should miss. Easy obtained comfortable and inexpensive transport available at all hotels. Many unique presents for the ones you left at home and they are cheap. Buy at the area around the temple and barter! Locals enjoy that and you will save 25-40% compared to town prices
BEAUTIFUL temple.. Not sure what I was expecting from Siem Reap, but the temples surpassed every possibility. LOVED Angkor Thom - do NOT miss seeing all of the various temples!

Buddhism and Hinduism at the same time. It's really interesting to see the influence of buddhism and hinduism in the temples. Different king would have different policy on the religion for the kingdom. However, the temple could provide good examples that the two religions co-existed rather peacefully at certain time in the kingdom.The temple is smaller than angkhor vat, but also interesting. Take also a walk around the temples... and buy the drink from the local vendors to help the local economy.
The Ancient Capital. Take a complete tour of Angkor Thom. Majestic and beautiful. Bayon is the center-piece of this complex. The carvings are simply superb.

Essential but can blur in with all the other temple sites. If I had only went to Angkor Thom I would have probably written a more raving review but as this was part of very long and drawn out cycling tour of the temples around Siem Reap (and because our guide was astoundingly boring) it didn’t really stand out as much as it should.The architecture, sculptures and the way nature has taken back so much of it was incredible to see but when you are getting dragged around the temples with a guide who likes 2 things only, the sound of his own voice and perving over young female tourists it can become a bit dry.My wife summed it up when she said “you can only look at piles of rock so may times before they start to blur together”The temples and sites in and around Angkor are essential viewing but do it in a tuk tuk and do it all in one day and you will see everything you want/need to see without burning yourself out, as we did.

Beautiful. Coming from one who loves history and the history of foreign cultures, this was an amazing site. The site is very well preserved and a great place to tour. As with all of the sites around Siem Reap, you must deal with the very persistent vendors outside of the temple, but some are polite and sell nice things. We got there relatively early, and the crowds were light and very manageable.
Amazing. It seems incredible that this place was only 'discovered' again not so long ago. Great trip and visit, not so hot as climbing up Ankhor Wat. Quite busy though.

Beautiful, big Buddha heads!. This temple has a lot of big Buddha heads strategically placed, that if you stand in a certain direction, you can pucker your lips and give the Buddha a kiss! It was really cool when our guide showed us this and some other unique places to take interesting photos such as in the windows that became frames for the pictures. Some walking up and down stairs is required so wear comfortable shoes here.
Great Visit. This place is well worth the visit but make sure you have plenty of time as it can take a while to get around if it is the busy season.It is worth using a local tour guide as well.
Ancient Wonder. Another must see temple in Siem Reap. Just like Angkor Wat and Bayon Temple, Angkor Thom is breathtaking. You get to see just how nature can envelope man made civilizations.
Historical walk. Wonderful temple ruins. Views, architecture, history. Be prepared to walk a lot. Young ones and senior adults may find it difficult.
Great illustrative relief details. Bayon temple is the main temple within Angkor Thom and is interesting because of its four faced buddhas and impressively illustrative reliefs.
Very interesting!!. The general atmosphere of this place is magic. Not to miss!! It is not so crowded as other places and very peaceful

Best guided tour. Yes we could have done the Angkor Wat visit by ourselves, however, having and experienced tour guide like Sovan Say made the experience so much more rewarding in terms of discovering the history of the place rather than just viewing the temple.
Brilliant. Just as you'd expect.. The scale of this monument is astounding. Has been looted and reclaimed from the jungle but still so much to see. Take walking shoes.t

Amazing!. Nothing short of awe-inspiring... be sure to take a small towel to wipe away your sweat, as it's very hot and humid out. Good walking shoes. A few dollars in your pocket to buy water and maybe some magnets from the young children all around. Lots of photos

Historical wow. In Cambodia there tends to be 3 groups of temples. One built 1st century, second 9th century and third 11-13th century. This temple is in the third group and it is massive. You walk through in awe of the workmanship and how this temple was ever created in that time. I think learning about the temples gives you a connection to the people and that's important. This temple is in the top 3 and therefore very busy.
This is the Indiana johns temple. My favorite, with nature taking a protagonist role among the ruins, crowded, but still very impressive do not miss this visit
Good place to visit. The temples will not disappoint, shows history, and some sense of serenity. The location and the vantage point are wonderful!
Very crowded. It was so hot walking all round. We had a fabulous tour leader who took us short cuts and looked after U.S. So we didn't fall, helped down and up the big stopped.
Large and wonderful. Angkor Thom like Angkor Thom is a very large complex and offers a lot to see.Its kind of the poster child for Siem Reap, like Angkor Wat. Lots to see and lots to climb one.

STUNNING!. My absolute favorite place in Siem Reap. Beautiful and serene! Make sure to bring a face towel or a hanky and a fan or umbrella. The weather is scorching hot but the view and ambiance is worth it.

Grand City, Indeed. Angkor Thom houses one of the most popular temples around Siem Reap: Bayon. This temple is famous for its many faces (216), all in sets of four, which are a mixture of Buddhism and Hinduism. Though the temple was built as the last state temple in Angkor as a Mahayana Buddhist shrine, some scholars believe that the shrine may be paying more homage to the founding/creating King Jayavarman VII than Buddha himself, as there seems to be a keen resemblance between the 216 faces and the god-like king with the name meaning victorious warrior. Angkor Thom, much like the King's ousting of the Chams, stands as a reminder of the monumental size and power of the Khmer Empire, the largest pre-industrial urban center in the world from the 11th-13th century.If you'd like to do more than just ooh and ah over this fantastic walled city, be sure to get a guide. I can recommend no one more highly than Narin, who also lives up to his website's name: www.angkorbesttourguide.comContact him at: narinviptours@gmail.com
Amazing temple. dont miss this place while you are in Siem Reap because it is the former residence of King during 13 century.Many temples in Angkor Thom.

Majestic Excellence. This place is majestic. Definitely worth a visit. Steps can be quite step. Beautiful place. Sunscreen and good shoes are a must when visitng the temples as the uneven cobbled stone floors are a killer on the knees.
Must see massive complex. Includes Bayon Temple with very detailed faces carved in stone. I also saw a ton of monkeys in this area...and I love monkeys!
Impressive Stucture. I did not enter the compound as I was temple tired from wandering up down and around other places. it looked amazing and I will check it out the next time I visit the area.
wow!. massive , go early before the bus trips and the heat , take water and ladies cover those shoulders .

Thom (Huge). In contrast to Angkor Wat, Angkor Thom is larger and more exotic. Expect to have a lot of walking to do as it is huge and plenty to see. More than half day is required to fully appreciate every monuments in the area.

tomb raider. this is were the movie tomb raider was madewith anjalna jolie
amazing place just like in the movie truly a place you must visit cambodia is truly a wonderfull destination for the whole family
Quite nice. Unlike the main temple , Angkor Thom is not as big as Angkor Wat , so it can be a lil bit crowded. Bring a lot of drinks as it can be really hot and humid !

Amazing Angkor. We saw so many temple wats and so many sights that only by writing down each one in my journal was I able to then recall for posterity the various wonderful p!aces we visited all over Cambodia. This way is one if the most well known and famous, it is similar in structure to several others which are made if the same stonework, some are redbrick like but the stone adds to the mystery of the ways as it has aged with all the lichens and the incredible flora and fauna creeping over the ruins. The trees which have encased themselves onto the structures are like living fossils themselves, it is really s unique place which is unforgettable.

worth a visit -1 of 3 places to visit if you have to choose.. If you have limited time or like us have kids on tow and have to choose from the manytemples; then this, Ta Prohm and Abngkhor Wat are the main 3.This is a temple with a main entrance only for the King to access. Not to big and one can complete the walk in 30 minutes. The architecture is as all the temples quite stunning.Be prepared for the heat in July. Plenty of warm with losse fitting clothes and comfortable shoes. Women need to cover knees and men can wear shorts but decent onesI suggest.
Worth visiting. It's a place one must visit at least once in a lifetime. Great to just wander around and take your time. The weather is most comfortable from November to January.
A delightful complex. This complex has a lot of neat temple/attractions. Bayon was my favorite, second only to Angkor Wat.

Biking!. This is one of the best areas to bike. We brought our bike from the hotel (Maison Polanka) one of those bikes with a basket in front. You can stop to feed the monkeys too :) And most of all the temples in this area are my favorite! Great forest energy
Nice Ancient Site. A place not to missed if you are in Siem Reap Ang kor Wat Area nearby surrounding you can even rent a bicycle to go around this wonderful area.
Great stone face carvings. Unlike Angkor Wat, Angkor Thom has massive face carvings. The stone carvings also tell about everyday life rather than victorious wars or mythical legends.

Fantastic Temple. Smaller, and later, than Angkor Wat this temple is more understandable. It has a lot of steps - and might be more crowded than Angkor Wat as it is smaller. It is also suffering from its age and a lack of investment; viewers will need the entrance ticket obtained at Angkor Wat.
Remarkable place. This is totally a must to go place, the complex is huge, the sculptures are unique and well done. Surrounding area is also clean and well maintained.

Here's a tip.... We have found that some of the 'guards' around the temples are quite excellent tour guides and photo op gurus. They are meek about it at first, but if you find one showing an interest in you and offering a photo op or giving some good info feel free to encourage them and pay them a dollar or so for their efforts. This allowed us to see some wonderful hidden wonders in the temple as well as get our favorite shots. In particular, one guard posed us 'just so' and took fantastic shots of the boddhisatva faces cradled in our hands like a loved one. So fun, and I would have never thought of it. She got a kick out of it as well and it made for a nice encounter all around.
A wonder of the world!. A must for all world travelers! I have visited Angkor Thom twice and love it! I recommend the three day pass to see all of the temples in the Siem Reap area.

Where the jungle eats the templw. The roots of trees covering the temples. You need to be prepared to an incredible hot and humidity. Start the tour from the west entrance. It was a great suggestion of our tuck tuck driver Mr Chambrong that was very good to provide us tricks to best see the temples.
Beautiful Site. Angkor Thom is a beautiful site that must be seen. You are going to fight off crowds here and there, but it is a picturesque site and worth the visit nonetheless.

wow but get a guide. This is a seven wonder in my experience and has so much history. But there are no plaques or explanations once inside and you will basically see a huge palace. So a guide is must in order to explain the whole place correctly. They have guides right out the door which charged me 20 USD for about 1.5 hours but money well spent.

loved it. This place deserves as much if not more time than Angkor wat......truly you must walk over, under and through it ALL ...we were told about the .queen. that was hidden in amongst the ruins and then we had to do the Indiana Jones thing to find it...ASK people that are there were it is...we had bats fly overhead and it was great

Blessed to be able to see this again.. Everything's a little more worn than it was the last time I visited three years ago, but it is still stunning. There's something magical and mystical about the faces carved into the giant stones. This temple is the number one reason I returned to Cambodia. Beautiful! Wonderful!

Must See. Amazing place, an eye opener.The history and the stone carvings are incredible. The temple is full of ancient story and amazing landscape. Would highly recommend friends and family to visit that place at least once in their lifetime.
impressive tour through the temple ruins. take a 3 day temple ticket and take a privat tuk-tuk driver for 15$ a day and let you drive around all temples

Definitely the best temple!. This temple is really great, the trees growing through the temples are really amazing almost mystical. The size of the trees here are massive. It's a small temple compare to the main and there are photo spot, but you have to queue. It is not a problem since it will be worth the wait. Bring enough water, because you are gonna sweat a lot, or maybe it's just me. haha

Amazing!. The temples are magnificent! Well worth the visit. Get at least a three day pass to go round the temples. Sunset was a lovely way toend a busy day of temple visits. Tour guides can be good or read about the temples and brush up on your history.

Go for a short trip. Go there for a short trip. It is not far off from the Angkor Wat. Stone carving of the old time is worth seeing. Few tourists go there. Visit in the morning time to avoid heat during the day time.

Out of this world... A place that you should not missed in Siem Reap.The place that you will never forget because structures are stunningly beautiful.i cant imagine what really happened on the Khmer Civilization during the ancient time.. but what i can say the structures are too amazing we have a lot of time ill go back for a second visit,, LOLthe $20 USD entrance fee is all worth it. visiting those temples including this one,,
Jungle temple. Beautiful Temple in the Jungle. Must see. Best to explore on a bicycle and this temple alone will definetly take you one hour or more.
Another Amazing Temple. Angkor is one of the greatest temple in Cambodia, It was built by king Javaraman II and was finished at the end of 13th century.

Incredible temples and so much history. An archeological site of extraordinary beauty and history.Definitely stimulates one's imagination with its mysterious aura: it was in fact the biggest pre-industrial revolution settlement in the world!My personal favourite was the Bayon Temple, with its huge carved faces.

Silent ruins that speak volumes. Takes you back into the 10th century! Detailed inscriptions that reveal the lives during eras gone by and the stairways to heaven that are tough to climb but really nice once you get there!
Incredible...!!!. The temples of Angkor Wat, are impossible to explain... they are so different and so differently amazing... just incredible!!!

Magic. discover the kmer civilisation through the magic architecture and be among thounsand of ppl who everyday share the same joy and get fascinated ; beleiv me you will have a good day and you will never forget it all your life; siem reap is more interesting than phnom penh or sihanokville .

A trip to FantasyLand. An ancient walled city replete with grand temples and magnificent structures boasting of the golden age of a mighty empire. The lord of the empire, Jayavarman VII casts his immortal gaze through all the stone faces carved across the city and on the majestic temple of Bayon, making you feel as being under his surveillance all the time. The high-light of course is the Bayon temple and the faces on the upper levels. The feeling is overwhelming from the upper levels of the grandiose temple. Next to Bayon stands another master piece - BaPhoun. Don't miss out to spot the sleeping Buddha embedded in the structure of the temple. Walking arounf the complex and the various structures can be exhausting especially during hotter times. So, do carry lots of water and some snacks as you walk around.

Go see - worth the short trip from Angkor Wat. This is worth a trip - not far from Angkor Wat. There's a lot fewer tourists and the natural setting is beautiful. It's out in the middle of nowhere and will seem much more natural than Angkor Wat.

Not to be missed. It doesn't matter how many pictures you have seem of this the area of Ankor Thom is just breathtaking. Take your time to wander round and make sure you have plenty water Also remember to take something to cover up so you can get into all parts
Amazing adventure.. This place was beyond my expectations and I could easily go back and explore more temples. Cambodians are wonderful people.

One of the most important archaeological sites in South-East Asia. Angkor Thom was the capital of the Khmer Empire. Must visit: Temple of Angkor Wat, the Bayon Temple and Ta Prohm (used as a location in the film Tomb Raider).

Best temple in Siem Reap. My family and I visited Ta Prohm last week after seeing Angkor Wat and Bayon. For my mind Ta Prohm is the pick of the three. I had a guide that took my behind the scenes and gave a very in depth tour particularly concerning the filming of Crusaders of the Lost Ark. It truly is iconic.

Heads. Angkor Thom and Bayon in particular were very interesting. Get a guide to explain the inscriptions on the walls as it is interesting. Some of the inscriptions were in excellent condition as they were recently cleaned. The highlight was the elephant ride from the gate to Bayon. $20USD per adult. Cambodia is children friendly so use that to your advantage if you have little ones.

Most unusual setting. Angkor Thom is a less visited sister of Angkor Wat. It is a most unusual setting in that it is more ancient (original capital for the region) and the stonework in many places has be encapsulated by trees. This was a site for a recent Angelina Jolie movie and is very intriguing. The stone work portrays Buddha in many poses but mostly upright. There is an elephant wall that is fantastic to see as well as stone carvings of life as it existed at the time. This site is a must see.

Different experience to other temples in the area.. This temple is significant more because it has been reclaimed by nature. Other temples have been well tended and preserved so everything is relatively neat and tidy. This temple is, in some ways more decapitated, with trees growing over a lot of the stone work, which makes for a very pretty view. Highly recommend a viewing.

Well worth the visit and one of the best in Cambodia. To me this temple was one of the most interesting in Cambodia. One does not want to take away from mystery and wonder of these most famous of ruins ruins but they tend to be similar and after a while they tend to look very similar. Don't bank on spending too much time wondering around the ruins in the middle of the day as this place can get VERY hot and uncomfortable. Take lot of Fluids and an Umbrella for shade!!

Must visit this special temple. Unique and the one and only.. Must has been said about this temple. One piece of advice is if possible go during off peak season for easy photography. Peak season is from Nov to february. The temple will be packed with tourists and you will have to queue up to take photos. Sometimes the queue will be from 30 to 60 minutes. Nevetheless, this is a must see in Cambodia. where else can you see another one like this? Get a tourist guide to explain as it will be meaningful.

Loved all the temples in this area. We had a fantastic guide called Thom who was a walking, talking encyclopedia on the local area. We had a wonderful time and Thom was so patient and kind and giving of his knowledge. Looking forward to visiting again
jb@angkorthom. One of the most fascinating places I've ever visited. Truly one of the wonders of the world. A must see!

Trees and Archaeology. This place, despite the renovations that were going on at the time, is stunning. Thre trees growing through the old buildings is almost ethereal. It is amazing how the buildings manage to stay in one piece- hence maybe the renovations. It does pay to be early in the morning as the tour groups arrive at around 10 and the place is crawling. It is a shame to have your photos full of unknowns. Well worth spending time wandering about and being very observant.
The might of the nature. The temple here is worth visit more foe the growth of the might of the trees . The beauty of the temple and the power of the nature merge here . Awesome . Do not miss .
Smiling faces. Its really amazing how these structures could have been constructed before the advent of heavy machinery. Worth perspiring for in the oppressive June heat!
Brilliant hotel - Shinta Mani. Stay here when you come to Siem Reap. I don't often write reviews but Shinto Mani has blown me away.
Tempel Run. Another superb edifice, smaller than its more famous neighbour, and still stunning. Well worth the visit.
Amazing. Don't miss this temple! You will love Angkor Wat but this temple is nearby as good as the famous one. Don't run and enjoy all the beauty of the complex.

Stunning. it's truly amazing. all the temples and what is left are kinda hard to imagine how they could create them. all the bricks and big chunk of stones up high without a machine and the admirable, impressive and inspiring things were created. you have to see it yourself for once in a lifetime.

Angkor Thom; Fabulous. We have come to tour the temples for 2 years now, Angkor Thom is our favorite. Although under restoration, this temple offers lots of insight into the Cambodian history and culture. This is the temple with all the happy faces cut into the stone blocks. You'll spend a few hours climbing through the walkways exploring. One of our favorite points is the enormous walls engraved with stories. If you have a true interest, you'll spend quite some time reviewing every foot of these walls. They are quite interesting and well preserved. There's lots of history here.
nice temple. Beautiful 52 face of god. Monkey around there and many other temple combine nearby there too, so easy to walk around to see all together .

Amazing!. Angkor Thom is part of the Angkor Wat complex. It is a short trip down the road (there are lots of tuk-tuks about but it's walkable). To get there you cross a fantastic bridge which is lined with traditional naga statues which is seen in Angkor Wat. I would recommend stopping for a photo as it's very ornate and pretty. Angkor Thom is very tall and a lot more of a real feel to it as it's not as busy as Angkor Wat and feels more like it's just been discovered and that it's more 'wild', there were even a few monkeys going about! There are many levels which you can climb up, I wouldn't recommend the ascent if you aren't very mobile or struggle with stairs as there are quite a few and you need to watch where you put your feet in a few places. There is a distinctive difference between here and Angkor Wat which is very noticable. Angkor Wat is primarily a buddhist complex whereas Angkor Thom has a strong influence of Hinduism and there are lots of 4D faces. Lots of good photo opportunities at the top for those who want to get creative with camera angles aswell! Excellent place.
very nice temple. very nice temple at siem reap cambodia, just past angkor wat temple like 2km and have alot of story about cambodia.
Amazing experience. To be there and in all the area makes you feel like you have been transported to a different time and world. You need to study a bit to understand or better get a good tour guide

Worth the visit. A must see if you are visiting Siem Rep. I met a local academic who had just completed his Masters in Archeology and was a volunteer guide for university students from around the world. He was very happy to give me fantastic information regarding the countries working together to restore and maintain the temple. Very much worth it.
best place. very good place nice country , friendly people, i had took a good photo for my trip, i can see the very nice temple
Amazing. One of my favorite temples in Angkor. This whole region is a definite must see. Make sure to hire a guide who can tell you all about the history and designs of each temple.

Our Favorite Temple Area in Angkor. My husband and I love Angkor Thom because you can walk through winding passageways, climb staircases to no where. It really is a special experience when you feel like you are inside the ancient temple.

Check this place off your bucket list. Incomprehensible, truly a wonder of the world. Cannot believe that this is not better known, at least in the west. Be prepared for walking on uneven surfaces, and it can be challenging in the rainy season. Beautiful, memorable, inspiring.
Our temple complex visit. The atmosphere and simply just being there was remarkable. So fantastic. And the minor (compared to the temples themselves) bonus of seeing where Tomb Raider was filmed!
A must see. This is one of three temples close to Angkor and is well worth the look. This temple is know for the faces on the temples. You will get some great photos there.

Unreal. Angkor Thom is more detailed and cooler than Angkor Wat. The detail in the carvings are amazing, the Buddha heads are super sized and best of all you can ride elephants around the site or down to the South Gate. I strongly recommend going here and riding an elephant, it'll be a highlight of your time in Siem Reap.

Great Experience. I have always been attracted towards temple. Ankor Thom and Ankor Wat provided thus provided the thrill. Specifically in Ankor Thom, Bayon, Elephant terrace and Leopard terrace require mention. Recommend spend at least 5 hours to explore Ankor Thom. Move to Ankor wat post this visit so that one can see sunset at Ankor wat
Tomb Raider. Another beautiful place to visit, besides Angkor Wat. Especially the trees with roots growing above ground (also known from Tomb Raider). It's all very historic and huge.

Mesmerising Angkor. The monument is about 5 km from Siem Reap city and simply breath taking and compels you to think how it was made when mechanical means were not available. Don't forget to take your camera with you

Magical. The pain of going through the Cambodian border is all worth it! We visited Angkor Thom after Angkor Wat. We didnt mind the heat. Entrance fee of $20 for a day pass is worth it. Suggestion though,make sure to bring lots of water, hat or umbrella and it is best to wear a sneakers. Prepare yourselves for a looooong walk.
Amazing !. The temples was built like centuries ago. What else can I say ? AMAZING ! Blown away by the complex architectural.

What else can be said!. This is one of the most spectacular sights you will ever see. No trip to this area of asia could be considered complete without a visit. I would highly recommend hiring a TukTuk driver for the day to take you between them and keep you orientated to which is which!

Temple of a thousand face. There are many structures/temple in the large Angkor Thom ground. Be prepared for a bit of walking and need to spend at least 2-3 hours here. Here you can see a temple where there is a face in every tower. You can find elephant terrace - one of two temple in Siem Reap that has explicit elephant sculptures. There is a passageway behind the elephant terrace (Leper King Terrance) that has the most beautiful and most extensive wall carvings. A temple that must not be missed. If you have no time, you still must visit this temple after Angkor Wat.

Magnificent!. This is the Must that you need to visit. It is fantastic to see the historical place in Cambodia. The most of the spot that we like is Bayon temple. This is stunning and we think it was the completely perfect which is worth a visit. Please go and enjoy beautiful Bayon.

Magnificent. Well worth a visit. The trip starts with amazing bridges guarded by demons and goods with a giant Nagas in their hands the Singas behind the nagas proclaim peace. Inside Angkor Thom you must visit Bayon and the Royal Palace.Must visit site in Ankor / Siem Reap
Spectacular Sight. 8 th wonder of the world. Really unique environmernt and enless amounts of tembles really close to each other

Something mismerising and out of the World. This temple is second to Angkor Vat and definitely worth a visit though some areas are under restoration. The figureins of Buddha on the temples are a wonderful sight to watch and behold. Every sq foot of this temple right from the entrance, walls and the roofs and the carvings are worth every minute spent.

Beautiful. This complex was a series of temples, with the many heads of Bayon, the terrace of elephants and the royal palace. There are many opportunities to take excellent photos, but be prepared to walk and don't forget the water!

amazing place. Part of the showpiece of the temples, it is all beautiful and special. you will visit this place on your way out of Angkor Wat, find a guide so they can explain the significance to you.

Bigger than Angkor Watt , not to be missed . This temple site is adjacent to Angkor Watt and is the core of the " mini tour " it comprises a number of temples and other sites Palaces , Elephant Terrace , Leper King Terrace etc and importantly Bayon Temple Went there on a tuck tuck all very easy from Seim Reip , entry covered by the 3 day Angkor Watt ticket, it is also an easy place to cycle around ( it also has monkeys , elephant rides and a zip ride )The thing to do is to walk from Bayon to the Leper King Terrace , making sure you see all of the sites , not many people doing this 2 km walk , certainly very few tour groups !
Simply outstanding. The temple complex at Angkor Thom is simply amazing. The construction techniques used to build these massive works are incredible.

Excellent. A must see, and not because to Angelina Jolie and the Tomb Raider film. Sprawling complex. Lots to see. Be careful walking and climbing. Lots of uneven surfaces and steps. Requires and admission fee. Entry pass is for multiple days and for all of the Angkor Wat complex
Magnificent. The gate are really.impressive it is as we brought back to the time when.it.was still in its golden period....

DONT MISS this ancient capital city. saying that,,, Angkor Thom is hard to actually miss!It was the capital of the Khmer empire back in its hey day, it was built in the 12th c and covers approx 9km sq and houses one of my favourite temples, Bayon watI would suggest to see the Terrace of the Elephants and to check out the faces on the entrance gatesIts well worth spending a few hours exploring Angkor Thom

Magnificently huge temple, please climb until the top!. The late 12th century temple built by Jayavarman VII. I take this as my first temple of the day to avoid crowd at Angkor wat. It is like a maze walking inside the temple and please stay close with your friends because they will disappear from your sight easily. Phone reception is poor here so don't depends too much on phone call

Fascinating history & carvings!. This ancient capital of the Khmer empire is truly amazing to see. The south gate of the complex has two long rows of statues depicting "churning the ocean of milk". Then there are 54 towers with smiling faces of the manifestations of Buddha (according to Mahayana Buddhist concept, I believe). The complex is vast and includes many different temples, some of Hindu style, several terraces some of which are called "Terrace of the Leper king", "Terrace of the elephants". There are legends behind all these structures and it would be helpful to have a guide who knows this stuff inside out and rattles out every detail. I personally do not remember all what he said, but at the time a story behind the carvings really helped me. There was a wall with depictions of events of daily life of the people, which I found quite interesting. It was also note worthy that some statues (even one of the manifestations of demon) were decorated with a bright yellow/orange robe as a form of veneration. There are many stairs to climb if you are ambitious, and it would be helpful to have a hat/umbrella, sunscreen and a lot of water. It is really worth it to take your time and see all you can manage to see. I strongly recommend a guide to make the best out of the visit.There are some elephant rides in the vicinity as well, if that attracts you.I simply loved the carvings and the legends in this complex.

An Incredible Ancient City - bursting with must see ruins!. Angkor Thom is the ancient city a few miles from the huge temple of Angkor Wat. Within the city limits there are many temples and other ruins to see and explore. My favorite was Bayon - the large temple complex that features 100's of huge carved Buddha heads peering down from every angle. Be sure to see the impressive carved murals on the walls. The Terrace of the Leper King and the Elephant Terrace also have amazing carvings with elephants, Gods and Demons galore. Two of the gates to Angkor Thom have causeways that are lined with statues of Gods on one side and Demons on the other - truly stunning to see and to walk along and pass through the gates. Many of these statues are in advanced stages of decay, but some have been restored. This is a must visit archeological site if visiting the area of Siem Reap. One could spend days here exploring all the nooks and crannies. Take lots of water, wear a hat, and dress appropriately as this is a sacred site. We took a sunset cruise on the moat. The view was magnificent and very peaceful - and the gin and tonics didn't hurt!

Great Continuation after Angkor Wat. Right after the visit to Angkor Wat, a short tuk tuk or car ride up north will bring you to the greater Angkor Thom area. Here you have a few ancient ruins for exploration.Recommended for mainstream tourist will be the Bayon temple (last temple to be built according to guides; also the one with most smiling faces and towers), Baphuon, Elephant Terrance and the Terrace of the Lepar King.Whole walk around the Angkor Thom area could easily take up 4-5hrs if you include the other smaller sites.
Beautiful Ancient Ruins. These ruins are a continuing work in progress that tells the story of Ancient Civilizations that you may visualize through it structures.

Loved it . Stunning place to visit, with many different temples to see, Angkor Thom is a vast area to visit so you need at least half day to explore.A true wonder of the world a must see when I'm Cambodia.
Great!. Take the long route to avoid most of the other tourists, plus you get to see more of the walls. Especially good in the late afternoon when the sun filters through the trees.

History, Culture and Religion. One of the best place visited in my travel history. Great scenes, Culture and divine feeling. If you can't visit Angkor while in Cambodia then You have not seen Cambodia.
Wow. Awesome and inspiring. Make sure you take water. Als please respect the quiet requet, the clothes requirement and no smoking.

Big complex. You could wander around here for days if you were so inclined. There's a lot to see and many parts to explore. My biggest advice is to stay hydrated and bring plenty of water. There are no vendors allowed inside the complex. It's beautiful and amazing.

Incredible history. A must-see. The complex contains so many temples, all of which are exquisite.
There are a lot of locals hanging around the ruins who try to befriend you, gamely show some spots to take a nice photograph, then ask for a huge 'donation' after. Hawkers are relentless, too. But still, a very wonderful site to visit.

An must for your itenary while in Siem Reap.. To be honest both my daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed the exploration of Angor Thom. Our tuk tuk driver dropped us at Bayon and the crowds were not there. Many may have been put off by the afternoon downpour but that didnt deter us. What a huge temple precinct . So many areas to explore within Angkor Thom. All of which were different . The 54 towers with 216 heads at Bayon, 3000000 pieces of stone replaced at Baphoun, the wide open forest areas and the pools. It was different to AngkorWat in a more adventorous way as climbing and navigating were part of the experience. Great photo opportunities and really hpurs could be spent here.

A spectacular complex of temples!. Angkor Thom actually refers to an extensive area which includes the spectacular temples of the Bayon, the Baphuon, Phimeneakas, the Temple of the Leper King and the Elephant Terrace among others. Try to get a good guide and brush up on the history of these structures to fully appreciate. It's just awesome to imagine those temples in the past like Baphuon with its bronze roofs and Phimeneakas with its golden tops. Also, I recommend the gondola ride on the angkor thom moat. It's very relaxing to float along the manmade canal that used to hold crocodiles.
Worth seeing. There are more temples in the anchient city of Angkor Wat than one has time to visit, Ankor Thom is one a traveller should not miss.It has something mysterious about it. Don't miss!
History and more history. Very amazing, and worth the visit. Just as good as Angkor Wat. Great photography opportunities.Didn't like the children begging, and trying to sell you postcards.
A look into Angkor History. Bayon is amazing. Suggest renting a tuk tuk to drive you around the various temples for a quick tour.
A must see. The imposing South Gate and statues are incredible, another stop one should take their time to enjoy.
fantastic. Another of the fantastic temples just north of Siem Reap, a must see on your temple tour, some great views from the top

Great history. Amazing place to visit, well worth getting a guide, our hotel arranged one for us who travelled with us but gave us the story and history of the Angkor sites and even knew where to take some of the best photos.
Beautiful everywhere. Everywhere you look, you see these magnificent humongous faces. We had a great time taking pictures and the guides have a wonderful way of taking great shots!

Certainly a world wonder!. What a wonderful, well kept temple, words can not give justice or honour the place of such significance, one could spend days here exploring, go early of late afternoon as tour buses can be some what overwhelming, pushing and shoving

A must. this is a must if you visit Siem Reap . breathtaking and spectacular. make sure you bring your camera . I would advise attend early in the am . An afternoon visit can be very hot there doesn't seem to be much breeze . Bring water as you will have a lot of walking . If you want you can bring snacks or fruit and feed the monkeys outside of the temple . ..

Wow!!!!. Upon walking up to Angkor Thom I was just amazed by the huge structures on each side of the walkway leading up to its entrance. The city is huge and filled with so much history it is a must see when in Siem Reap. I am not a tour guide and I don't want to give too much information out but what I can say it's truly worth it to get a guide and see this ancient city. Getting a tour guide is well worth it rather than exploring not knowing anything about its history!!!!
less perfect, more authentic?. One of the many temples worth a visit if you have time - less perfect, more authentic? And part of the water irrigation system.
Huge. If you think Angkor Wat is beautiful, wait till you come to Angkor Thom. It is really big and the scale of it is overwhelming.
Popular plaqce to visit. Angkor Thom is a very popular historical site to visit, how beautiful it would have been in it's time
Brilliant. Fantastic amazing place... The ruins are absolutely mind blowing.. Our tour guide was also great..".......................................................
The king who smiled. Definitely worth a visit for the beautiful setting. The entrance is stunning. The temple is smaller than ankor wat..

Gorgeous and Moving. Many tours will include several of the temple structures, and this is certainly one to make a priority. This is a sprawling and beautiful ancient structure with a strong Hindu influence. Its unique feature is numerous towers honoring the Hindu pantheon, making for great photo ops. Its reconstruction is not as far along as Angkor Wat, which provides an interesting window into this challenging process. My advice for this area is similar to what I would say for all the temple areas: dress for the intense weather, wear comfortable shoes, and hire a guide. Your clothing does not have to reflect the more modest standards of Angkor Wat.
A fascinating look into the past. It is a fantastic experience! The history behind this site is mystical and fascinating. I thoroughly recommend a tour like this.

Not to be missed. An incredible creation, hidden for so many years, it is a definite must see when visiting Cambodia. Being part of the World Heritage Site, it is best to travel with a local guide who will teach you the history behind this amazing place.

Last stop, Angkor Thom. We visited this area on tour in the evening, and shortly after entering the space, it began to pour. We were still able to walk through the hallways to see statues and sights. No one was able to climb the stairs because of safety concerns. Still amazing.
So peaceful. Thom is a stunning section of the Angkor Wat complex. Make sure to bring water and a hat- it's stunningly hot in the summer.
Part of the Angkor Complex. This magnificent temple forms part of the Angkor Complex. What never ceased to amaze us was how these huge temples were constructed with no mechanical equipment or CAD!

Avoid weekends. You could easily spend a day here if you want to see everything. Don't just see Bayon, have a look at the other smaller sites, you will be away from the crowds. Go in the weekdays to avoid the crowds.

Breathtaking. Neighbouring Angkor Wat is better known and more fully restored, but Angkor Thom is much bigger, much quieter and more atmospheric. Angkor Wat tends to be a bit overwhelmed by the sheer number of people who visit it. Angkor Thom can accommodate large numbers of visitors but still retain quiet corners and lots of little surprises and delights. Parts of it have been over run by jungle and you come across ancient walls with trees coming through them. It is truly one of the wonders of the world. Go early to see it at its most atmospheric.

Amazing and incredible !. Just amazing! We bought a guide book that showed what the ruins probably looked like in their original glory and this rally brought the temples of Angkor Thom and Wat, to life. Also really helpful to have a knowledgeable guide for the day.
Love Angkor. One of the most amazing places I have visited. So much history in Angkor. Remember to take lots of water when you go
Unforgettable experience. Do not miss this beauty. Climb all those steps and enjoy the view from the top. Take plenty of water and wear sensible shoes! Also don't forget an umbrella, instant shade!
Big and wonderfully interesting. All the temples were wonderful but Thom to me was the most interesting with all the section, nooks and crannies great photography option. Amazing!
Photographer's dream. My favorite spot in Cambodia. Loved this even better than Angkor Watt. Statues are incredible. So many place to photograph. I was in heaven.
Awesome monument. Nice sculptures. Lots of drawings on the wall. Many chambers to explore. Hire a guide for better understanding.

Facinating, well worth the visit. We visited on the first day with a guide. The area is incredible for what is there, and the imagination of what it was like when it was being used on a daily basis. The "ruins" are wonderful to walk around, on and thru. The trees/roots are fascinating and certainly remind one of the movies. Plan on at least an hour to view this one location.

Don't go Friday, Saturday, Sunday. This is the temple made famous by the movie, Tomb Raider. It is really amazing to see the trees growing over this temple, it's really something to see. It is not spread out like many of the other temples, it's more contained and has lots of pokey little corridors and doorways. Because of this, when it is crowded it's much harder to make your way through easily because of all the tourists. My suggestion is to make sure you go here on a week day when there are less people so you can enjoy it more. There is an influx of tourists from Vietnam and other nearby countries on weekend visits, so there are more people visiting on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. If you visit on a Monday to Thursday, you are more likely to have a relaxed visit, and less likely to be pushed and shoved by the crowds.
Time to stand and stare. You would need more than a day to see the full glory of this place. Pace yourself and drink plenty of water, its well worth it.
Monkeys everywhere!. Quieter here than the other temples, I think we beat most of the crowd who were still over at Angkor Wat. Monkeys in the trees were cool.

Great story to hear, great sight to see. This was the first temple we visited during our 2-day tour. Some parts of it were being renovated when we visited but despite that it still was a great visit. The walls were filled with carved stories of how people lived their lives then, from day-to-day activities to battles.

Do Visit. With so many ethereal and other worldly temples in Siem Reap it's hard to decide which to visit, but this one is worth the time. After wandering through the corridors and being stunned by the artistry, go ahead and be silly and touch your nose to one of the 216 exquisite Bayon faces.

Worth The Walking. We had the privilege of the personal history of our guide. He grew up on the grounds of these temples. Walking on the very soil of such conflict..... There are still land minds off the beaten paths. Be prepared to walk a lot. Bring plenty of water. Soooo worth it! Now I want to learn more.

Peaceful and Quiet. Angkor Thom is one of the most peaceful temple architectures in Angkor. It gives one the chance of outstanding photo ops and at different times of the day, you can come back with a different shot. Not to be missed!
Best Angkor thom temple. The best view of the temple in Siem Reap. Feel fresh with the transitional temple of Cambodian longman who built the temple.

Big Tour keep your batteries charged.. I love to walk around siem reap city. But during hot and sunny day, i suggest that you should hire a tuk tuk or a private car. The only thing I was not comfortable with is the dusty atmosphere. So i just use a dusk mask to protect myself. Other than that, the temples were extraordinarily built with 5 gate entrance to angkor thom. Guys don't forget to take a picture with Victory Gate. I most famous temple I visited during my trip, Bayon, Ta Prohm, Banteay Kdei, Preah Khan and Phnom Bakheng (best for sunset)

Another beauty of Siem Reap. Not too far from Angkor Wat, Angkor Thom is definitely worth visiting. The archaeological value of this building is vast and it is actually larger than angkor wat! There are several temples around Angkor Thom, within walking distance! A must visit in Siem Reap!
Another spectacular temple. Best seen in the early morning before the tour operators start dumping their bus loads of family and group travelers.

Magnificent!. Who wouldn't be awed with the ruins of Angkor Thom? The place is magnificently beautiful! It was hot and dusty when I went there this June, so be prepared. Be sure to have your umbrella, sunscreen, and water to rehydrate yourself while walking and exploring the place. Read a little bit about Angkor Thom before going there so that you will know what to expect and what to see. One day is not enough! If you wanna see the park and savor the place and if your time permits, get the 3-day pass at USD 40. The best time to go there is in the early morning. During midday, a lot of noisy tourists (ie Koreans) flock the temples. ✌Enjoy and take a lot of pictures!

Massive complex of sites to see. A short journey from the main Angkor Wat complex but equally worth the visit with spectacular carved screens depicting its ancient past .An active archeology site giving an insight into the painstaking work which has gone on for many years .

Loved this one as much as Angkor Wat. We really liked Angkor Thom as much as Angkor Wat. This was for a large part because the excellent guide we had here, who told us all about the history, plus the beautiful faces on the temples, which are very photogenic
Very nice temple. We liked this one more than Angkor Wat. Less people and more impressive building. Also the Elephant Terrance is amazing.

Amazing ruins of Ancient City. Angkor Thom contain ruins from an ancient city constructed approximately 800 years ago in Cambodia. One of its gates was used for a scene in Tomb Raider movie with Angelina Jolie. The ancient architectural and construction of this city is amazing and hard to imagine.

Massive Smiling Faces that Gaze Into the DIstance. I might have liked this one better than Angkor Wat - is that wrong to say?. It is mysterious, evocative and beautiful. Massive four sided towers with huge stone Buddha faces staring out from each side. It is like a real life video game. You can scramble around the ruins in a couple of hours so you don't need to budget a huge amount of time for this one and it is only about ten minutes drive in the park from Angkor Wat (although we stopped at a couple of other temples along the way so took longer) You need to use your Angkor Wat ticket to be able to get in.

One of the three we saw on the day we were there. All the temples we visited were so interesting. This one had a large group of young Buddhist there and my students got a picture with them. They were tourist too and were enjoying the temple as much as we were.

as, solna. One of these monuments you just have to visit, one example of this marvellous templ e area.when walking around the temple and finding nature trying to overcome the temple and civilization ,you remeber that you are mortal .

early morning visit just after sunrise is good. we visited these temples early morning, after watching sunrise at Angkor wat. The entrance to the temple with snake shapes was amazing.It helps to have a good guide who can speak the language you understand. We had hired a certified English speaking guide, but I noticed there were others who could speak- mandarin, Japanese, malay, Korean etc. it is better to hire certified guide and there is heavy fine for hiring illegal guides.

My top temple site;. Large, interesting and tree cover for heat. Variety from one temple to another, and near related sites, and we were casual observers over a week but use this site for your companion not thinking of doing more than a day at temples; I think they will do a second day of temples though.

The Great Soul Tree. The Soul Tree, that grow through the bricks of great historical building tell ,how's the nature are more stronger then the history its self. building are ruin but some of the trees are stand still, all this years. just a great soul tree.
Must be on the to do list. If in Siem Reap this is one of the must do visits. Just a great place, lots to see and explore - what has been achieved here is amazing.
city of temples. this is a very huge complex. Bring van umbrella to protect you from the sun or from the rain as it is an open space. Nothing to shelter from when it rains.

Must visit place.... I would say, if you come to Siem Reap and you don't come to Angkor Thom, then what else u can do. Me and my friend had a great time visiting those historical place but the weather was killing us. Make sure you bring your camera with you to capture those unique historical building.

Historical architecutre. A must see place in Siam Reap. The entire structure is a temple but no prayers being carried out now. One has to walk a distance to enter the temple area. Temperature could be very hot during summer season so bring along umbrella or sunshade to stand the heat.
Awe inspiring. For me, Angkor Thom is far more impressive than Angkor Wat. The scale of what the builders accomplished here is incredible. Will definitely return.
Amazing. This is an incredible place....to think that so many hundreds of years ago they built it with so much design & style. Certainly worth a visit!

Taking a step back in time. It's colossal, absolutely breath taking - however, if you haven't visited other temples in Asia suggest you do, before coming out to Angkor wat. After you have visited this place, the other temples pale in comparison.

Bring an Umbrella. Just like Angkor Wat, this is a very huge complex. Bring van umbrella to protect you from the sun or from the rain as it is an open space. Nothing to shelter from when it rains. Can be explored DIY but better if you hire a tour guide if you need to know the story behind. I prefer to hire a van than a tuktuk as most van tours provide cold bottled water and a wet towel. It is indeed refreshing after a very tiring tour of this huge complex.
Thom = big. This set of ruins is quite different from Angkor Wat. It is helpful to go to both sites to have a better understanding of the changes that took place over time.

Do not miss this.. Angkor Thom and The Bayon Temple must be visited. I would allocate a full day here, as there is so much to see. The gates, the enigmatic faces,the carvings, the terraces - all magnificent, and this short review can not attempt to do justice to this wonderful place. Please vist, and be overawed yet again by the wonders of Angkor.
Beautiful temple. I could not even feel to leave this temple because when I first step in it I feel like I was in 1000 years ago in the great history.
Good one. In total there are alot of place to see in this area and the most beautiful one is Bayond temple that everyone would love to see
Big city. Hard to imagine how people lived around here years ago, where did they go to get supplies, food... We like those big trees, the surrounding green, till water in the river.

Huge walled temple area. The largest and area of the temples, this is a large walled temple with massive gates and elephant carvings on the gates. In style with that elephant rides are outside the South gate. They looked well cared for and you can buy bananas and feed them after your ride. Fun!

Amazing thing to see in Cambodia!. Trust me, want to see awesome temple and amazing trip on earth,
Siem Reap of Cambodia is the best one that you just can't miss.

Well worth a visit. The feat of engineering to just build these places must have been enormous never mind that once the stones are in place they then needed carving. You cannot go to Cambodia and not visit at least a few of these temples so if you do then include this one on your itinerary

Really Incredible. Not to be missed!
We rode our bikes to the temple which allowed us to get to it rather quickly. It was less crowded than Angkor Wat but just as amazing.
Amazing and unusual. I would advise everyone visiting Angkor Wat to make this an essential visit - we loved the carved stone faces and the general atmosphere of this place. Do not miss it!

Trek, tuk tuk or air con car Angkor Thom is a must do.. Everyone starts out at the south gate of Angkor Thom to admire the immense representation of the Churning of the Ocean of Milk. From here you go through the gate and proceed to the ancient Capitol and view the Terrace of the Leper King, Terrace of the Elephants where you can imagine watching public ceremonies of the Khymer Empire happening before you. Fantastic carvings on a vast scale. Around this area are several buildings which are not generally viewed by the public as they rush off to Bayon or Ta Prohm. Angkor Thom can be hot and tiring as you are out in the open with no shade. Water, hat are essential items. To get back to your vehicle you will encounter a bevy of traders trying to sell you every tourist item that they think will complete your holiday. They can be persistent in trying to wear you down but a polite no repeated several times will get you through it.

Unforgettable!. This site is HUGE! Be sure to start through the middle corridor and follow the stairs upward, where you continue climbing to the highest point in the Wat and can see all around the site. CAUTION: You may or may not want the local 'tour guides' who loiter around in the nooks of the temple, but they most certainly are professionals at sucking you in. If someone is trying to take you around for 'free', telling you they are students and stay in the temple, if you aren't assertive with them you may find yourself paying them up to $40 upon completion. . I got out of this snare, but gave the guy a few dollars for merit-sake.
Another amazing site. Amazing ancient capital city with several ruins to see. The bridge with the carved heads, the Elephant Terrace and Baphon are all interesting.
Must see place. Loved the huge cravings on both sides going into the plsce. Amazing work in the temple. How did they do it without moderrn equipment and machinery. Mind boggling stuff. Must see.

Worth visiting in spite of the heat. We traveled on our won without a tour. But it was very easy anyway. The tuk tuk service is very good, the driver always know where to take you first or you can choose your own route. We didn't make it a 4 am ride, so we didn't see the sun rise, but the sunset was great too. Yes, a bit too hot, so don't forget to cover your head and have water with you.
More temples. You come here to see the complexes and temples, don't miss these as well. Like all temples there in a ruined state but still magnificent.

Fabulous. The whole complex is well worthy of a half day visit (and perhaps longer if not for the relentless heat at this time of year). Wear sensible shoes, respectful clothing, a decent sunhat, and take plenty of water and explore the many aspects and structures of this amazing place.

Not as grand, but just as impressive. Although not as grandiose and intact as its Angkor Wat cousin, Amhkor Thom is no less mysterious, engaging and filled with wonders at every turn, from massive towers in the shape of Buddha, to beautiful carvings on every stone. Not to be missed.
Monster Within. Amazed by the power of nature trying on one hand to destroy and on the other to keep alive the history of this temple. An internal fight that there is no winner!

History with a lot of steps. Dress comfortably and cooly as visiting this complex is best at midday too. The light opens up better during the high sun and there are far less crowds. Careful on the steps.

Beautiful. Went here early in the morning after sunrise and seeing Angkor Wat. Surprisingly not too crowded. Don't miss the Elephant Terrace! Also, make sure you're wearing good shoes as those steps get real steep!

Full of Historical story. This is the destination that you can't be missed. It's full of cultural and history of the Cambodian. Require lot of walking up & down & sometimes with steep route, so sneakers or any comfortable shoes are recommended.

Amazing. We entered through the Southern Gate of Angkor Thom and were amazed at the size of the temple. The carvings are so detailed and tell a story of what was happening at the time. You can easily spend the day looking at these carvings but there are so many temples you either need to decide to look at most in the one day pass $20 US or get a 3 day pass and take your time. Tuk Tuks are readily available to take you out there and bring you back. There's also lots of street vendors selling cold drinks and food.
Whoa!. I have never seen so many faces on an ancient monument. It was also so cool to see the elephant tours and the neighboring monkeys being part of the surrounding area.

The capital of the Angkor Empire. The Angkor ruins are huge and its capital city is called Angkor Thom. This is the gateway to the most advanced civilization at its time featuring a Four-faced Buddha at its peak. You might recognize this as one of the scenes in Lara Croft: Tomb Raider.The walkway back in time. Feeling eerily ancient as I walked into Angkor Thom via the South Gate. Lining the causeway leading up to the gates of Angkor Thom are Deva statues holding back a Naga Raja. These devas protect the path into the ancient Khmer city, surrounded by a moat. All entrances on each axis leads directly to Bayon at the centre of Angkor Thom. I guess as they say in Khmer, “all roads lead to Bayon.”Angkor Thom’s walled city contains many temples to visit. Bayon at the centre, the Terrace of the Elephants, The Leper King’s, the Royal Palace. You’ll gonna need lots of time for that.All Khmer roads lead to Bayon. That is true within the capital city of the Khmer Empire, Angkor Thom and at its heart is Bayon. The last temple to be built in Angkor before the fall of the Khmer empire, its distinctive characteristics is the four-sided stone faces adorning the towers. The feeling I get when I venture into the temple compound is like entering a maze city. It’s small and compact within, and the twist and turns do make you feel like Indiana Jones excavating your next adventure.Ascending to its summit, I found that Bayon seem compact, claustrophobic even. It doesn’t have the wide spaces such as Angkor Wat, and it’s also a smaller temple compared to its more famed brethren. But there are more hidden corners, unknown pathways, dark hallways that make the experience somewhat more thrilling. Almost as if you’re exploring a road less travelled.
Wonderful. It is a great old Capital of Khmer empire. This temple contained many faces on the towels. The wall of the temple was big with all the stones.
unbelievable. We visited this site and I must say we were complely blowb away. It is facinating to see the temple being restored to its former glory.

Another beautiful part of Angkor Wat . Another beautiful part of Angkor Wat the whole site is just fantastic and beautiful the only downfall is being constantly harassed to buy crap at crazy prices by the sellers that surround every temple

Ancient city. Angkor Thom is actually an ancient city, and there are a number of temples within Angkor Thom, the most famous is Angkor Wat. A fascinating day exploring this area. Start early if you are visiting in the summer.
Beautiful!. An absolute must see! More people know the name Angkor Wat but this was just as incredible. We wandered around taking pictures for an hour!

Not to be confused with Ta Phrom!. Angkor Thom is part of the Royal Palace section of the Angkor Temples, a short Tuktuk ride from the iconic Angkor Wat,(the one featured on the Cambodian flag) and in the same complex as the Bayon buildings (the ones with the Faces). Part of Angkor Thom is the Terrace of the Elephants carved frieze, which the day we were visiting was completely free of sight-seers, which totally baffled us! (There were people walking on the Royal Ceremonial Platform above it, but noone but us taking photos of the famous Elephants)If you are looking to see the Temple that has the trees growing through it, you need to go a further few minutes drive away to Ta Phrom. This, too, is fabulous. The best way to get around all the temples is to get a decent map, and hire a Tuktuk for the day. Not too expensive, and the drivers will take you where you want to go, once you've done your research properly!

Cambodia's Ancient History. Marvelled at the skill of an ancient race and the longevity of the complex. Amazing that it has survived the elements, wars and probable pillage. Guides highly informative. Buffs of history and architecture could spend many days here

A Khmer beauty.. An outstanding attraction, of world-wide fame, this building harks back to the days of the Khmer Empire, which covered large parts of modern day Vietnam, Laos, Thailand and even down to Borobodur in Indonesia. An eye-opener for the many visitors daily.
Beautiful!. So beautiful! I wish it wasn't so crowded though. Come early in the morning for the sunrise. It's worth it!

Beautiful structures. Not to be missed. The gates entering the grounds are beautiful as are the temples with the trees growing on the roofs. The structures are beautiful. It is an extremely pleasant walk through the grounds.

loved it the most of all. i have seen three temples, bayon, angkor wat and this one. this was the most beautiful for me and i have the nicest memories out of all. from the moment you come close, to the exit, you see sponge trees totally occupying the walls of the temple, growing inside, around, all over the place. and, the trees are really spongy :) the only part of the temple that i dislaked (but, still have the photo of it - when in rome... ) is the one where angelina took that shoot for the movie. the specific tree is really a true representative of its kind and it is, indeed, one of the most beautiful spots in the temple. as for any of the temples, on the ways in and out there are markets, and some stuff can be found cheap, but still, it is the same all over the place. we did, however, took some coconuts and it was a fantastic and refreshing experience. i very, very wormly recomend visiting thom :)

Spectacular. An amazing visit to a place that has a history that is hard to comprehend in its age. So sad that many heads of gods and demons were cut off and taken by the French when they left the county many years ago, they are now in the French museums. I think its time that all artefacts be returned to Cambodia as they are rightfully theres. give yourself a day to roam around Anghor Thom.

Angkor Thom is perhaps the best of all. Bayon is a great temple, despite its state of disrepair. I and many others prefer the bas reliefs here to those at Angkor Wat and the gates and other sites of this Khmer city always impress. Not to be missed.
Trip of a lifetime. Seeing the immensity and antiquity of the whole temple complex in Siem Reep was a never to be forgotten experience.

Special. The whole park was a great experience and this temple was part of that experience. It pays to go early to avoid the mid day jams but if you do the sunrise at Angkor Wat the everywhere can be seen early! Take plenty of water and good footwear and take the time to wander around and soak up the atmosphere of this very special place.
Architectural Wonderland. One has to imagine the logistics that went into building a establishing these Temples - how advanced these civilizations were - way ahead of the times.
it's ok but not much to see. the highlight of the site are the sponge trees and how the grew over the temple and through the rocks.
A must see. An ancient city built in a perfect square. Nice moat to protect it. Most of the structure still standing.

Angkor Thom. A place to visit when your in Siem Reap. Our group of seven hired a private tour guide called Lucky, if it wasn't for him we would not know about the different cultures/religions that made up all the temples in this regent. Take plenty of water with you!

Extraordinary history.. It is an amazing example of what time can do with nature taking back over the stone walls. One can only imagine the blood, sweat and tears that has gone into building this city.

Unbelievable. I just could not believe how wonderful this place appeared as we approached early in the morning. It is magical and atmospheric. The building is amazing and incredible. To think that this was built so long ago and is still standing in amazingly good order. Sensible shoes recommended.

As good as Angkor Wat. This was really nice as well. The South and North Entrances have good spots for pictures. This is the temple with the large faces with large lips. Angkor has these faces as trade marks, you cannot forget to take a picture close to one, it can be your Facebook profile picture.
You cannot miss this temple...

Another amazing site. As with all the other temples it is incredible.
You get a true sense of the past.
As always it gets busy so either try early or later in the day.

Incredible but be able to walk on rough paths. This second set of sites is marvelous. It is everything the guide books say. We went during a series of very hot days which caused us to cut our visits short each day. Go during the cooler season event though it will be even more crowded
What an entrance!!!. the entrance to Angkor Thom is amazing... each temple has its own beauty about them... i loved them all :-) have fun!!!
Totally different experience!!!. We enjoyed the contrasts between the main sites. The structures at Thom were very different and the whole place had a different vibe.
Breathtaking temple. Really interesting place. Thought better than Ankor Wat as had more features. Must have a guide as knows all the best photo opportunities.

Angkor Thom with its central Bayon temple. Spend a day discovering the temples of Siem Reap. Explore Angkor Thom with its central Bayon temple and Terrace of the Elephants. See the tiered Phimeanakas Hindu temple, and marvel at Angkor Wat, one of the most striking historical sites in the world.

Huge. The Angkor Thom complex is huge. The Bayon temple is at the center (Bayon means center) and there are plenty of places to see while in this complex. Overall, this was the best temple area of our trip and we would highly recommend this one!

Impressive Smiling Face of Bhuddha. The gate of Angkor Thom is so impressive. The smiling face made me feel great. I left all worry behind. It was wonderful that I and my family had visit here. I recommend to have it in a top 30 things to do in Siemens Reap!
Impressive!. This temple is different from the others. Because there were lot of giant tree covered on the temple. This is amazing! How can the giant tree can be survived so many years!

Historic Ancient Temple. Wonderful visit to Angkor Thom Temples.
Extraordinary wall carvings. Amazing gigantic roots of trees entwined in the walls. Well worth a visit. Be warned - bring plenty water.
FACES EVERYWHERE. Thoroughly enjoyed all the different (but same) faces. It's an intriguing face with lots of variations. Enjoyed it more than Angkor Wat.

Very Nice. Have just got back from Angkor Thom, enjoyed it but I think we're getting a little templed out now. The elephant terrace wasn't quite what I had hoped to be honest. There is a food place just behind the terrace where we stopped for lunch as we were starving. We were cautious of eating at such a place but it turned out to be very good if not a little expensive by Cambodian standards. The fried spring rolls were hand made fresh right then and there and were excellent.

Opulence of architecture. I would recommend an entire day at the Angkor Thom considering the sheer size of the complex. Plenty of walking is required to explore the complexes with temples and terraces. An umbrella and plenty of water is essential.
Breathtaking!. Words fail me - and I am seldom at a loss for words. See it for yourself. You will not be disappointed - the history, the grandeur, the scale.
Cool ruins. Also an interesting temple to visit, many alleys to explore. This temple was not as busy as the others- Ta Prom, Angkor Wat and Bayon

My Highlight of Siem Reap. Don't get me wrong. Angkor Wat was incredible. However, Angkor Thom will hold you spellbound. The 260 faces of the temple stare at you and captivate you. Make sure you are cool and rested before attending Angkor Thom. It deserves your full attention!
Temples. Another of the must see on the list in Siem Reap. There are so many temples in the Angkor Wat compounds but this is one you should not miss.

#3 on my list of must see at Siem Reap.. Nice Temple with the towers with faces. Definitely a must see. The number of temples in this areas is amazing. It is hard to imagine the labor that it would have taken to build them. And the planning and engineering is incredible.

Mightily impressive. Whilst the temple is awe inspiring, it doesn't quite live up to my expectations. There are lots of areas currently off limits, but having said that it is well worth seeing as a world heritage site.

Gigantic sites, impressive carvings. Since i'm an early bird, I strongly enjoyed my visit due to the absence of any other tourists or any harassing vendors. Been there around 6h30-7h00 and it was quite impressive with the sun at a proper angle to reflect on the carvings and the trees surrounding! Worth it.
This is a wonderful place. A really amazing place to visit. Huge Kapok trees growing out and around these ancient temples make this place feel quite surreal. You really have to see it to believe it.
big. A must see temple , you enter and walk through , a big temple , the tuk-tuk waita at the other side where you come out , different to angkor wat ,
Enchanting!. Beautiful architecture. It is going to be a long walk, make sure you wear the most comfy attire. Hot and humid, make sure you are equipped to meet Mr. Sun

We were very impressed.. We were surprised at how much has been renovated to it's former state. The trees were incredible and because we arrived early we almost had the place to ourselves which gave a lovely atmosphere.
Favorite temple. I enjoyed this temple the best. The peaceful faces on the statutes were calming. Angkor Wat is good. Angkor Thom inspiring.

Great Place. Skip Town. Be sure to plan on taking your time here. It's one of the wonders of the world. The town however, is one nightclub after tee shirt shop after restaurant after massage parlor after tattoo studio and then more of each. It's great if you're looking to get drunk, get a tattoo and pay for a woman but otherwise, it's not a place to spend time.
What a place!!!. This was my favourite place on the whole of our trip to siam reap,awe inspiring and a must to anyone visiting siam reap
Amazing. This place is certainly worth a visit. Tiny rooms with many carving. Plant life in rocks. Mind your head and watch where you put your feet some stones can be unsteady
One of the best temple complexes in Angkor!. You will need a lot of time to explore Angkor Thom. There is so much to explore, including my favourite Angkor temple - Bayon! Truly a wonder to behold!

We Liked It Better Than Angkor Wat. We were fortunate enough to be able to spend a half day here in addition to a half day at Angkor Wat. We enjoyed Angkor Tom more. It had a lot of interesting spots in a more compact area, particularly nice since the weather was hot with high humidity. The ruins were built in the 12th century, so that age itself made them interesting. The highlight for us was Ta Prohm, known as the "Kingdom of Trees" for the way huge trees have intertwined with the temple stones. We were told they were featured in the film "Tomb Raider", which made us wish we had seen the film.

So much to see, get a three day ticket.. Ok, so this is the main site kinda, it is by far the largest and has several temples inside it, all within walking distance. The most famous one and most beautiful in my opinion is the Bayon temple at the very center. But take the time to look at the others as well. However, you might be approached by non official guides, that will basically just string you along, and at the end, ask for a donation to the teachers teaching them English, and after that, ask for a donation to themselves for guiding you around. I would also recommend seeing some of the temples outside of Angkor Thom, including Angkor Wat and Ta Prohm.
What can you say. Amazing how old this area is, get yourself a good guide and take your time take plenty of water and take it all in

Incredible. We visited Angkor Thom in the morning before visiting Angkor Wat in the afternoon. The site is incredible, but extremely crowded, hot and humid. Would definitely recommend visiting when in Siem Rep.

Comprehensive collection of temples in Siem Reap. Angkor Thom is a walled huge area with many sections with many dedicated small and large temples. It all starts at the South gate which is amazing including the bridge. Within the walls keep an eye out in the grounds for monkeys until you get to other temples like Baphoun & Bayon temple, Elephant Terrace, East & Victory gate and more. My advice is please get a Tour guide or organise a tour as it is essential to understand the history to this amazing place. We used an excellent & best english (American accent) guide- Vannak (vannakguide@gmail.com), extremely knowledged.This tour was organised thru (the best) Odyssey Indochina Tours with a air conditioned car driver and guide- knowledge of history, language, customs and area including food.

Of cause you are going here. If you are going to Angkor area you will be going to Angkor Thom, no way around it, with beautiful temples, palace, elephant terrase and big gates. Try walking between the different sights and see a bit of the jungle.
simply amazing. huge complex covered with so many ruined temples and statues.u can see the historic banyan trees.one can amazed to see the hindu architecture and culture over thr.

Amazing ruines. Angkor Thom is walking distance from Bayon Temple. When you walk through the many tall lush green trees, you suddenly see this huge temple complex, Angkor Thom.
